subtitle: Being confined to the narrow spaces and typical urban structured city homes can be quite a draining experience for a nature person
description:
Being confined to the narrow spaces and typical urban structured city homes can be quite a draining experience for a nature person. With the demanding schedule of work and family matters, one seldom gets a chance to wander away from the city to explore the beautiful landscapes of nature. What follows is a constant longing of finding ways to reconnect with nature. Perhaps, one of the best ways to do that is to transform your house into a countryside abode by adding some fine touches of nature.

Here’s a quick guide to some simply wonderful styles that will help you to create a natural ambience in your city loft without much hassles.

1) A natural living room with a beautiful wooden theme. Source 1 Source 2

This is a snapshot from Gerard Butler’s New York based home which embodies the complete essence of nature in its design and style. The living room has a ceiling with a wooden frame structure attached to it and a well-coordinated brown colour scheme that blends beautifully with the furnishings. Other objects that give this room a natural aura are the large windows, wooden chess board and artifacts and the presence of neatly gardened potted plants. This is just the ideal living room to make you feel closer to nature.

2) Instill a Natural Spa kind of atmosphere in your bathroom.

Source 1 Source 2

It is a well-known idea that having a long and relaxing bath is supposed to have therapeutic effects upon the human body. A great way to relish this experience is by simply setting up a nature friendly bathroom that is well-suited to rekindle your senses. This luxurious bathroom has a nicely laid out stone wall scheme that produces a gentle effect when merged with a subtle wooden pattern as seen in the bathtub, ceiling, doors and floor. The rustic chandelier lends a very delicate touch to this natural spa with its warm light.

    3) Go with a grey-wooden colour scheme for your kitchen.

Source 1 Source 2

This picture barely needs any description as it is quite a lovely specimen when it comes to conveying the message of ‘home meets nature’. The grey and wooden colour scheme renders an elegant appeal to this country home along with the cozy light from the hanging candle chandelier. This setting is also a picture-perfect depiction of how modern fittings like the taps and kitchen equipment go well together to create a natural kitchen look.

4) Take your dining room to the garden.

Source 1 Source 2

This is our favourite trick from the bundle of smart ideas to create that impeccable natural home. If you have a fairly spacious outdoor space or a balcony, for that matter, you can easily try this out for your home. Just move your wooden dining table outdoors and set it up alongside a stunning arrangement of potted plants and decorative lamps to build yourself a natural dining room. With this look, you can smoothly transform your standard dining room structure into a fine-dining restaurant outlet and enjoy the same experience without burning a hole in your pocket!

5) Create that heavenly natural bedroom.

Source 1 Source 2

Last but not least, let us come down to a fabulous tip for creating that natural bedroom for you. The concept is simple – Keep it casual and basic. Don’t put too many of those unnecessary furniture and décor items that do nothing but clutter up the moving space in the bedroom. This picture displays a divine and relaxing design that instills a breezy environment in your personal space. The large window makes way for enjoying those breathtaking views and also serves a good passage for the wind to maintain a healthy ventilation system. To keep the look real, this bedroom has a selective and minimal choice of furniture, that is, the bed, the wooden table and some small plants. Another advantage of having a large window in the room is that it ensures a good amount of sunshine and natural light.

These country home ideas are excellent when it comes to crafting that picture-perfect green home you have always wanted. Try out these simple steps and convert your home into a true abode of nature.
title: 5 wonderful styles to add a touch of nature to your house

subtitle: Renovating your bedroom can be an exciting experience. With the right kind of ideas and approach, you can completely transform your personal bedroom into a dream place without having to splurge extravagantly.
description:
Whether you have a huge space or a small space, it is all about making some smart changes in your room. Here’s our collection of handpicked ideas that covers some great designs and can be done without much ado!

1) Add that Bohemian touch to your bedroom! 

Source

This look is as simple as it gets. You can add a nice bohemian touch to your white bedroom with just a few additions as shown in this picture. Just drape a funky black & white printed bedcover set on your low loft bed and put in some delicate vintage sets and unique pieces like, the small decorative items near the window, black ladder and small hanging potted plants as seen in this Bohemian design.

2) Make a headboard out of salvaged wood!

Source

A perfect example of giving a complete makeover to your bedroom is by simply adding a beautiful headboard. You can make a headboard for your bed out of a chunk of salvaged wood to induce a slight hint of a rustic aura in your bedroom. This kind of worn out wooden planks can be easily found in your neighbourhood carpenter shop or even old buildings, for that matter.

3) Attach a smart and sleek desk to your bed!

Source

This is a very smart layout of redesigning your bed with an added feature of an attached table which makes great sense as it can be used as a laptop table as well as a study table. The sleek multipurpose table provides a clutter-free work-space which does not interfere with the basic relaxed environment of the bedroom. In fact, you can save a great amount of space with this slight modification in your bedroom.

4) The ideal bedroom for students

Source

Facing a space crunch in your bedroom? Then, this design arrangement is just what you need. This simple room with a wooden and white colour scheme makes a great use of space by picking just the right sized furniture. The specially built white drawers in the bed and table socket take care of the storage requirement and the soft textured white rug renders a cozy look to this room.

5) The tiniest bedroom

Source

This is undoubtedly the tiniest bedroom you will ever come across. But don’t just go by its miniscule size as it perfectly serves the purpose of any master bed. The wall in the backdrop has a rustic wooden pattern design which looks beautiful with the adjacent white walls and the standard wooden floor. The inclusion of the bed lamps is a nice touch in this design.
title: Handpicked ideas to redefine your bedroom interiors

subtitle: In the era of ever changing interior design trends, a timeless concept that is always here to stay is the brick wall theme.
description:
Trends come and go but brick walls are timeless! Be it your favourite 90s TV show ‘Friends’ or the more recent ‘How I met your mother’ you will always remember the brick wall at Central Perk where Monica, Rachel, Joey, Chandler, Phoebe and Ross used to hang out.

Source (Central Perk from the TV show ‘Friends’)

Neither can you ever forget Ted’s new apartment with the fantastic brick wall fireplace.

Source (Ted’s new apartment from the sets of ‘How I met your Mother’)

Ever thought of building your own brick wall at home? Check out our top picks of brick wall design ideas that will always leave a lasting impression on your guests.

1) A brick wall with a rustic look

 Source

One glance at this spectacular library is all it takes to impress the reader in you. The brick wall design in this scene renders a very rustic look to this elegant study cum living space.  This is a grand illustration of creating a beautiful living room with huge sized wooden book shelves with a very simple idea. In fact, the faint texture of the brick walls exudes a wonderful effect while pleasantly highlighting the full frame of this huge book rack.  Besides the lush storage space, the red sofa in the centre makes this the favourite spot for lounging.

Don’t have room for a huge library? Here’s another way for you to try out this brilliant brick wall at home!

Source

2) A striking combination of wooden textures & an exposed brick wall design

  Source

This grey and wooden kitchen has a very neat layout with a fine incorporation of an exposed brick wall design reflecting an exquisite taste. The dim lights underneath the shelves bring out the grandeur of the brick area and add a cozy touch to this kitchen. In fact, this is a perfect way to play with a striking combination of wooden textures and an exposed brick wall design. The final look is very original and a true depiction of modern kitchen interiors.

3) That perfect cozy nook

 Source

Want to create that perfectly cozy nook by your window? Then, this idea is just for you! Look at how this simple brick wall near your window side can be used to render a warm and comfy look. Just hang up a string of yellow bulbs over the brick wall and feel the sheer bliss of the ambience at night. This is the subtle magic of exposed brick walls that add a raw charm to your interiors with just a tad of creativity.

Here’s another example of how an exposed brick wall can transform the entire look of a simple space.

 Source

4) Different colour schemes in brick wall design

Source

Besides the raw appeal of the natural shade of bricks, you can also experiment with various colour schemes. Each colour scheme has a charm of its own and that makes it a perfect reason to try out brick patterns all the more.  This stylish exposed white brick wall adds a lively touch to this simple bedroom space and it goes perfectly well with the white ceiling of the room. The animal print pillows and hanging lights are a great pick of décor items for this setting.

Similarly, you can also try out an all grey brick wall pattern in your living room. The living room below has a stunning grey brick wall that acts as an elegant backdrop to the light grey couch and other furnishings. Here’s the best part- there’s absolutely nothing dull about this colour palette!

Tip: Try to go for a lighter shade of couch or sofa set to not lose out on the individual appeal of each entity. (Light Grey in this case)

 Source

5) A smart hack - Get the brick look with a wallpaper design!

 Source

Yes, we understand that building the perfect brick wall can be quite an extravagant venture. Another way to get that raw and unfinished look of brick walls is to opt for a wallpaper design. This corridor space with a Faux Red Brick Wallpaper is a flawless execution of this idea.
title: Brick Wall Ideas to create that lasting impression!

subtitle: There is something almost surreal about the colour blue.
description:
There is something almost surreal about the colour blue. It is a colour which invokes a vast range of sensations; be it the colour of the sky, the mesmerizing shade of the ocean water, the soul touching notes of blues music, or for that matter, an abstract frame of mind. Perhaps, the most favourite attribute about this colour is its inclusive characteristic – ‘Blue is the most gender neutral colour’. No wonder, it is almost everyone’s preferred colour. Now, imagine the possibilities of experimenting with this dynamic shade in your home interiors. The choice of options will fascinate you!

1) A glossy Midnight Blue on the walls

Source

This living cum dining room is a beautiful embodiment of classy and flamboyant interior design. The bold shade of midnight blue on the walls has a lovely glossy finish which acts as a great reflective surface for light. We love the light scheme in this room which has the picture-perfect chandelier, a tall floor lamp and the small pair of wall lights. The white sofa set, décor items (especially, the wall art) and other furnishings accentuate the look of this contemporary design.

2) Experimenting with blue and white wall art

Source

An interesting way to add a dash of brightness in your house would be to try out different patterns of wall art. This wall design of blue ink spots splattered all over gives a very water colour look to it. It has quite an artistic and funky imprint which brings out a playful mood in the room.

Here’s another wall art pattern with a blue and white combination which highlights the beauty of this lovely steel lamp in this bedroom.

Source

On the other hand, this textured wallpaper design takes the whole art of experimenting with walls to a whole new level. In fact, this is an outstanding idea to try out under a monochromatic colour palette scheme. We love the huge white lamp on the top and the grey sofa set which makes this simple room stand out. 

Source 

3) A bedroom with a minimal design and white brick wall design

Source

If you are looking out for some exciting ideas for your bedroom interiors, this is just the idea for you.  Just take a look at this divine bedroom which is yet another stunning design made possible with a monochrome colour palette. This lovely blue and white interior minimal design stands out because of the marvelous brick wall painted in white. The patterned throw on the bed and white hanging light looks perfect in this setting. 

4) A study room with a vintage touch

Source

Are you someone who spends most of their time in the study room? Then, take a glance at this spectacular library. The all blue design scheme renders an inspiring ambience with a very subtle essence of the vintage era. The huge sized book shelves, the large velvet sofa bed and a handpicked collection of vintage décor items (like the small table and the wall lamps) give an extraordinary touch to this study. We also love the impeccable design of the ceiling with a blue and white pattern that flatters the look of this room.
title: The Blue Experiment: A handpicked collection of interior design ideas.

description:

subtitle: Has the plan of renovating your kitchen crossed your mind lately?
description:
Has the plan of renovating your kitchen crossed your mind lately? If so, this is just the time to reacquaint yourself with the basics of few design styles that will help you build a beautiful and functional kitchen space. Before you draft that master plan for your kitchen, it is important to consider the principal requirements of storage space, lighting arrangement, proper ventilation and a working space with easy movement. All you need is a design scheme which beautifully incorporates all these details without compromising on the style quotient of your kitchen.

Here’s an assortment of some simply stunning kitchen design ideas with the best of interiors and fittings. 

1) A kitchen with a rustic look

Source 

This is beautiful grey and white kitchen design has quite a rustic appeal about it. The choice of a subtle colour scheme and fixtures gives this kitchen a very warm look. We love the lush space of the working area which ensures easy access to every item in the room. The storage capacity of this kitchen is fantastic as there is ample amount of space in the white drawers and cabinets. For the flooring, you can either opt for a vinyl plank wood look or even an engineered hardwood appearance depending on your preference.

2) A lively open-concept kitchen

Source

If you like a dash of colours, this open-concept kitchen design will definitely inspire you with its lively ambience. We love the blend of turquoise and white in this layout. In fact, the turquoise looks quite elegant on the upper cabinets and it goes pretty well with the glossy look of the white quartz countertops. Another thing we love about this kitchen is the backsplash made out of diamond-patterned Carrara marble. Although the dining area is small, it is just perfect to enjoy some quick servings of hot meals straight out of the oven. The comfortable grey and brown chairs were just meant for this kitchen! 

3) The kitchen with the perfect spotlights.

Source

First things first, we absolutely can’t miss the amazing lighting scheme of this bright looking kitchen. Those hanging lights almost look like two spotlights that nicely illuminate the workspace over the black countertops. Besides that, the use of ceiling lights makes sure that the entire space receives just enough light at the same time. Also, this open kitchen earns full points on the right use of space and storage capacity.  The light green colour of the walls and the natural light from the windows give an airy feeling to this room. Lastly, the small dining space over the countertops is just perfect for those cozy romantic dinners.

 4) A kitchen with the pleasant assemble of natural wood and an exposed brick wall

Source

If you are a fan of those brick wall design ideas, then this kitchen is all set to win your heart for sure! This grey and white kitchen has a neat design scheme with a pleasant assemble of natural wood and an exposed brick wall pattern. In fact, the wooden-white colour scheme adds a touch of softness to this kitchen with dark grey walls.  Also, the small pair of ceiling lights does a great job in highlighting the wall shelves.

5) A kitchen with a dark theme

Source

This kitchen is a picture-perfect example of the various design possibilities that can be realized with a dark theme. The colour of the grey walls and the expresso cabinets blends wonderfully to create a kitchen reflecting an aura of panache and rich taste. Also, the cabinets built from lacquered wood have a very smooth finish.
title: Build that perfect kitchen now - 5 stunning kitchen interior ideas!

subtitle: Most of the contemporary houses have an impeccable interior design scheme going for them.
description:
Most of the contemporary houses have an impeccable interior design scheme going for them. Be it the perfect colour scheme, the wall design, an embellished false ceiling or a handpicked collection of murals and interior décor items, we invest a lot of time and effort to get that flawless look for our homes. But what about the choice of a flattering lighting scheme for your house? If you’ve got the right kind of lights in place, it can add to the charm of your interiors and enhance the appeal of your beautiful house. 

If you look around for different lighting styles, you are most likely to come across thousands of ideas. But how many of them are actually doable?  In this article, we bring you a hands-on selection of unique lighting schemes that will surely accentuate the look of your interiors.

1) That perfectly cozy nook

Source

If your living room has a dull impression about it and lacks that quintessential element of warmth, this is one simple trick that can help you fix that problem. Just put together an arrangement of soft yellow light emitting mini-bulbs, which can be held together by a decorative set of strings or golden chains that is easily available at your local store. Now, observe the quick transition of your ordinary room into that perfectly cozy nook. 

2) The magic of pattern lights

Source

This stunning bedroom is a great example of how a pattern of light can be used to add a hint of luster to a minimal design style bedroom. The best part about this layout is the clutter free appearance of the bedroom. This pattern light scheme creates an additional layer over the simple texture of this room. The hanging white light illuminates the space with its pattern lights that blend pleasantly with the mild yellow lights of the lamps hades on each side of the bed.

Here’s another brilliant idea about placing a pattern light in your living room to render a cozy ambience.

Source

3) Lit up the stairway to heaven!

Source

 If you have a spiral staircase in your house, this lighting style is just apt for you. Hang up a long, vertically arranged set of decorative light fixtures that covers the entire length of the staircase. This sort of a light scheme is sure to shoot up the elegant quotient of your fancy staircase.

4) A glam dressing table

Source

This chic dressing table has an amazing light scheme that will surely appeal to the ladies. Most of the times, we don’t pay enough attention to the kind of lights that go well with the dressing table area and end up with a poorly lit space which ultimately fails to be meet its functional purpose. This dressing table is the ultimate answer to all such complaints. We love the idea of setting up small light bulb fittings right on top of the mirror frame. This is an absolutely smart trick to try at your own home!

5) Light up your lawn party!

Source

If you are planning that long due outdoor party in the evening, look no further. This is a picture-perfect light scheme to pick up some inspirational ideas for your own lawn party. A lot of creativity has gone in to put up this striking display of lights with the use of simple and daily life items for doing up the decoration. Just get hold of some small yellow light bulbs, old glass jars, bottles, and let your imagination guide the way.
title: Light it up – Simple tricks to create that perfect light scheme

subtitle: When it comes to picking a colour for your house, one of the most important considerations is about how the shade should reflect your mood and personality.
description:
Nowadays, the most common trend is to experiment with as many colours as possible - the more, the better. Contrary to this belief, there are some amazing possibilities to be experience with a monochrome palette. This is because the concept of monochrome scheme has undergone a paradigm shift over the last few decades. Truth is one colour experimentations are here to stay!

With the very mention of a monochrome colour palette, the most common choice is experimenting with ‘white’. White is one classic colour that is timeless and magical. It signifies the quintessential elements of purity, calmness and elegance in its subtle essence.

Here are some amazing home ideas of experimenting with ‘white’ for attaining that neat look and setting your own style statement.

1) White & breezy living room

   Source

This contemporary living room is a perfect blend of elegance and tranquility that conveys a neat look with a minor play of contrast. The white colour scheme accentuates the space of the room with a simple arrangement of the white sofa set and large windows by giving it a very lively look. The room setting makes the best use of the beautiful natural light which ushers in just enough air to render a fresh appearance along with the pretty backdrop. The Silver Panton lamp on the shelf and the perky blue cushion add a fine touch of contrast to the room. Another essential feature here is the minimal use of decorative items, like the small flower vases and the wall hangings which don’t make the space look cluttered up.

2) Trust in the wooden-white combination

Source

A simple way to get the best out of white in your kitchen is to try out a mishmash of wood and white. You can never go wrong with this combination as long as you make it a point to keep the surfaces free from clutter and stock up the shelves with minimal objects and cutlery. In this set up, the decorative mugs and containers strike up a decent contrast against the rectangular white coloured brick tiles. The end result is a fabulously organized and easily accessible kitchen at your disposal. 

3) A stylish white hallway

Source

You can transform your simple hallway into a sophisticated piece by using a simple display of white frames to go with the white-coloured walls. The picture frames are stunningly put up in a creative sequence to flatter the visual appearance of the staircase. It is quite alright to experiment with frames of various sizes as long as you don’t overdo the wall. A polished layer of beige or brown coloured carpet can be placed in the area to induce just the right amount of contrast along with a small-sized hanging light. To complete the look, just place a delicate furniture item, like, the white table used in this picture and club it together with a beautiful flower vase of white roses.

4) A vintage style white bedroom

Source

This is a bedroom which takes inspiration from a vintage style vacation home. It has the heart of a typical Moroccan theme as its central component. The interior design of this room brings together an artistic collection of furniture and décor in minimal design style. The intricately constructed colour of the black arched windows brings out a classic black and white scheme which complements the black cast-iron bed and the white satin curtains. When you look at the room, you will be able to appreciate the bright light that enhances the form of the entire room. In addition to that, the use of the off-white coloured sofa and the lamp shades on either side of the bed is a fantastic technique to make use of closely related colour shades in a chic fashion. Last but not least, if you still want to add a dash of contrast, just place a bright coloured pillow right in the middle of the bed. This swell look can change your bedroom with absolutely minimum effort!

It is incredible to think of ways to play around with an all-white colour scheme. However, it is handy to note that the design strategy should include a variety of textures or patterns to prevent the scheme from looking cold and hostile.

With a little focus on the details, great results can be accomplished. Isn’t it wonderful to see the limitless possibilities of experimenting with white? Think white, think beautiful.
title: Experiment with White – Explore a whole world of possibilities!

subtitle: If you are passionate about different painting styles and love to explore the details of this art, then the versatility of Indian painting styles will astound you.
description:
The colour and design patterns involved in Indian painting styles have certain unique features which you will not find anywhere else in the world. Let’s look at some fascinating Indian painting styles that have set their mark in both the traditional and contemporary context.

1) Madhubani Painting

Madhubani Painting by Bharti Dayal

Source

The famous Madhubani paintings or Mithila paintings of Bihar are best known for their beautiful depiction of themes involving Hindu Gods and mythology, Hindu devotional stories, royal marriage of Ram and Sita, scenes of the royal court and others. The design of Madhubani paintings consists of geometrical motifs, pictures of flowers, animals, and birds that are painted with twigs, brushes, fingers, matchsticks and other tools. In these paintings, a lot of natural dyes are used and no space is left empty on the canvas.

2) Tanjore painting

Source

The Tanjore paintings of Thanjavur are one of the most traditional styles of painting and are equally appreciated for their contemporary appeal. These paintings depict the religious creations of South Indian style through the rich textures and vibrant colours. Tanjore Paintings are also called as ‘palagai padam’ in the local dialect.

3) Rajasthani Painting

Source

Rajasthani Paintings, popularly known as Rajput paintings were derived from the Persian miniature style. These paintings portray tales from the epics like Ramayana, Mahabharata, Lord Krishna, and war heroes of Rajasthan. The Colours for these paintings are created from different sources like plants, minerals, conch shells and by processing some precious stones like gold and silver.

4) Mughal painting

 Source

Mughal paintings have their origin in the era of Mughal rule in India with most of its themes depicting the events of battles, court scene, portraits, wildlife and other famous stories of that era. This art form brings together the combined essence of Indian, Persian and Islamic styles.

 5) Pattachitra

Source

Pattachitra is a beautiful art form which has its origin in the eastern region of India. It is a distinctive form of folk painting from Orissa with a strong association with Lord Jagannath. While ‘Patta’ implies ‘clothing’ and ‘chitra’ stands for ‘painting’. In this form, all the pictures are painted on a cloth base by the Chitrakars.

6) Warli Art

Source

The Warli artwork of Maharashtra is a very lively form of tribal art which reflects the daily life events, dances, festivals and other ceremonies of the Warli tribe. This painting style makes use of different shapes and designs to capture different emotions and aspects of tribal life.  Another interesting feature of this form of painting is the depiction of the cycle of death and birth.
title: Indian Painting Styles

subtitle: A quick way to change the mood of your room is to drape it up with a beautiful set of curtains.
description:
A quick way to change the mood of your room is to drape it up with a beautiful set of curtains. Gone are the days when you would just go to the market and buy those ordinary curtains for your house. It’s time to look at curtains from a fresh angle and brighten up your rooms!

Let us take you through a bunch of amazing curtain décor ideas that will inspire you to change the way you do curtains!

1) The Pompom Curtains!

Source

This simple window space with a white brick wall design looks spectacular because of the lovely set of pompom curtains. The lively look of the pompoms along the borders of these plain coloured curtains adds that stunning touch of contrast to this setting. In fact, you can dazzle up any room in your house just by adding these set of breezy curtains.

2) It’s all about the way you style it up!

Source

Just one look at the cream coloured décor scheme of this room reflects a feeling of pure elegance. The style in which this pleated curtain is draped around the window makes this space stand out. This is a very fine trick to try out in your house to get this completely dressy curtain look. Remember, the essence lies in the creative arrangement.

3) Go floral all the way!

Source

If you like a dash of colours in your room, there is a whole variety of choices open for you. To bring in the mood of spring, you can take a pick from those charming floral print curtains. A fine example of this idea is seen in this room with a monochrome colour palette. The floral prints on the curtain and cushion render a vibrant ambience to the interiors of this room.

Here’s another example of bringing in a pop of colours in your room with a dark colour scheme. The colourful pattern on the curtain, cushion cover and wall art brings out the beauty of the dark navy blue walls in this scene.  A subtle hint of contrast is rendered by the green sofa chair.

Source

4) Experiment with the order.

Source

Another interesting style to try out is to change the order of your drapes and sheers. The pink curtains in this window space looks different from the traditional arrangement that is usually done at homes. Putting the drapes behind and keeping the sheers in front gives a fancy look to this beautiful room.

5) Think beyond the windows!

Source

Who says that curtains just belong in your windows? Choose a set of light coloured net curtains and just hang them behind your bedside. The white net curtains in this bedroom lend a perfectly cozy look to this room. Deck it up with some small string lights and create that lovely romantic ambience! This is a brilliant idea to experiment with if you are bored of seeing that same old headboard in your bedroom.
title: Change the mood of your room - Dress up your Curtains!

subtitle: A design scheme which brings together the beautiful elements of contemporary and country styles.
description:
Project: Crosswinds - A Luxury villa in mountains

Designed by: A Simple Plan, Delhi

Just one glance at the neat interiors of this spectacular villa designed by ‘A Simple Plan’ will take you to the heart of the mountains to reconnect with the divine landscapes of nature. The design scheme of this project brings together the beautiful elements of contemporary and country styles without compromising on their unique attributes. In fact, there is a very  pleasant interplay of rustic and luxurious textures in the furnitures and other interior fittings. The designer has experimented with a neutral colour palette to create a soothing template that helps one unwind from the worldy blues and surrender to the meditative atmosphere of the mountaintops. Perhaps, the best thing about the design plan of this home is the smart utilization of the vast space and its extremely cozy appearance.

 

As you step inside the drawing room of this grand villa, you will definitely notice the beauty of the soft hues and natural light from the huge window space. The presence of abundant light and comfortable furniture adds an airy touch to this lush space. Another interesting feature of this room is the rustic aura rendered by the wooden ceiling and the stone finish of the floors. 

The grey and cream colour scheme of the sofa sets blends wonderfully with the choice of décor items and accessories. Apart from the inviting spaces, one simply can’t get enough of the remarkable view from the windows.

Another arrangement for sitting has been put in place in a slightly secluded corner of this country house. This is a perfect niche with a minimal design style where one could spend some peaceful moments of solitude. A delicate look is achieved because of the cane furniture and minimum use of fabrics. For the window space, the choice of traditional blinds acts as a great substitute for the ordinary curtains. 

The villa also has another cozy zone which is just right for lounging around. Again, the minimal use of textures and fabric exudes a very nonchalant vibe that makes the place look very inviting. The warm wall lights and potted plants in the room enhance its charm.

 

The dining space of this holiday home is a perfect rendezvous of elegant and rustic textures. A certain degree of flamboyance is visible in the full scale wooden theme which distinctly marks the dining area. The wall at the backdrop of the table displays a horizontal arrangement of wooden lines which blends well with the light coloured walls of the place.

One of the most striking interior structures in this villa is the beautiful display of spiral lights hanging right from the ceiling. There is a sturdy hardwood railing surrounding the entire space which reinforces the rustic touches of the design vision.

The study room of this house is built around a colossal space with a comfortable choice of furniture and fixtures.  The neutral colour palette accentuates the luster of the place which creates a gentle environment for reading. A bright coloured rug with a pattern of concentric circles induces a pleasing contrast in this design scheme. The wide spread size of the wooden book shelves can be stacked up with a huge collection of books. Also, the flooring comprises of two colours, which is yet another attention-grabbing feature of this library room. 

The flair with which this villa has been planned and constructed is a true statement of tasteful modern architecture. It is incredible to observe the finesse of a design scheme which transforms a vast expanse into an ideal holiday home with an impeccably cozy ambience.  

All picture credits: www.houzz.com
title: A Villa in the Heart of the Mountains by ‘A Simple Plan’

subtitle: Are you a wine connoisseur? Then, this is just the perfect way to set up a beautiful display of all your wine bottles and glasses arranged together.
description:
1) Something for the wine connoisseur!

 Source

You can use a fine wooden wine rack on your wall as a sturdy holder for the bottles. Isn’t it a simple trick to save up a lot of space?

2) Get creative with your staircase!

Source

We love this creative way of building a lovely storage space along the sides of a simple staircase. You can use these shelves to build a mini-library with your favourite collection of books. It can’t get better than this!

3) Use up the space right behind your bed!

Source

Another fantastic way to save some space inside your bedroom would be to use up all that the space right behind your bed. This is a superb idea of having a multi-purpose headboard which is not only beautiful but also acts as a great space to storage your stuff. There’s no need for a bedside table now!

4) Thank God for folding furniture!

Source

We love this idea using smart folding furniture fittings in tiny spaces. This arrangement of attaching a folding table desk from your wall shelf will save you a lot of space! With this simple idea, you can create a stunning and fully functional work space for yourself!

5) A simple solution for your bathroom storage hassles!

This is the ultimate solution for all your bathroom storage hassles. Use wall towel racks in your bathroom to stack up your bath linens that can be easily accessible right after you step out of the shower. Isn’t it a great way to save up on the bathroom cabinet space?

subtitle: The summer season is a perfect time to experiment with bright bohemian prints and patterns.
description:
If you like a dash of colours in your home, there is a whole range of décor options to go for!

1) From bright embroidery to contrast colours!

Source 1 Source 2

Team up your single coloured sofa chair with a bright set of embroidered cushions to create a beautiful contrast. The cushion cover with big floral patterns renders a lively look to this sitting space. The glass lamp with multi-coloured drops is an interesting addition in the décor scheme!

2) Throw in lots of bright patterned cushions & pillows in your bedroom!

Souce 1 Souce 2

A simple way to create a boho-chic bedroom is to bring in a blend of vibrant motifs through different bedroom furnishings. We love this simple bedroom layout with different types of cushions and pillows that lifts up the mood of the room.

Tip: You can also add a patterned throw on the bed to give your bedroom a flamboyant touch.

3) Don’t forget your walls!

Souce 1 Source 2

While experimenting with décor ideas, don’t forget to do up your walls! Adding colourful wall hangings, patterned mirrors and other accessories will help you create that perfect boho-chic look in your home.

subtitle: Are your old coffee mugs doing you no good now?
description:
Source

Well, here’s how you can give them an all new life. Convert these mugs into beautiful candles and give yourself a reason to celebrate! For making these attractive candles, follow these simple steps:

  1. Just paste some coffee beans on the mug using glue.
  2. Let it dry. Once it is done, melt some candle wax inside the mug and place a wick in between.
  3. Let the wax cool down for some time. Bingo! Your all new candle is ready to light up your mind, body and soul.
title: #DIY: Convert your old coffee mugs into candles

subtitle: Tired of losing your keys every now and then?
description:
Well-well, here’s the solution. We bring to you the easiest way to create a key holder in no time. So pull up your socks and get started!

Source

Things you’ll need:

  • A vintage frame.
  • A screw driver and some screws.
  • Screw hooks.

Steps:

  1. Take your frame. Mark the places where you would like to fix your screws.
  2. Then, drill the screws of the appropriate size into the frame.
  3. Once it is done, place screws in each hooks.

Bingo! You are ready with your all new key holder in no time. Hang your keys and enjoy the feel of a raw and funky key holder.
title: #DIY: Frame Key Holder

subtitle: Say no to the same old boring library shelves! This time, try something different for your house!
description:
1) The high on organization corner shelf!

Source 1 Source 2

We love this beautifully built shelf structure! This arrangement of shelves leaves a lot of room for your books, a small wall painting and other décor items. If you are high on organization, this corner shelf idea is just perfect for your house!

2) The tiny rotating shelf

Source 1 Source 2

If you have a tiny space in your house, then this is just the perfect type of shelf idea you can try out. Set on a circular base, this beautiful wooden shelf has just the right amount of space to fit in your favourite books and décor items. Fitting a rotating base for this kind of a shelf is definitely a bonus!

3) The Piano shelf

Source

This piano shelf idea is a musician’s delight! If your old piano is no more functional, just get creative with it. Just add in a few shelves to it and turn it into a masterpiece bookshelf. Alternatively, you can even build your new shelf by using the piano as a design inspiration.

4) The Tree design bookshelf

 You can build yourself a light weight shelf structure with the design of a tree to fit in the tiniest corner of your room. We love this shelf design which gives the impression of a beautiful tree spreading out its branches. Use it to stack up your favourite books and enjoy the look!

5) Experiment with the box design

Source

This shelf design is a beautiful way to experiment with simple boxes and turn them into a striking display piece in your living room. Just by playing around the design scheme by using various sized square boxes, you can build yourself a beautiful and spacious shelf.

subtitle: “Keep your head, heels and standards high.” ― Lola Stark, Tattered Love  Agree with the quote? Then, read on!
description:
1) That chic cupboard

 Source

Every girl wants to have that spacious closet with neatly aligned shelves to store all her clothes, shoes, bags and other accessories. This open and rolling rack closet is just the perfect solution to this. You can hang up your favourite clothes and use the bottom shelves for storing your bags or shoes.

Tip: You can also turn your bookshelves and stack them up with your fashion accessories!

2) Your one stop shoe solution!

Source

Lost count of the number of pairs of shoes you own? If you have more than 20 pairs of shoes, it can be quite a crazy time finding that exact pair for your daily outfits. This cool arrangement of storing your shoes is your one-stop solution for all those problems! Just split your ordinary wooden shelves into three sections by fixing some flat boards in between to create that additional room for your shoes.

3) No more messy make-up spaces!

Source

If your dressing table is cluttered up with your lipsticks, nail paints and other make up accessories, you should definitely try this. Get creative with your cupboard door and attach some tiny plastic frames to it. Now, stack them up with your makeup items and do away with the mess!

4) Mirror Mirror on the wall!

Source

If you have no room for a dressing table in your bedroom, make one by just using a simple wall mirror. We love this pretty layout of using a heart shaped mirror placed right above a simple table to create that impression of a dressing table. Just hang up a light wooden or plastic rack on the wall right next to the mirror. To finish the look, decorate the space by using some pretty photos and a string of small light bulbs.

Source
title: Girl world problems – The ultimate hacks for all your storage problems!

subtitle: A unique design where ‘cozy meets formal’ to create that perfect dream home you have always wanted.
description:
Project: Residence at G.K. II

Designed by: Plum Design

Have you been working on the idea of creating your dream home? If yes, it makes great sense to explore different design ideas to come upon a vision for your home. To take a leaf out of this plush GK II residence designed by Plum Design, a clear glimpse of an exuberant vision unfolds as soon as you step inside this apartment.

When lead designer Sangeeta Sharma from Plum Design started off the work for this 4300 square feet apartment, she was guided by this core inspiration to bring about a spectrum of natural elements in the ambience. The biggest challenge was to the create a simple, practical and cozy home reflecting the beautiful layering of materials, textures and motifs found in nature while working within the constraints of a builder apartment. This project exudes an impressive flair when it comes to making a chic statement about experimenting with contemporary interior design ideas.

This is a beautifully designed master bedroom which integrates the fine features of elegance within the ambit of urban culture. The design reflects an intelligent use of the vast room space and a great focus in coordinating the design essentials across all the furnishings and home décor items placed in this room. The colour scheme of this room has a subtle presence of earthy shades to create a picture of autumn as seen in the orange wall behind the bed and the large wooden cabinet. All the furnishings in this room, including the bed, the sofa and the tables, are custom made using lacquered wood to bring out a nice shade of autumn. The large cabinet is made out of wood and copper which gives it a great antique finish. For the wall art, a stunning floral sketch was specially designed to induce a scene of sleeping under a tree and make it cozy space. There is a LED light wash from the bed back and wooden bed back panel upholstered behind the bed to light up the artwork. The carpet was created from custom made Felt and a lovely shade of mocha champagne colour was picked for the satin curtains to suit the mood of the project. Another great addition to the furniture is the bed sofa, which has been smartly designed with a tea trolley on wheels. There is abundant natural light in this bedroom from the large window and the adjoining balcony. Also, the false ceiling and lampshades on each side of the bed renders a very cozy touch to this suave bedroom.

The walk-in closet comprises of extremely spacious wardrobes and a dressing table built from lacquered wood with stainless steel fixtures. A dash of coziness is added to this compact setting with the Can Can Pendant light. The flooring has been kept simple with the choice of Grey Williams Italian marbles.

The layout of the bathroom is also set with a similar theme of fittings and a spacious shower cubicle. Lacquered wood has been used in the mirror and towel cabinet. The stone counter near the wash basin is built in Italian marble and the cabinets are given a wooden finish.

 This living room has been planned with an autumn green leaf colour scheme with custom made sofa set and other furnishings. The leather trunk placed in the centre of the room is tailor made and can also be used as a coffee table. While, the artwork on the wall and the lacquered wood TV cabinet have been specially made to go with the flow of the design, the floor lights have been purchased off the shelf.

The other bedroom in the house has an exciting display of custom texture on the walls with a neat wooden board back design along the bedside area. Again, lacquered wood has been used for the vibrant grey and yellow closets. Another interesting thing to note here are the made-to-order chairs put together using leather and fabric. For the floors, a pattern of printed wood has been used.

The dining area arrangement has a quite roomy setting with a comfortable dining table set and a mini-bar right next to it. The wooden dining table has a textured top and groove pattern chairs. Pattern of the chairs upholstery has been incorporated in the bar counter in embossed brass. Lacquered wood with leatherite (synthetic leather) was used to construct the bar table and the imported glass lights were hung from the top to render a cozy ambience. Statuario Itlaian marble was used for the flooring.

The design scheme of the drawing room echoes with a feeling of class and fine taste. The furniture was exclusively built out of wood polish and textured wood with a grand finishing. Additionally, the set of black tables (centre table and corner tables) were made from textured wood and leather to bring in a delicate contrast in the overall setting.

For the materialization of this luxury project, an approximate amount of Rupees Two Crores were spent on the interiors and soft finishes. A rough estimate of Rupees Four Thousand works out as the Interior cost per square feet. The floor was supplied by the builder which covers a huge area of 4300 square feet.

Word from the designer: “Plum Design believes in creating clean, exuberant spaces of value, comfort and luxury. We constantly focus and inspire ourselves to create the right mood for the space within the budget, weave interior & exterior spaces seamlessly from a large space idea to a tiny detail. Our special expertise is in the area of custom created furniture and furnishings.” – Sangeeta Sharma.

All picture credits: Plum Design.
title: A posh home in town: GK II Apartment by Plum Design

subtitle: A design scheme where comfort meets luxury.
description:
Project: M House

Designed by: Kumar Moorthy & Associates, New Delhi 

A stunning glimpse of a contemporary design scheme with luxurious embellishments is the vision behind the creation of this metropolitan home. This M House project designed by Kumar Moorthy & Associates has an interplay of multifaceted décor ideas that blossom together in their grand union.

The drawing room of this house is the ultimate statement of luxury and style. Starting from the look of the walls, you will notice a sublime superimposition of the black tile look on a neutral palette. The room has a collection of modern furniture which is comfortable and luxurious at the same time. To strike up a contrast, the designer has opted for a white sofa set with a mix of colourful and plain cushions, a wooden table and bright wall art décor. The ceiling has a black and white colour scheme with a stunning display of hanging lights, ceiling lights and a central cooling system. A rustic touch is rendered by the vinyl flooring surrounded by a stone floor border. The room has a wonderful view through the wide window side which also brings in a good amount of natural light.

The dining room is built around a soothing ambience with the presence of potted plants, stone floors and just the right amount of moving space. Also, the multi-coloured pattern of the chairs and assortment of hanging lights right above the table, accentuate the beauty of this room. In the backdrop, there is a fantastic view of the outdoors and a flight of stairs that leads to the upper floor of the house.

The coziest area of this contemporary house is the living room. It has a very earthy colour palette in terms of the choice of furniture and décor items. The red sofa set adds the comfort factor to this room and makes it just the spot for lounging around while watching your favourite TV shows. At the backdrop, there is a view of the dining room.

Speaking of cozy, this nook around the kitchen area just takes the idea to the next level. This modern kitchen has a tiny dining space with a wooden table pinned to a metallic stand and two high rise stools. The ambience is just perfect for enjoying a quiet romantic dinner with your partner.

The bathroom of this house has a neutral colour palette with a smooth brown look appearing in places like the door and other areas. It has a lovely shower space with a glass door and a gorgeous pendant light hung from the ceiling. Also, the wooden countertop around the wash basin has a very smooth finish.

The design scheme of this city home includes all the fine elements of modern day comfort and luxury. Its charm is aptly depicted in its detailed interior design and fittings.

All picture credits: www.houzz.com
title: A Contemporary Metropolitan Home

subtitle: For lots of single men and women living in the metros, studio apartments always seem to be the best fit.
description:
To make up for the loss of space, there are many smart tricks to try out in these tiny apartments!

Paint your walls white

Source 1 Source 2

An instant way to make a tiny space look spacious and neat is to stick with a basic white colour. So pick a shade of white or a light cream shade for your walls and add some pops of colour through bright décor items like cushions, curtains or rugs.

Say ‘Yes’ to clutter free rooms

Source

You can save a lot of space in your apartment by making sure that you don’t pile it up with things that you won’t really use. Stick to the basic furniture fittings and keep the space clutter free.

Floating wall shelves – The smart way to store!

Source

When it comes to storage, opting for those floating wall shelves could be a great savior! You can easily stack up these shelves with all your favourite books and basic items. These shelves are not just functional but are also very accessible.

Foldable furniture or multipurpose furniture like a sofa cum bed

Source

Be smart with your choice of furniture and bring home a multipurpose item like sofa bed. This simple idea can put an end to your space troubles and make your apartment a cozy place to live in.

Another interesting way to use yellow is to team it up with grey. These two colours are almost made for each other! Yellow brings in a pop of fun in the mood whenever the grey colour seems kind of overbearing.

Here’s another superb example of playing with the ‘grey’ and ‘yellow’ colour combination!

Source

subtitle: Don’t just throw away your old wine bottles!
description:
DIY Make that shimmery glitter wine lamp!

Source

Get creative and make this glittery wine bottle lamp for your home!

Just follow these simple steps to get this done!

  1. Collect all your old wine bottles and wash them clean of all the dirt and dust.
  2. Now, carefully drill a hole around the bottom of bottles.
  3. Once that’s done, get hold of some silver or golden glitter packs (as per you preference). Neatly lay out the glitter on a large sheet of paper.
  4. Then, paint the whole bottle with glue and slowly roll it over the glitter. Repeat it until the whole surface is covered by the glitter and let it dry.
  5. Now all that’s left to do is simply put in a string of tiny yellow bulbs inside the hole and enjoy the shimmery light!
title: #DIY Make that shimmery glitter wine lamp!

subtitle: Does the thought of a reading book take you to another world? If yes, you are a true bibliophile at heart!  Check out these amazing ideas to create that perfect reading niche at your house!
description:
1) The cozy corner to sit down with a book!

Source

Get yourself a comfortable sofa chair and place it in a secluded corner of your house. Make the spot cozy by adding in an ottoman so that you can stretch and relax while reading your favourite book. You can also keep a small side table and a tall floor lamp to make sure that the spot is well lit up! 

2) The breezy reading spot by the window

Source

Nothing beats a reading corner around the window side! It is just the area where you can get a good amount of natural light and great ventilation at the same time. Just place a comfy couch or sofa chair near the window and do up the spot by going for colourful printed curtains that will give it a fresh look. You can also place your bookshelf right next to the sitting area to make it easily accessible.

3) Do it the hippie way! 

Source

Turn into a hippie during the weekends! We love this idea of using a swing chair as a reading spot. Team it up with a set of bright cushions and place a printed carpet or rug on the floor to give it a cozy look. Go for a light set of net curtains to let in just the right amount of light and fresh air.

Tip: Add in a pop of colours by going for some bright accessories like the orange lampshade in this room.

4) A smart trick for studio apartments!

Source

No room for a couch? No problem! Just place a small mattress or huge pillows on the floor and throw in a bunch of cushions to make yourself a homely reading place. Make sure that you try it out at a spot where you can use the wall as a back rest while reading. This is a must try for those living in studio apartments!

subtitle: To spend a leisurely evening in your backyard with a cup of tea and a book is certainly an affordable luxury that can be enjoyed within the realm of contemporary living
description:

Source

To build a traditional flagstone patio, it’s good to stick to building materials like bluestone, slate and fieldstone. For those special evenings, you can light up the spot with scented candles, string lights or diyas and enjoy the surreal experience of a Zen garden.

Source

Want to keep it simple and attractive at the same time? Go for a big light or lampshade and change the look of your hallway instantly! This is as simple as it gets!

subtitle: Who doesn’t like flowers? They bring in that beautiful feeling of freshness wherever you place them. Now, think about getting that floral essence into your interiors. These floral décor ideas will leave you spellbound!

Source 

One of the most artistic ways to do floral prints is to go for those classic wallpapers with beautiful colour patterns that bring out the beauty of your walls. It will not only light up a drab place but also create a vibrant ambience. 

Here’s another way to try this out.

Source 

2) That eye-catching floral décor piece!

If you want to pick that one perfect floral décor item for your house, you can blindly go for a sofa chair with floral print upholstery.  Place it near your window side or cozy nook and enjoy the charm it adds to your interiors! 

Maybe & Maybe not?

While you are at the flora-fication phase, don’t forget to include your bedroom! One of the easiest ways of getting that floral touch in your bedroom is to try out a soft floral printed bed sheet, bedcover or even, a pillow cover.

Source 

If you are good with the paint and brush, this idea is a must try for you! Just pick up your brush and paint up a pretty floral pattern on your walls bordering the entire door. This makes a very welcoming addition to a room. In fact, why not try this out in your kid’s room?

5) Floral curtains are here to stay

Source

Perhaps, this is the most traditional way of doing floral prints. Never underestimate the magic of floral curtains!

6) For those leisurely pleasures!

Source 

Doesn’t this picture take you to a whole new world of leisurely pleasures? Floral table linen looks amazing on a small dining table placed around your garden. Just the perfect way to enjoy a cup of tea in a breezy morning!

7) Why not a floral staircase?

Source

We love this idea of using floral prints to do up your staircase! Just choose different types of floral wallpaper prints and stick them along the steps. The final look is simply stunning!

8) The Bold & The Beautiful 

Source

Do you have it in you to go bold with floral prints? If yes, this idea is definitely your thing!

Another way to try out this theme in your room is with a raw brick wall look!

Source

subtitle: Hike up the style quotient of your house by trying out gorgeous stencil patterns! If you like experimenting with prints and patterns, you will love the variety that stencil designs have to offer. Besides being cost effective, the best part about a stencil
description:

This design idea not only adds life to a neutral space but also allows you to boldy experiment with intricate patterns. We love the look of walls in this room! The amazing picture arrangement beautifully flatters the look of the accent wall.

You can also opt for cushions, lampshades and other décor fittings of the same colours to accentuate the beauty of your room.

subtitle: Are you a hardcore Instagram or Pinterest user? Take your photography passion beyond your phone and try out these amazing photo frame ideas right on your walls!
description:

Source

This is a great layout to try out in a tiny portion of your bedroom wall. Get your postcard sized photographs lined up and start off with this simple arrangement to get a neat grid view. Isn’t this a wonderful way to display your snaps without having to worry about space issues at all?

Tip: You can also try the postcard style picture collage right around your work desk or over a rarely used window in your room.

Source

2) Memoirs right next to your bed!

Source

What better way to wake up than to the sight of your favourite memories right next to your bed? We love this picture collage against the bed wall. The black bird prints on the wall add a beautiful touch!

Source

This picture collage almost gives the impression of a grand exhibition. If you are a big fan of black & white photography, this wall collage display is a must try! Cover up the entire wall of your corridor space with all your greyscale snaps and just admire the final look!

4) Frame thy corners!

Source

Change the dull look of your corner space and turn it into cozy spot with a display of your cherished memories framed up against the walls. We love the warm look of this nook which has a lovely lampshade and sitting arrangement for some moments of solitude.

5) All along the stairway

Source

Here’s another fabulous idea of hanging up your picture frames to hike up the visual appeal of your house. If you have a staircase inside your house, this idea is a must try!

6) Turn on the spotlights!

 Source 

The right kind of lights can enhance the charm of your photographs. Just install some small ceiling spotlights pointed towards your photo wall and feel the difference!

7) Not just photographs! 

Source 

Get creative and think beyond the ordinary photo frames! Try out this idea of arranging your favourite photographs to get the look of a huge wall clock! Interesting, isn’t it? 

8) Why not jazz up the arrangement?

 Source

Get quirky with the way you arrange your frames! Gone are the days where you used to hang up your picture frames like a boring museum gallery.

9) For the music & tv show buffs! 

Source

So, are you totally up-to-date with Jon Snow’s fate in Game of thrones? Do you own all copies of Pink Floyd’s records? If so, you sure sound like a big fan of the entertainment world! Look at these amazing ideas to display your collection of favourite show or artist posters!

Tip: You can use string lights all around your photographs to give your walls a cozy look!

Source

Source 

If you are looking for that extra special thing for your pictures, all you got to do is experiment with the way you frame them up! Whether you buy stylish frames or you get them custom made, there are a whole lot of options. We love this idea of using a curtain rod to hang up the picture frames. The beautiful arrangement gives this wall an outstanding look!

Tip: Another interesting idea is to use steel hooks with an attached clip to hold your photographs. With this, you also have an easy option of changing the pictures whenever you want.

subtitle: So, you think that Pink is just a girly colour? Think again! Check out these wonderful ideas to add a flavour of pink in your life!
description:
1) Featured image

Source

Source

Source

If you are a fan of vintage style, then this idea is just perfect for you! Invest in a sofa with classic design elements to set the vintage tone in your room. For the walls, you can go for a floral or leaf pattern wall paper having a pink & white combination.

3) Those in between pops of Pink

Source

Not sure if a full blown out pink room is your thing? Then, this is a safe way to try out subtle hues of pink in your cushions, lampshades and other décor fittings. This simple living room with pops of salmon pink is exactly what we have in mind!

subtitle: Here’s a quick checklist of ‘what not to do’ while decorating your house. Pay attention and avoid these mistakes!
description:
1) Going wrong with contrast!

Source 

Even though playing with contrast colours is fun, you have to be very careful while picking the perfect shade to get the right look for your interiors. One slight mistake with the colour proportion and you will end up with a tacky room! The long and bright yellow pair of curtains in this living room clearly makes this point.

2) Cluttering up your room!

Source

The phrase ‘less is more’ definitely makes sense when it comes to home décor. The biggest mistake that can ruin the complete look of your beautiful house is when you clutter up your living space. It’s best to keep only the everyday essential items out for display.

3) Exposed messy wires!

Source

This is an outright rookie move! After spending a lot of time and money on your home décor, you often forget to take care of the basics. The view of exposed messy wires in the room is a quick way to kill all the hard work you had put in the decoration.

4) Matching everything

Source

A common myth about good design is that ‘you have to match everything’. A big NO to that! While it’s alright to match a few items, overplaying the same colour look in your rooms rips off the beauty and individuality of your décor fixtures.

5) Going overboard with décor!

Source

Make this mistake and you’re straight away headed for doom! Remember that class doesn’t come from having all expensive décor items put together in one place. Overdoing the decoration of your room can actually result in creating the opposite effect!

Tip: While planning to decorate your walls, avoid putting up too many frames and paintings on it. 

Source
title: The Biggest Decor Blunders that You Must Avoid!

subtitle: Going for the right colours can magnify the beauty of your house. The first step is all about making a good choice while picking colours. Check out our list of amazing colour combinations that create magic when put together!
description:

If you are into darker shades, then this colour idea is apt for your living room! Pops of teal colour brings in a sublime contrast in the intense mood created by the charcoal-grey furniture fittings. Full marks for the huge white light!

Source

When two bright colours are put together inside a room, their vibe is simply electric! That’s exactly the case when you experiment with pink and yellow. The sheer energy of these two colours can charge up the tempo of your interiors!

Tip: If you are worried about ending up with an overbearing look, then try to experiment with subtle hues of these two magnetic colours!

One look at this room and you’re sure to fall in love with the salmon and pink rose combination! This blend of colours creates an enchanting spell of coziness that can’t miss your eyes. If you look closely, you will surely appreciate the idea that furnishings can definitely make a statement!
