subtitle: Have a quick dose of fun with your shirt buttons! All you need for this simple idea is a collection of colourful buttons, a plain white lampshade, some paint and lots of glue.
description:
#DIY A quick dose of fun with your shirt buttons

Source 

Just follow these simple steps to get this done!

  • Start of by cleaning all your buttons with some soap water or detergent so that there are no dust residues on them.
  • Now, use some fabric paint and make some prints of tree branches encircling the entire lampshade area.
  • Then comes the fun part, start applying glue on one side of the buttons and keep pasting them on the lampshade. Make sure to paste the buttons at the tip of the printed branch designs so that you get the impression of a flower.
  • After you are done pasting all the buttons, all you got to do is light up your super creative lampshade!

Tip: You can also try this out with a mix of large and small sized buttons pasted all over the lampshade. This completely filled in button lampshade looks terrific with multiple shades of colours!

Source
title: #DIY A quick dose of fun with your shirt buttons

subtitle: If you like to pull off some funky fashion accessories, this Button Shoe idea is a must try for you! With this simple idea, you can hike up your style quotient in no time!
description:
DIY Hike up your style factor with these funky Button Pumps!

Found on joann.com https://www.pinterest.com/pin/240590805068241670/ 

Just follow the simple steps to get this done!

  1. Take a pair of old pumps and get them thoroughly cleaned before you do anything else. It’s actually better if you pick up a flat pair of shoes for this idea.
  2. Once you’ve got your shoes all spic and span without any tinge of dust on it, then begins the main task!
  3. Get hold of lots of colourful buttons of different sizes and start coating them with a layer of thick glue or any footwear adhesive that works well on plastic.
  4. Now, start pasting these glued buttons very carefully on top of your shoes. Make sure to leave slight space in between the buttons so that they don’t fall out.
  5. Keep pasting the buttons until you’ve got the entire shoe covered and let it dry for 24 hours. Drying them under the sun is even better!

Once you’re done with all these steps, all you have to do is flaunt these funky shoes in front of your friends! Isn’t this a fun way to use buttons?
title: DIY Hike up your style factor with these funky Button Pumps!

subtitle: Take a quick study break to get creative with your pen and paper! Add in a bit of fun to your day with this cool craft project for your notebook cover!
description:
Source

To try this craft idea, all you need is to follow these simple steps!

  • Begin by getting hold of some colourful chart papers of your choice.
  • Now, cut out 4 pieces of hearts from those chart papers.
  • Fold each heart into half, overlapping each other and keep it under a heavy book or object.
  • Also, cut out 2 cloud patterns from a plain white chart and stick them on your notebook cover with glue. (Stick it around the side spots as done in this picture)
  • Now, take the heart cuttings and paste two hearts on top of each other with glue. Make sure to paste them only along the middle lining so that they open like a book.
  • Next step will be to paste them on top of your notebook cover using the glue. Do this carefully so that you don’t spill it out of the specific area. We don’t want to make a mess, do we?
  • Now that you are done with 80% of the work, it’s time to get artistic with your pen! Draw a simple design like the one in this picture and wrap up this lovely craft project!
title: #DIY Add some fun to your study hours! Get creative with your notebook!

subtitle: One of the best ways to beat the Monday morning blues is to look forward to your amazing workspace.
description:
One of the best ways to beat the Monday morning blues is to look forward to your amazing workspace. If you are stuck with a dull workstation, it is most likely going to take a toll on your efficiency and productivity levels. A well laid out desk can not only give a boost to your creative side but it can also make you feel at home all throughout your work hours. Ask us how! Let’s show you some beautifully set up work desks which will definitely inspire you to redesign your own office desk.

1) A very industrial desk

Source

Let’s begin with something simple and easily doable idea. This workspace has been designed by a Russian Designer called Vadim Sherbakov and its essence lies in its minimal style. As you can see, this is a fine layout made out of wood and some classic bits of furniture which render a very industrial look to the workspace. The table is stocked up with the very basic items but the one which definitely catches our eye is that striking black table lamp.

2) Get yourself that organized desk


Source

If organization is a top priority for you, this is just the right kind of desk for you. This is a great example of how a small space can be used to make room for all your daily necessities without creating a mess. The best part about this black and white arrangement is the perfect utilization of the wall space to hang the mini-white board, post-it panel and the file holders. The small white lights hung from the top and the matt finish of the furniture makes this quite an elegant desk.

3) That perfectly cozy desk


Source

The first word that comes across your mind when you look at this lovely desk is perhaps ‘cozy’ and rightly so. This is a stunning design accomplished with a simple combination of grey and white colour scheme. Also, this desk has a pretty subtle feminine touch about it, which is perhaps due to the choice of décor items used here. The yellowish lights from the small bulb lights add that a nice cozy touch to this workspace. Also, there is a pleasant superimposition of white in this otherwise grey dominated area. The white table has a glossy texture which makes it an uncomplicated surface for rough work, where one does not have to worry about leaving ink stains or those clumsy coffee spills as it can be easily wiped off without any sign of a mess. Moreover, the glossy surface acts as an apt reflective base for the lights which gives a bright look to this beautiful workspace.

4) Vintage style inspired work desk


Source   

If you are fond of vintage décor and design themes, this work desk will definitely make a lasting impression on you. The design scheme presents a wonderful chemistry of classic and rustic styles. The metallic table and other furnishings render a fine touch of panache without compromising on the comfort factor of the workspace.

5) A work desk for the late-night workaholics


Source: Apartamento decorado - Tradition by Fernandez Mera

Do you belong to the late night clan of workaholics? If yes, then this workstation is just the ideal spot for you. The design pattern is neat and cozy which makes it a comfortable space to stretch while working for long hours. The wooden desk attached on the wall has a light and sleek structure. Also, the size is well suited to fit in your desktop and other necessary stationery items. The huge shelves on the right are easily accessible and can be used to store some small items.  However, the best feature of this desk has to be the spectacular arrangement of lights which flatters the look of this space.
title: 5 Beautiful Work Desk Ideas

subtitle: With the evolution of the business empires and the ever increasing levels of work pressure, a lot of visionary companies have started paying close attention towards building a conducive work environment.
description:
With the evolution of the business empires and the ever increasing levels of work pressure, a lot of visionary companies have started paying close attention towards building a conducive work environment. Constructing innovative office structures have now become an object of great interest as the concept of a ‘workplace’ has stretched by leaps and bounds. An office is no longer ‘just a place’ where people report to work in that typical 9-6 schedule. Rather, offices have become the extended version of a home or a comfortable space where an individual spends maximum number of hours of his day. Keeping that in mind, many big companies have understood the importance of investing in the creation of a workstation that caters to the specific needs of their employees. The dream is to build an office which is well-equipped with all the essential facilities that fosters a spirit of creativity and efficiency amongst the employees. An office is supposed to be a happy place and not a prison that confines its slaves to some mundane tasks through which they can earn their daily bread and butter.

This vision is endorsed by some of the major business houses and it is reflective in the kind of offices they are building for their workforces.  Let’s have a look at some of the most popular brands of the world and the visualization of their modern office ideologies.

1) Google

 Google Tel Aviv Office, Israel

Source

This is a glimpse of the new Google office space at Tel Aviv, Israel which has a huge 8,000 sqm campus and occupies almost 8 floors in Electra Tower. The project has been jointly designed by Camenzind Evolution, Setter Architects and Studio Yaron Tal. Google has always been a pioneer in establishing an innovative work environment with a purposeful need to integrate nature as its core element. The idea which drives Google to initiate such efforts is its aim towards adopting sustainability in its business culture.

This is a beautiful conference room with a spectacular view and a fresh raindrop theme in place. The design of the entire project reflects various aspects of Israel as a country with a focus on its diversity and local identity. The hanging lights in the room convey an aura of nature which is in sync with the wall theme. To put it simply, this room presents just the right environment to inspire and cultivate a creative atmosphere for the Google Team.

2) Facebook 

Facebook’s Sydney Office

Source

The most famous social media website, Facebook has set up many interesting creative offices around the world. This is a small preview of Facebook’s Sydney office which has been designed by Siren Design with an amalgamation of ultra-modern and tech design style.

“Facebook is about people – and our workplaces should support our employees in ways they didn’t even know possible, working to stimulate collaboration, nurture cultural cohesion, and pave the way for ingenuity and invention” – Facebook design guidelines.

The superimposition of grey along with the steel staircase in the picture renders a very crude-industrial look in the interiors. While, the long black hanging lights bring in just the right amount of coziness in the room and makes it an ideal environment to take a break to unwind. A trace of nature can be seen in the wooden table wedge, sofa and the few potted plants placed in the room. The yellow sofa and bright cushions have been put in place to strike a subtle contrast in the place. This design goes well with the brand image of Facebook which is raw, inventive and progressive. 

3) Microsoft

Microsoft – Redmond Building 44 Offices

Source

This is a snapshot of Microsoft’s Building 44 set in Redmond, Washington and covers a vast area of 143,000 square feet. The project has been designed by ZGF Architects and constructed by GLY Construction. The renovation of this building was a giant leap by Microsoft towards converting present day office buildings into innovative workspaces. During this construction, the architects went for a complete procedure of knocking down the old office structure and accepting the challenge of starting from scratch to arrive at new possibilities. The mission was to experiment with space and set new benchmarks in the realm of designing in a resourceful and functional manner. 

The dominant features of this project are- the exclusive steel helix staircase, the largest living wall on campus, hanging ATC “Clouds” from the ceilings which to cut off the noise in the area to render a calm work environment. There is a good amount of natural light in the office area which enhances the liveliness and openness of the space. The bright coloured staircase and carpet create a cheerful look in the work area.
title: Classy Office Spaces- Evolution of the Office concept

subtitle: This article will take you to a whole new range of design ideas to help you build that beautiful shower space you have always wanted.
description:
Have you been planning to renovate your master bathroom to make room for that perfect shower case? If yes, this article will take you to a whole new range of design ideas to help you build that beautiful shower space you have always wanted.

 1) An elegant shower case with an in-built tub

Source  

If you have a lot of space in your bathroom, you can definitely take some inspiration from this exquisite design of a shower room. The design scheme reflects a combination of luxury and sheer elegance. This is a perfect bathroom built from vinyl tiles on the floors and the walls. Placing the tub under the shower is actually a great idea if you want to take a lazy bubble bath and rinse off right under the shower.

2) A shower case with a blue brick wall design

Source

This is a very interesting shower room design with a slanting side roof which opens up to a window. The area receives a good share of natural light from the window which renders a bright look to this space. We love the choice of blue brick wall design and its neat finish. Again, this is a great idea to try out if your home has a well spread-out bathroom area.

3) A cozy bathroom enclosure

Source

 We love the cozy design of this lavish shower room. The light coloured tiles, the sleek glass casing and the soft beam from the small lights on the ceiling make it a dream bathroom enclosure.

4) Add a touch of nature to your shower

Source

If you want to experiment with a stone interior design, this is just the thing you might want to try. This shower room with a charcoal stone veneer interiors almost resembles an isolated cave.  The water from the shower panels fixed on the ceiling makes you feel as though you are right under a waterfall. In fact, this is a lovely way to add a touch of nature in your bathroom.

Here’s another idea of a shower space with simple stone interiors and a rustic ambience. The choice of bathroom fittings in this setting is quite eye-catching and adds a stylish touch to this bathroom.

Source

5) The classic Black & White look

Source

This shower room is a reassertion of the fact that you can never go wrong with the classic combination of black and white. In fact, the idea used here is actually pretty simple. The designer has opted for a white tile wall with a black glass frame casing to get this timeless look.

subtitle: If you want to add an artistic touch to your home, there is a wide variety of arty home décor items to pick from. One such amazing decoration idea is to go for an ethnic lampshade or light fittings.
description:
We bring you an assortment of lampshade designs to bring in a traditional look in your house.

1) Terracotta Lamps

Source

Image credits: Photograph- Nrupen Madhvani & Styled by- Aparna Kaistha 

A simple way to add an earthen look to your room is to go for a Terracotta lamp. Terracotta is typical clay-based unglazed or glazed ceramic earthenware, which is used to make many ethnic décor items. It is a superb idea to experiment with Terracotta lamps as they come in unique styles and forms. You can either go for a hanging lamp or one of those easily available table lamps to create a warm atmosphere in your living room or bedroom.

2) Medieval style inspired lamps

Source

Another way to beautify your living room is to go for a lampshade or lantern which has a design pattern that is inspired from the exquisite medieval lighting styles. These lamps are usually built out of metals or glass materials that capture the design mood of the medieval era.  You can choose from a variety of metallic and glass light fixtures, like the purple and gold hanging lamps to render a shiny look to your home interiors. 

3) Warli Art inspired Lamps

Source

If you are a fan of a lively craft work, you should definitely bring home a lampshade with a Warli Art pattern. The popular Warli artwork of Maharashtra is a fantastic example of tribal art which reflects the daily life events, dances, festivals and other ceremonies of the Warli tribe. This painting style makes use of different shapes and designs to capture different emotions and aspects of tribal life. Lampshades made out of such cultural paintings definitely accentuate the charm of this art form. Place this lampshade in any area of your house to add a subtle dash of folk culture. 

4) Metallic lamps

Source

Another type of trend in the category of light fixtures is seen in the case of metallic lamps and lanterns. Metallic lights with a gold, silver and copper finish lend a perfectly lustrous look to any dull living room or drawing room. The design possibilities in these lamps are immense, ranging from Middle-Eastern to medieval design styles.

5) Moroccan – Indian design inspired lamps

Source

One of the most popular styles in the segment of lights is the Moroccan and Indian design inspiration.  The Moroccan form of art depicts some elaborate designs which involve the use of various geometric, floral and calligraphic patterns with a mystical aura. The style of these lamps is firmly rooted to Islam which is the main religion in Morocco. A blend of Indian and Moroccan design creates a deeper sense of beauty in the style of these lanterns. 

Pick from these amazing ethnic styles of lampshades and get that crafty look in your beautiful home. You can also add small décor items built from the same materials to enhance the look!
title: Go ethnic with Lampshades!

subtitle: If you ever visit the magnificent Jaipur City Palace, you can catch a beautiful glimpse of all the four seasons in form of four stunningly constructed small gates around the Pritam Niwas Chowk.
description:
1) The rapture of autumn in the design of the Northeast Peacock Gate

Source 

The euphoria of the season of fall is vividly captured in the intricate design of the Northeast Peacock Gate. The sheer beauty of the colours of autumn, the gorgeous multi-coloured motifs of peacocks and leaves on the doorway, is sure to leave any tourist spellbound. This gate is known to be dedicated to the Hindu God, Vishnu.

 2) The vibrant shades of summer at the Southwest Lotus Gate

Source

Just one look at the vibrant design of the Southwest Lotus Gate is enough to convey the essence and mood of summers. The choice of bright colours, repetitive patterns of flowers and petals paints a surreal picture of a sunny summer evening where nature is in full bloom. This gate is dedicated to Lord Shiva and Parvati.

3) A glimpse of spring blossoming at the Northwest Green Gate

Source 

No other colour can capture the spirit of spring like the way green does. While envisioning the design for the Northwest Green Gate, the artisans of those days must have started off with the same thought. That’s what makes this gate so striking! Apart from the emphasis on green, this gate is also famously known as the Leheriya gate, where ‘Leheriya’ stands for ‘waves’. This blooming gate is dedicated to Lord Ganesha. With its glorious design, it truly is a classic depiction of spring.

4) Traces of winter at the Rose Gate

Source Image Credits:TilakHaria 

Lastly, the Rose Gate stands as a symbolic figure to depict the story of winters. Its design has a detailed pattern of flowers to signify the rose flowers. The artistry with which this gate has been crafted reveals the true genius of the architects and craftsmen of ancient Jaipur. If you look closely enough, you will find the mild traces of winter fabulously filling in the frame of your imagination. This gate stands as a mark of respect to the Hindu Goddess or ‘Devi’.
title: Watch the seasons unfold at the ‘Four Season Gates’ of Jaipur City Palace

subtitle: In this era of green living, how far along are you when it comes to adopting healthy and sustainable practices in your own house?
description:
Let’s acquaint you with some easy green living mantras to try out on your own.

1) Start off with some basic landscaping!

Source

The simplest way to start off is with some basic landscaping. All you got to do is take the dead leaves along with the yard trimmings and start layering. Then, add egg shells, vegetable scraps and coffee grounds. Don’t forget to add air, occasionally. Eventually, you will have your rich landscape ready for the plantation of deciduous trees around your home.

2) REUSE AND RECYCLE

Source

Reusing and recycling are the two quintessential pillars of sustainability. With a little bit of practice, these serve a great deal towards ensuring a healthy environment. Make use of items like paper bags, baggies, newspapers and file folders, which are easily available and have a much longer life span. 

3) REDUCE

Source

Ever wondered how much energy would you save just by switching off that one light? A lot! Just by taking simple measures like switching off the lights every time you leave a room, or using compact fluorescents over regular incandescent light bulbs, or by fixing leaky pipes, you can not only save your money, but can also contribute towards a sustainable environment.

4) MAKE WISE CONSUMER CHOICES

Source

Making wise consumer choices and reducing the consumption of non degradable items go hand in hand. Making simple changes in your selection while shopping for your house will take you a step closer to a sustainable surrounding. So the next time you are shopping, make sure to buy a washable cloth instead of a paper towel, biodegradable trash bags instead of paper bags, and rechargeable batteries.

5) USE NON TOXIC CLEANERS

Source

The market is filled with toxic cleaners that hamper our water supply. Hence, the need of the hour is to bring in use non toxic cleaners. You can also make your own non toxic cleaners out of household items. Vinegar, baking soda, and lemon juice are some of the most commonly used, yet effective cleaners. So, say yes to these cleaners!
title: 5 ways to make your home more sustainable

subtitle: If you are a fan of uncomplicated art work, then this paper craft idea is a must try for you!
description:
Source

Just follow these simple steps to get this done!

  1. To start with, punch out as many heart shapes as you need from a cardstock.
  2. Once you have all the shapes punched, gently poke a hole at the top and the bottom of one heart piece with a pin or needle. Then, cut a length of fishing line.
  3. String the fishing line through the top hole away from you and then through the bottom hole coming towards you.
  4. Repeat the steps with as many shapes as you want.
  5. Once you have all of your strands completed, tie each one to your dowel.
  6. Make sure to leave at least 1 to 1-1/2 inches between each strand to keep them away from tangling.

The moment you’ve completed these steps, all that’s left is to enjoy your new and easy piece of art!
title: #DIY ‘Love on the Walls’ – Experiment with paper cuttings & give a dazzling look to your walls!

1. Begin with tearing up a lot of strips from the magazine pages. They need not be neat and can be of different thickness.

subtitle: Explore the Decor and interior designs of the Bigg Boss House(Season 9-Season 5)
description:
Decor Diaries: The Bigg Boss House (Season 9 - Season 5)

One of the most controversial and widely anticipated reality TV shows, Bigg Boss is back with yet another season featuring one of the biggest celebrities. As always, an exotic luxury house with all the plush amenities that integrates the in vogue home decor trends has been specifically designed. The house showcases the brilliant stature of interior designing and decor as well as the massive appetite for the same in the country. Hope you enjoy it as much as I did!

Season 9: Double Trouble: Set designer-filmmaker Omung Kumar is the mastermind behind the house. Pssst, he’s also the director of Mary Kom!


An Intoxicating Confession Room. The seating couch is overwhelmed with what appears to be herculean wings or flames, erupting from the back and cascading the contestants under its shade. 

Modern Decor Bedroom. Perhaps a tad-bit bohemian by the looks of it. Check out the mini grafitis of spanned wings, the many birds nesting on wires and impressioned on the beds. A Gigantic mirror on the back as well.

‘Staircase to Heaven’ - Led Zeppelin.

As expected, a plush pool out in the open.

Plenty of greenery. Surrounding the pathway and cascading the benches as well as the chessboard setting for the floor.

Unconventional decor for the dining. New-age pastels for the chairs with an eccentric table cover and plenty of artsy pieces imbibed aptly into the house. 

Opulence is word. Mesmerising interiors for the beds with massive chandeliers and voluptuous breezy installations over the walls, perhaps to soothe those tired souls.  

A very fascinating wallpaper indeed.

The Living Area

An Urbane Cookstone. A definite break from the mundane kitchen with a bohemian selection of colours. Looks fabulous though.

Observe the pillar as well as the wall in the backdrop. Certain continuity in terms of the beautiful decor is visible from just a glance. Exotic Brilliance.

The most happening Vanity Ever. Bright Reds with sparkling golden, a must have combo.

Season 8: The Wondrous Log House

Winner: Gautam Gulati

Things took off from the insides of a plane and for a while, many of us were badly missing the grandiose house, something that we all had been accustomed to for such a long time. Eventually, the luxurious wood themed house, an all time favourite of mine with magnificent colour coordinations and subtle floorings set the stage ablaze!

Pathway leading to-&-fro from the House. The house again was designed by veteran Omung Kumar.

Intriguing airplane interiors.

The Vivaan house decor.

Charismatic plank floorings and plenty of plants, victorian-era lamps, intricate detailing carved onto from furnitures tables to beam-pillars were just some of the highlights.

Serene Outdoor Park.

Plush Vanity Room.

Lively illuminations from the hundreds of tiny lights, umpteen of mirrors mounted on walls, the herb garden and the flamboyant modern furniture with wooden finish imparts an earthy feel to the interiors of the entire house. Sheer Elegance.  

Open Verandah with the herb garden.

The house decor of especially the bedrooms are adorned with wall-arts of all sorts, from impressions to abstract, from wall-prints to contemporary portraits as well as the blocks chipped out from and into the walls.

Semi-circular Seating Couch.

Season 7: The Best of both Worlds!

Winner: Gauhar Khan

Designed by none other than the great Omung Kumar, this house has to be the most challenging creations ever for the Bigg Boss franchise, and as per the designer : "The theme was based on heaven and hell and the challenge given to me was to create two extreme conditions under the same roof."

Sounds pretty Insane to me!

The beach-pool has been designed like a dome while the ceiling imitates a cloudy skyline.

Quirky Wall-Art.

Master Bedroom.

Like a rainbow, a resplendent home decor complementing the heavenly theme for the season, with hangings from the ceilings and an urbane-chic interiors that didn't falter from mesmerising the TV audience. Moreover, the faux-bookshelf and the faux-bar were some of the trending elements from the world of home decor that were incorporated into the house.

The Sparkling Living Area.

The Bicycled-Basin!

The gigantic white tree framed to spread out and cover the ceiling, a bicycle ingeniously crafted to serve as a washing bin, confession room with contrasting themes, dazzling color combinations of blue and pink render a pulsating ambience to the house aesthetics.

DIY wall-clock: Roman and English numerals together.

A soothing bathe and wash.

Eccentric and Luxurious Bedroom.

The Faux-Bar.

Season 5: The Bubble Gum Effect!

Winner: Juhi Parmar

The 5th season featured an eccentric pale or pastel shades in home decor, designed specially to stir uneasiness amongst the contestants and create a stressful environment. Not something that we would recommend to our home owners as the effervescent colours stimulate the most vivid imagination, however the futuristic home decor is an undoubted masterpiece.

Futuristic Bedroom Decor. Designer Shyam Bhatia has simply nailed it. A lot of fuchsia and yellow has been used in many areas of the house.

Swimside Gym

Scintillating color combinations. Simulating pastel shades of blue and yellow contrasted by quirky pink plywood furnishings.

The bedroom decor.

Curvy lines mounted over walls and polygon mirrors, circular seating furnitures and shapely interiors extend an aura of incompleteness and flamboyance.

The cookstone in an exciting pink decor.

Dining area in dual tones of pink and white.

Source Source Source Source Source Source
title: Decor Diaries: The Bigg Boss House

subtitle: In this era of extreme stress, who wouldn’t want to be a little closer to nature? Having the right kind of plants indoors is a great way to add a touch of nature to your house.
description:
This Environment Day, take a pick from our list of special plants that are not only beautiful but also help in creating a healthy environment at home.

1) The Podocarpus Bonsai

This is a beautiful choice if you are looking for a plant with a great visual appeal with amazing stress reducing properties. It is an upright, evergreen and dense tree with pointed and leathery dark green leaves which will add an aesthetic look to your room.

DOs:

  • Keep them at a place which gets 3-4 hours of direct sunlight, daily.
  • Do the pruning of old leaves to avoid fungal attacks.

DON’Ts:

  • Don’t repot these bonsais by yourself. It should be done by a plant doctor.
  • Don’t repot using regular soil. It should be done by a plant doctors.

2) The Pink Syngonium

With very attractive ornamental foliage, this plant looks very beautiful and is easy to maintain. This luscious tissue cultured plant is ideal if you want a disease-free and healthy environment at home.

DOs:

  • Keep them at a place where they can get atleast 3-4 hours of indirect sunlight.
  • Do the pruning of old leaves.

             DON’Ts:

  • Don’t give them direct sunlight.
  • Don’t overwater your plants.

3) The Sageretia Plant

Also known as Bird Plum Cherry, these are very popular because of their small glossy leaves and tiny flowers. Apart from being extremely attractive, these bonsai leaves, again, are proven to be great stress busters.

DOs:

  • Do put manures every 6-8 months.
  • Keep them at a place which receives 3-4 hours indirect sunlight everyday

         DONTs:

  • Avoid temperature shock.
  • Don’t give them direct sunlight.

4) The Succulent Plant

These beautiful plants are commonly known as fat plants as they store water in some of their thickened parts. Because of their unique and charismatic appearance, these moist plants are grown as ornamental plants.

DOs:

  • Water them once or twice a week.
  • Keep them at a place where they get 3-4 hours of sunlight.

             DON’Ts:

  • Don’t overwater your plants.
  • Avoid temperature shocks.

5) The Oxycardium Plant

Toughest of all the house plants, this pretty little plant is very easy to maintain and can literally take care of itself. These special tissue cultured plants are disease resistant and give you sufficient space to breathe in.

DOs:

  • Do the pruning of old leaves.
  • Keep them at a place which gets 3-4 hours of indirect sunlight.

           DON’Ts:

  • Don’t give them direct sunlight.
  • Don’t over water your plant.

All Image Credits: Nurturing Green
title: Celebrating World Environment Day, 5th June, 2015 - Add a fine touch of healthy green inside your house!

subtitle: Finding décor ideas that are cheap is not a difficult job, but finding ideas that don’t look cheap is a bit difficult! Here’s a list of some tips for decorating your home without spending much.

1) Make use of DIY

Source

From cushion covers to hanging lights, make use of DIY products! This will not only be easy on the pocket, but will also make your ‘home sweet home’ really special for you. This doesn’t mean you need to make perfect things, but it’s about how you bring perfection to your house with simple ideas

subtitle: Bored of the contemporary style of your room? Imagine how wonderful it would be to decorate your room with one of the simplest
description:
Bored of the contemporary style of your room? Imagine how wonderful it would be to decorate your room with one of the simplest, yet most beautiful form of art in the history of mankind. Now, you can add that missing traditional touch to your room with some wonderful “Warli Art” ideas.

1) The ‘Warli’ wall clock

Source

This beautiful and colourful wall clock is really easy to make. All you need is a plain white wall clock and a few sketch pens of various colours. Just decorate the clock by ‘Warli’ designs which comprise of combinations of circles and triangles (which appear to look like humans).  This is really simple and looks very attractive, enhancing the beauty of your wall.

2) The ‘Warli’ photo frame

Source

 Who wouldn’t want the pictures of their loved ones in their room? To top it all, pictures kept in a beautiful photo frame will only increase the intensity of those memories. This bright and funky Warli art photo frame is just the option you should consider!  All you got to do is get a plain photo frame of any deep colour, a white chart paper, a pair of scissors, and glue. Just cut the chart paper in circles, triangles and rectangles of various shapes. Now paste them together on the frame making images of humans, and your photo frame is all ready. Simple, isn’t it?

3) The ‘Warli’ notebook

Source

Reading would no longer be boring with this cool notebook. This notebook cover is unique and very easy to make. To start off, all you need is a plain notebook and some bright paint colours. Then, just paint ‘Warli’ designs directly on the notebook cover. Fill in the designs with some more bright colours, and get going with your ‘Warli’ notebook.

So give your room a wonderful folk culture appeal with these amazing Warli art ideas and enhance the beauty of your home!
title: Give your room that “Warli” touch!

subtitle: If you’re ever in the city of nawabs, you will be mesmerized by its beautiful architecture that still reflects the glory of Lucknow’s history with prominent traces of Mughal architecture.
description:
1) Bara Imambara

Source

It’s only fair to begin with a legendary monument like ‘Bara Imambara’, which is one of the largest buildings in Lucknow built under Nawab Asaf-ud-daula in 1784. It includes the Asfi mosque and the Bhulbhulaiya or the Labyrinth. The Asfi mosque contains the tomb of Asaf-ud-daula, and the labyrinth is the only maze in India which supports the massive structure of the whole complex from underground.

Source

The adjoining halls in Bara Imambara are shaped as watermelon and sunflower. These halls are standing straight without any pillar support.

Source

The huge design on the ceiling of this hall is a true depiction of Mughal Art with its neat metallic carvings.  Almost 15 meters in height, this ceiling design beautifully captures the royalty of the Mughal era.

 Source

In contrast to the designs of other halls of this monument, the ceiling of the Giant hall of Bara Imambara is very vibrant.  It is filled with the design of concentric circles which cover the whole ceiling. The colourful “jhumars” add that extraordinary charm to the hall.

2) Ambedkar Park

Source

This park was set up by the Bahujan Samaj Party when it was in power and is made up of Red Sand Stone, which was specially imported from Rajasthan for its construction. The main center of attraction of this place is the surreal reddish brown glow that comes from the lights placed on the pillars.

Source

This refreshing place is a real treat to the eyes in the evenings. The lights placed at the bottom of the pillars make them sparkle. The elephant faces on the top of the pillars enhance its beauty altogether.

 3) Chhota Imambara

Source

Also known as the ‘palace of lights’, Chhota Imambara is another beautiful example of great architecture. The chandeliers used to decorate the interiors of this monument were brought from Belgium. It has a gilded dome, minarets and several turrets. The walls of this building are decorated with Arabic calligraphy.

 Source

The black and white walls are decorated with Arabic calligraphy that has flowing charm about it.

The brilliant designs and patterns of these monuments will definitely make you say- “Muskuraiye, aap Lucknow mein hain”
title: 3 architecturally amazing places from the city of nawabs – LUCKNOW!

subtitle: Give an all new touch to your room with a crop of bold, fabulous and truly inspiring colour pairings. These amazing blends would perfectly fit into different personalities a person may have. Check them out!
description:
1) Grey and yellow: 

Source

This is definitely a beautiful combo to try out in your living room. All you got to do is add a small table, a few cushions and a lampshade of a super bright yellow green shade to your grey colour room and you’re good to go. Your new stylish room is all set to dazzle. Adding a carpet and a candle of the same shade will only be a bonus.

2) White and blue 

Source

White and blue go beautifully hand-in-hand. Placing a round velvet blue pouf and a blue cushion to your white room will give it that perfect look. A touch of blue in your room will give it a classy and  attractive appearance.

3) White and magenta

Source

Experiment with the dynamic colour combination of magenta and white to boost up the energy level of your room. Try placing a magenta sofa set and a few small tables of the same colour in your white room to make your room look vibrant and youthful!

4) Blue and Red

Source

Nothing can be better than two bold colours coming together in such a pleasant manner. Red and blue are a treat for the eyes when combined together. So just mix and match your furniture and walls with these two eye catching colours and fall in love with your new room.
title: Colour Play: Experiment with the Contrast look!

subtitle: Mark Twain has rightly said, “Good friends, good books and a sleepy conscience: this is the ideal life.” The only problem with them is that they require quite a bit of space.
description:
Here are some amazing ideas to tackle the space issues in the most wonderful and creative way. Check ‘em out

1) Staircase book shelf

Source 

Making bookshelves out of your stairs is a great idea! It will not only enhance the style quotient, but will also beautify and utilize the unused space near your stairs. All you need to do is mount bookshelves along the wall adjacent to your stairs, or use the space under the stairs. This is a perfect way to store all your favourite books!

2) Palette book shelf

Source

The easiest to make, using palettes is a great way to add that raw look to your new bookshelf. All you got to do is hang these palettes in the center of a wall giving it the look of your taste. You can make a magazine-rack shelf, a tree shelf, or anything, depending upon your convenience. Cost efficient yet attractive, this is a must try!

3) Bookshelf door 

Source

One of the most fun ways to create your bookshelf, this could be a cool “passageway” leading to another room! Just glue and screw smooth plywood from all sides for the back. Then, attach the required number of shelves using screws and get ready to use your super cool bookshelf. This project may be a bit more work, but looks amazing. So, give it a try!
title: Redesign your library with these super creative style ideas!

subtitle: Wall decor is the most exciting part of decorating your house.
description:
Wall decor is the most exciting part of decorating your house. From bright prints to unusual patterns, you can try it all.  Here’s how you can make your cute little wall the center of attraction, not just for your guests, but also for yourself. 

1) Family tree wall

Source

Creating your own family tree is the most creative thing you can do with the walls of your room. Just paste a tree wall sticker on the center of your wall. Then, paste pictures to its branches randomly and your family tree is ready. This will not only beautify your wall, but will also make you feel close to your dear ones.

2) Wall of words

Source

Get different words or quotes written on rustic wooden blocks. Just place them on the wall and say hello to your stylish wall of words. This looks best on narrow wall spaces which are generally left vacant.

3) Photo frame clock

Source

12 frames filled with 12 different pictures, prints, cards, etc. and a center timepiece with arms, this is exactly what it takes to makes this brilliant photo frame clock. This amazing wall decor idea will definitely increase the charm of your walls. All you got to do is get creative and make one on your own!
title: 3 amazing wall decor ideas to inspire you

subtitle: Student life is the most happening phase in one’s life.
description:
Student life is the most happening phase in one’s life. It’s a mix of learning, having fun with your buddies and making memories that you will cherish forever! The experience is even better if you have a bedroom that captures this youthful spirit! Check out these amazing room ideas for students! 

1) The all-in-one model

Source 

If you are a stylish, clutter free and study-focused student, this one is just for you. A comfortable bed under a huge study table, this is the need of the hour for every student. A model like this will give you a perfect experience of comfortable learning altogether. 

 2) The K.I.S.S. model 

Source 

This model has been set up following the ‘mantra’ of keeping it simple and sweet (K.I.S.S.). Simple shelves and cabinets adjacent to a simple bed with multiple drawers will enhance the beauty of your room. Pleasant to the eyes, this room will be your best companion for years to come. 

3) The ‘Library bed’ model 

Source 

Don’t find enough space to keep your books? Well, this is exactly what you’ve been looking for. A comfy bed with an in-built section for keeping your books and a table lamp is just what you need. It will give you the perfect atmosphere to learn and explore new things. 

4) The ‘study table cum bed’ model

Source 

Study table with a trundle bed, this is precisely what every student dreams of. Classy and stylish, it is definitely one of its kind! Accessorized with some cool lamps and a chair, this will be your first step towards a high tech environment right in your room. 

5) The ‘comfy-soothing’ model 

Source 

The thought that ‘beauty lies in simplicity’ is very effectively depicted by this model. Simple and soothing, it will surely be a treat to your eyes. Complemented by white walls, the white furniture is an amazing solution to small space problems faced by the students.
title: 5 Amazing Student Room Ideas

subtitle: Monsoons and Chai is a match made in heaven! Go funky with your ‘Chai Cups’ and add that dreamy effect to your monsoons.
description:
Try with an array of colours and make your own patterns. Flaunt your creations with everyone on Instagram and Facebook!

Tips

  • If the nail paint is too dry, add some nail polish remover to it to get the consistency right.
  • Clean excess nail paint with a cotton ball and remover.
  • Mixing of colours needs to be quick.
  • Make sure the water is warm enough.
title: Add a Monsoon Twist to Regular ‘Chai Cups’

subtitle: Embrace the winds and say bye-bye to the scorching heat because the Monsoons are marking their onset! What better than making your own wind chime to welcome the monsoons?
description:
Add that Monsoon Swivel with this easy DIY Wind Chime

Source

Materials Required

  • Thick wooden twig
  • Seashells (with punctures in them for the thread to pass through)
  • Beads
  • Thread (Thin and sturdy varieties)
  1. Start by choosing the seashells and beads that go into the first column of hangings.
  2. Take a thread and pass it through the series of shells such that you knot it at regular intervals to hold the shell.
  3. Decide the length of the thread and secure it at the end.
  4. Repeat this for as many columns you want.
  5. Tie the other end of these hangings to the wooden twig.
  6. Your wind chime is almost ready and just needs that perfect spot to rest in. Take the thicker variety of the thread and tie it along the twig so as to provide for a hanging mechanism.
  7. Now hang your whimsical wind chime and let it dance to the tunes of monsoon.
title: Add that Monsoon Swivel with this easy DIY Wind Chime

subtitle: Can you hear that? It’s a call from the magical world of beauty and merriment reaching out to you. Yes, these easy DIY Lanterns are little balls of happiness that you can make at the comfort of your home.
description:
Source 

Materials Required

  • Twine/ Any other sturdy thread
  • Glue
  • Cornstarch
  • Luke Warm Water
  • Fairy Lights (Yes, the Diwali Lights)
  • Vaseline
  • Balloons
  • Scissors
  • Cleaning Cloth
  • Safety Pin 

Can’t wait to start with all the magic? Let’s begin!

  • Start by laying down a cleaning cloth to save yourself from mommy’s scoldings.
  • Blow onto some balloons in sizes that you want your lanterns to end up being.
  • Mix the glue, cornstarch and little warm water to form a paste free of lumps.
  • Spread a thin layer of vaseline over the balloon so that it saves onto some labour at the end.
  • Dip the twine into the paste and start rolling it around the balloon. You can make it dense or light depending on personal preferences.
  • Once you've satisfactorily covered the balloon, let it dry overnight.
  • Wake up in the morning with excitement in your eyes and a pin at your dispose and burst that balloon! (This is where the role of vaseline is highlighted)
  • Next, take those fairy lights and wrap them delicately around the yarn balls choosing an appropriate spot to hang them.

You’d be delighted with the end result and would never want to switch these whimsical creatures off!
title: DIY: A Little Doze of Fairy-Like Lights For You!

subtitle: Did you ever wonder what it’d be like to make your own set of candles in colours that please your eyes? How about we tell you that we have just the right trick up our sleeves to make you accomplish exactly.
description:
1) Colour Block Candles!

Source

Materials Required

  • Microwave safe utensils
  • Containers for the Candles
  • Candle Wicks
  • Wax
  • Crayola Crayons
  • wooden stirrer

Now that you're all set to charge with your list of ‘ingredients,’ you'd want to start as follows

  • Pour some wax in a microwave safe utensil and heat it in the microwave for about a minute. Once that’s done, empty the small amount of heated wax into your candle container.
  • Place the candle wick into this wax and allow it to harden.
  • Choose any crayon of your choice and remove its exterior paper. Break the crayon into 3-4 pieces and set them aside.
  • Grab your microwave safe container again and fill it with wax. Take the broken crayons and add them to this.
  • Heat again for 2 mins or until the content has melted. Stir the contents with a wooden stirrer and pour into the candle container.
  • Experiment with different colours and designs and bask in the glory of your homemade candles!
title: DIY- Colour Block Crayola Candles

subtitle: Ever wondered if you could save a trip to the mall every time you decided to change your linen because the pillow covers just wouldn't match? Well, we’ve had this figured out for you no matter what colour or style you're looking for.
description:
Source

Materials Required

  • Plain Pillow/ Cushion Cover
  • Various colours of Sharpie Pens
  • Rubbing Alcohol
  • Ear Buds

How-to get this done?

  • You may begin by placing the plain pillow cover on a flat surface.
  • Next, go wild with the sharpie pens! You may scribble, doodle or even opt for intricate patterns to go onto the cover.
  • Now that the ‘Picasso’ in you is drained, get hold of some ear buds dipped in rubbing alcohol and while the ink is still wet, rub the buds along the pillow cover. This will make the ink bleed and blot into beautiful looking silhouettes.
  • Allow your masterpiece to dry. 

Voila! You have now got your very own version of an array of pillow covers to go with any kind of bed linen.
title: DIY: ‘Expensive’ Looking Pillow Covers at Minimal Cost

subtitle: Ever wondered what you’d do with your boyfriend’s old t-shirts? How you'd put them to a nasty use and demean his existence? Don't fret it because we have just the right solution to make your ex-boyfriend blues go away with an old t-shirt rug.
description:
Source

Materials Required

Old T-shirts

Scissors

With a pair of scissors in one hand, t-shirts in another and rage in your eyes get set to put his ‘leftovers’ to a good use-

Start by cutting the t-shirts along the horizontal length in strips of about 1.5 inches. Also cut it at the ends so as to avoid any continuous loops.

Gather any three strips and knot the three together tightly.

Begin braiding the strips.

Once you've reached a significant length of the braid, coil it with the knot in the centre as if holding your ‘ex’ by the neck.

To make each concentric circle secure with the other, take the strand that is closest to the loop and make it go inside around the previous braided loop.

Continue coiling and braiding till your rug is of the desired size.

You obviously do not have an endless supply of t-shirts strands. Hence, you’d have to add fabric every now and then. So, fold the end of your fabric in the coil and make a small slit in it.

Do the same with the new strand and align them one on top of the other.

Take the other end of the new stand and pass it under the coinciding strings and there you have and easy mess-free addition.

Once your rug is done with, place it in some beautiful corner of your home and jump, stamp and dance on it secretly crushing the spirit of that unlucky ex!
title: Get Over that Lousy Ex with this easy DIY

subtitle: It isn't necessary for you to be blessed with an artistic mind and breathtaking artsy skills to pull off an easy art installation to adorn your walls. Sit back and relax as you effortlessly master this trick!
description:
Source

Materials Required

  • MDF Board/ Piece of Wooden Board
  • Embroidery Thread
  • Nails
  • Hammer
  • Pencil

After the material collection is over with, follow these easy steps to attain your very own ‘piece of art’

  • Start by lightly tracing the form of the figure you want.
  • Next, hammer the nails around that silhouette.
  • Once the hammering is done and you hopefully still have sound hands to work with, start by connecting the nails with the embroidery thread. Knot it in the right places to avoid messy spots.

Tada! You've now completed a timeless and unique art installation for your own merriment.
title: Embrace the Artist in you with this Easy DIY String Art

subtitle: Get ready to dress up your light switch covers in pretty colours and funky patterns with this quick trick!
description:
Source

Materials Required

  • Screw Driver
  • Existing/ New Switch Covers
  • Scotch Tape (2-5mm wide)
  • Spray Paint
  • Newspapers/ Cleaning Cloth

Either get hold of already placed switch covers or grab a set of new ones and get started-

  • With the help of a screwdriver, carefully take out the cover plate. Please ignore this step if you’re using a new cover.
  • Next, lay a cleaning cloth or some newspapers on a flat surface and place the cover on top of it.
  • Choose the desired spray paint colour and apply a base coat over the plate. This colour will form the minority of your design.
  • Allow this to dry.
  • Once the paint has dried, use a thin scotch tape to stick onto the surface of the plate in asymmetrical or defined patters.
  • Go for another contrasting spray paint and let it work its way onto the cover plate. Allow this to air dry.
  • Now that the paint has satisfactorily dried, gently peel off the tape to reveal the base colour.
  • Also paint the nails so that they don’t look too out of place.
  • Lastly, screw the plate into the switch box.

Your very own version of an extravagant switch plate is now ready!
title: DIY: Add Glam to your room with these Quirky Switchboard Plates

subtitle: When it comes to designing your ideal bathroom space, the right choice of flooring becomes the nucleus around which everything else would revolve.
description:
When it comes to designing your ideal bathroom space, the right choice of flooring becomes the nucleus around which everything else would revolve. You wouldn't want to enter your bathroom and fall prey to a mighty fall or witness cracks and seepage anywhere, would you? Hence, flooring material is the thought worth pondering over. You might want to steer clear of hardwood and carpet flooring because they’re not the best of friends with moisture! Easing your dilemmas, we have a perfect list of bathroom floorings to choose from-

1) Luring Limestone

Source

It’s warm, cozy and comes in an array of colours ranging from soft whites and creams to darker hues. Limestone is relatively soft and hence light weight. If you plan to go with this, be ready to look after it like your own child because it’s pretty high maintenance. Its widespread availability and cost effectiveness makes it a popular choice among designers and it’s definitely a stunner.

2) Scintillating Slate

Source

Unravel the mysterious aura behind slate with its everlasting beauty which makes it look so appealing. Slate never misses to make a statement with its ravishing textures and durability. Coming with minimal maintenance and a boastful outlook, slate is a stellar choice for your master bath!

3) Glorious Granite

Source

 Granite, with its hulk like properties and watertight ability, happens to be the most appropriate option for bathroom floorings. Granite is tough, durable and pleasing to look at which gives your entire bath space a rich and luxurious touch. Granite is versatile and free to experiment with proving to be a total winner in all situations.

4) Creative Ceramics

Source

Ceramic flooring is one of the most versatile and ‘easy to play with'! They come in truckloads of textures and colours reaching out to almost everyone. Complementing your space bang on, ceramic tiles have been in the market for a long time making it an overreaching option to certainly try! Bath

5) Victorious Vinyl

Source

Easy-peasy-lemon-squeezy- yes, that’s what vinyl sheets are all about! They require the least amount of labour and skill without compromising on the final output. Vinyl floorings have a widespread variation in colours, designs, patterns and can imitate the look of the most exotic stone at pen-third its price. It’s the most suited type of flooring for kids’ bathrooms and can also be used elsewhere.

6) Boisterous Bamboo

Source

Comparatively new in the market, bamboo floorings are slowly catching up to their name with everything that they have to offer. Bamboo is eco-friendly and easy on the pocket proving to be ideal for the bathroom. Its docile availability and easy repair makes it perfect for that rustic yet contemporary look.
title: Tips to Nail that Ideal Bathroom Flooring

subtitle: ‘Man needs colour to live; it's just as necessary an element as fire and water.’ Fernand Leger beautifully put forward these words which have a very apt meaning in our day to day life and we must pay attention to the divine abilities of these colours.
description:
1) Raging Reds

Source

Reds are mighty and bossy! They really have the ability to excite you and get you going. This is one reason why all fast food chains have predominantly red interiors. Red, if done right, can really add that extra edge to a space. It can be used in areas which are not used for prolonged hours like our living rooms. Balance the eccentricity of reds with neutral colours like whites or greys and your sanity will be in your own hands.

2) Mellow Yellows

 Source

Yellows are such happy cheery colours and can elevate your mood in a matter of seconds. They have a very stimulating effect on you giving you an insightful and luminous layer. Yellows can be used in the kitchen spaces with contrasting walls to set a gay pace to the usual hustle-bustle. Aim for a subtle effect with this colour since a little yellow is capable of a massive impact.

3) Opulent Oranges

Source

With oranges, less is always more. Oranges are also prone to deriving immediate responses, hence, mustn’t be used excessively. Slight undertones of oranges set against darker colours compliments its aura. It can be used in a closet space or for accentuating certain niches or corners of the house giving it a very royal outlook.

4) Bashful Browns 

Source

Earthy, modest and low-key, these are the pristine qualities of brown making it such a soothing colour choice. Brown is the staple colour of nature found all around us and is thus characterised as safe as well as stabilized. Thus, this colour is a brilliant choice for bedrooms with hints of gold, white, yellow or orange so as to prevent the brown from looking too boring.

5) Whimsical Whites

Source

Whites, ivories and creams speak a language of heavenly luxury. They are so pure and extravagant at the same time make a sure shot statement. White helps to give a relaxing and soothing effect to the interiors making it one of the leading choices for bathroom spaces. These spaces are meant to relax the mind and body where white plays an inevitable role.

6) Blissful Blues

Source

Blue is the colour of the sky, the oceans and thus has a very tranquil quality attached to it. It’s a peaceful colour appropriate for study areas as it provides an environment for concentration and point-on focus. And nonetheless, blue is such a beautiful colour! One could never go wrong with the might of blue.
title: Get your Colour-play Right with a Mindful Dose of these Colours

subtitle: False ceilings or suspended ceilings are becoming a growing rage due to their aesthetic appeal and availability. They’re beautiful and alluring, capable of winning many hearts. The ceilings are that part of the house which are often neglected.
description:
False ceilings can be done in an array of materials to hide those ugly nooks. Look at this wooden panel ceiling for instance, it’s such a classy option to hide those light holders. These ceilings efficiently conceal ducting wires and other irregularities to give the surface a smooth finish.

Source

Suspended ceilings in the bath spaces are very popular. Irrespective of that, these ceilings must be done in a way to control the humidity. Play with different levels of the ceiling and light fixtures to take your bathroom to a whole different dimension. Perforated ceilings work best to absorb the moisture content in bath spaces.

Source

Sometimes false ceilings aren’t used for concealing but merely for the beautification purpose of a space. Geometric designs look the best in such a setting. All white ceilings and walls with complimenting fixtures and floorings prove to be a stellar choice like this one. Addition of false ceilings also tend to make the AC units for effective and the volume of the room drops.

Source

Moving a little away from crisp lines and angles, asymmetric ceilings add a whole new level of drama. They’re the perfect choice for commercial spaces like cafes and restaurants! Such ceilings can be fitted with light fixtures along the periphery to partially focus on the ceilings since it itself becomes a piece of art.

Source

How about using your false ceilings to just delicately add a starry light effect to your interiors? Well, this setting is totally dreamy. Suspended glass tiles fitted with lights add transparency and luminosity to the room. Easy to pull off, such an option is a front runner.

Source
title: Dress Up Your Ceilings With All Things Pretty

subtitle: Inspiring and entertaining, some TV shows have always managed to hold a very special place in our hearts. Even after the series has ceased to embrace the TV screens, we hold on to it in our own personal ways.
description:
Getting these famous snippets into our homes is just one way to clench onto their memories and we’d show you exactly how to do that.

1) The Girl-Next-Door

For all you girly girls out there longing for a revolutionary bedroom idea- the answer lies with the ‘Pretty little Liars’ star Hanna Marin! She's your go-to girl with all her style and feminine ways and these traits truly reflect in her bedroom. Be inspired and evoked with her choice of colours and decor and adapt these to your ‘dream room.’ From a subtle choice of the wallpaper to eccentric bed linens, Hanna does it all!

2) From the Land of Winterfell

It’s thrilling, heart-racing and totally addictive! No wonder, the show has us all for a spin! Embracing us with its presence only once a year, it keeps us longing for more. But you could always save a part of it exclusively for yourself and hence, we have the perfect bedroom inspiration for you! Live like your favourite Stark, set amidst a beautiful hilly setting, in a cozy abode full of wooden shenanigans, dim lighting, fireplaces and lots more. Stay warm and safe within your walls opening up to breathtaking views and experience the mellowness this inspiring room as to offer.

3) The ‘Modern’ Family

Source

Full of craziness and unpredictable happenings, the Dunphy family is totally off-beat. It’s a mixture of opposites that functions pretty well when made to pit against each other. This ideology of ‘unity in opposition’ is their USP and the way many small varying elements come together to form the bigger picture is magnificent. Go for contrasting upholstery, quirky wall decor, subtle rugs and dark floorings to imitate this loveable family space where every niche has a story to tell.

4) The Heart of a Home

Source

The kitchen space is definitely the most strong and lively place of a home constantly bubbling with activity. Get Monica’s boisterous kitchen look with its cute cutlery, appealing colours, ambient lighting and those adorable fridge magnets setting the mood right for each day!

5) Class Apart

Source

Classy, edgy and top-notch, this is what marks the beginning of this famous office space from the house of ‘Suits.’ Harvey Specter is not a man of rules and his office is totally up-beat! With crazy basketballs over the mantelpiece and suave furnishings, this office space makes work a lot of fun. Connect with your inner Harvey Specter with such a space and ‘play the man, not the odds!’
title: Favourite Spots from some of our favourite TV Shows!

description:
1) Invest in a great floor mat at the entrance to keep all that outdoor dirt at bay!

Source

2) Get your hands on some scintillating scented candles to liven up your interiors! 

Source

3) Add that dainty floral touch to your home by bringing in a pop of colours!

Source

4) Do away with bulky curtains! Just opt for lighter and sheer curtains to keep your home breezy.

Source

5) Indoor plants are a great option to keep your indoors fresh and damp proof.

Source

6) Add that ‘tinkly’ effect with some eccentric wind chimes.

7) Umbrella stands come in handy when it’s raining and you have guests over.

Source

8) A cozy couch is perfect for you to snuggle in and read your favourite book.

Source

9) A cup of hot chocolate isn't a bad idea either!

Source

10) And lastly, a glorious window to stand by and enjoy the pouring rain outside.  Just hang in a lantern or add a beautiful flower pot to create a cozy nook!

Source
title: 10 Hacks to prep up your home for the monsoons!

subtitle: History has a way of catching up with us and it’s not always creepy. No, this isn't a 7th Grade history lesson but a rather intriguing twist to the classic era.
description:
1) Gothic Glory

Pointed arches, ribbed vaults and the sheer monumentality of this kitchen has struck the right chords basking in the glorious gothic times. Use of timber and the playful utilization of light brings alive the 12th Century with a youthfully modern twist worthy of great inspiration. Steal this kitchen idea with its sleek counters and use of colour to add a tinge of ‘history’ to your abode.

 Source

2) Bathe in Byzantine

The Byzantine period is remarkable for its mosaic work and rich natural colours. It is loud and highly ornamented which gives it a royal dimension. One wouldn't want to stop admiring such a piece of art that has beautifully accentuated this byzantine inspired bathroom space. With a storage niche in the form of a dome to its eccentric blue decor, this bathroom space speaks a fluent language of luxury. 

Source

3) Of Neanderthals and Prehistoric Times

Source

Even though we’ve come a long way from the prehistoric times, stone and river rocks still work their magic with the undue versatility they have to offer. Make use of pebbles and rustic looking rocks to provide a focal point to your outdoor garden landscape. Fountains, seating arrangements, decorative features, pathways- the possibilities are endless.

4) Raving about Renaissance

Source

Glorifying the rebirth of the classical periods, the renaissance is a revival of Greek and Roman times characterised by its use of scale and proportion, the classical orders with their lines and angles along subtle hues. This living area translates along the lines of renaissance perfectly with its earthy colours against a predominantly off-white canvas and its grandeur. Be impelled to try and bring this perception of a living room to your home and enhance its aura.

5) Baroque Bedrooms

The tales of the Baroque period are nothing less than moving! Its influences are seen both in art and architecture making it a style that has been imitated endlessly. This Baroque style bedroom pictured by its curves, arches and manipulation of light, is a marvel. The French baroque style furniture in white leather is absolutely opulent and deserves a spot in your home decor endeavours.
title: A Blast From The Past- Bring the ancient times back with these inspirational spaces!

subtitle: Prints are so much fun! These happy little creatures can accentuate any dull piece of article or any doleful corner adding vibrance to the overall outlook of a space.
description:
There are so many prints to opt for and so many ways to do it that it’s perfect for experimentation!

 1) Doing it the Aztec Way

Source

Aztec prints are part of the glorious history of Aztec tribes that’s making a welcoming comeback due to its pleasant and rich appeal. Nothing better than dressing your floor up with a magnificent Aztec rug! Any kind of fixture would look amazing resting over it. Go for a rich colour scheme of youthful colours and nail that Aztec look!

2) Sailing through the Nautical Prints

Source

Nautical prints are such calm entities that they truly make you relive everything that has got to do with the ocean. They're also sassy and elegant at the same time! No wonder they look lovely adorning your living area. Give this space a fresh mix of nautical cushion covers, nautical colours and upholstery to enlighten it. Poised and finessed, the end result would be breathtaking!

3) Floral Fables

Source

Flirty and feminine, floral prints have a direct way of connecting to nature. They are absolutely stunning and can add that extra ounce of glam to your decor. Go for a floral bed canopy to liven up your bedroom and pair it with contrasting colours and patterns such that the floral print remains the front runner. Keep the walls of solid colours and predominantly light to avoid very loud interiors.

4) Cheerful Chevrons

Source 

Chevrons are just a more uptown version of the classic zig-zag pattern gaining renowned fame and acceptance with its quirky moods. We can’t help but love how chevron looks so pretty as sofa upholstery. Black and white chevron with a teal cushion- that’s a lethal combination! Chevron prints are a perfect target for younger generations and can be used in the study areas effectively. 

5) Glorifying Geometry

Source

Geometrical prints are safe yet versatile helping to add a subtle level of sophistication to your interiors. Dressing up your walls in geometrical prints is a brilliant choice to cut down on the monotony of sequential spaces. subtitle: Ever wondered if your room says something about you? Are certain colours really ‘your’ colours? Would you have been a little less of a control freak if you weren't born in a certain month? Maybe or maybe not!
description:
Zodiac signs really have a way of crawling back to you in some way or the other. Believe it or not, some zodiac traits are always present in you and reflect at certain times and situations. Find out what kind of space is truly yours and move closer to discovering yourself further!

1) The Alluring Aries (March 21- April 19)

The boisterous fire sire, Aries, tend to be creative, insightful and ambitious. They're independent and like their surroundings to represent just that. Since an Aries stands for the colour red, they like that fierce and fire like element to speak for them.

Source 

2) The Tantalising Taurus (April 20- May 20)

Taureans are down to earth and loving signs. They tend to be stubborn and want things their way. Sometimes, they also tend to be dependent on others to make decisions in their lives. Green being the colour of this Earth sign, it provides the sign with that necessary harmony to function. They also love the company of roommates in lieu of their ‘dependent’ traits.


Source

3) The Generous Gemini (May 21- June 20)

Flexible, talkative and humorous, Geminis are full of life!  This ‘air’ sign, ruled by the colour yellow, is cheerful. Sometimes showing aspects of duality to their nature, a Gemini shows many traits of its ‘twin’ symbol. Their surroundings are predominantly multifunctional with a chirpy and bubbly aura.


Source

4) The Calm Cancer (June 21- July 22)

This calm, gentle and loving water sign is the perfect family person. Cancerians tend to be emotional beings. They happen to be conservative and hence, are pretty good at hiding their feelings. Governed by the colour white, Cancerians prefer to sometimes be in their own company.

Their immediate environment is inviting and adoring just like their personality.

Source

5) The Loyal Leo (July 23- Aug 22)

Speak of luxury and power, the sign that comes to picture is the proud Leo! Leos tend to live in the comfort of utmost opulence. Irrespective of the hard and egoistic shell, a leo is actually quite a softy at heart! They're driven by orange and golden hues that bring out a sense of extravagant living.

Source 

6) The Vivacious Virgo (Aug 23- Sep 22)

The perfectionists by nature, Virgos strive to learning and excel. They are focused and ambitious, proving to be great teammates at work and otherwise.  Blue is a Virgo’s colour and they prefer to have their surroundings spic and span!

Source

7) The Lovely Libra (Sep 23- Oct 22)

Epitomizing the quality of balance, Libras are kind, fair and artistic. Libras tend to surround themselves with harmony, peace and beauty. Pastel green is the colour of this air sign, symbolizing its balance with the natural environment.

Source

8) The Scintillating Scorpio (Oct 23- Nov 22)

Bold, mysterious and dark. Scorpios are one of the most passionate signs! This water sign is determined and has an unshakeable focus. Scorpions also enjoy alone time and powerful gold is their colour. Aiming for a certain level of secrecy, scorpions don't like to reveal too much and this shows in their interiors. Minimalist yet classy is a mantra that they stand by.

Source

9) The Serene Sagittarius (Nov 22- Dec 21)

Sagittarians are true fire signs. Their temper quickly escalates and cools off at the same pace. They are a little philosophical about their views and tend to be impatient. They have an unmatched wit and are driven by the colour turquoise. Sometimes irresponsible and restless, Sagittarius are great adventure seekers.

Source

10) The Caring Capricon  (Dec 22- Jan 19)

High on organization, Capricorns are intellectual signs who believe in practicality. They do not appreciate change but would rather stick to mundane routines. This Earth sign also derives its colour from the depth of the ground making it attracted towards browns. They are disciplined and like their surroundings to reflect structure and systematic arrangements.

Source

11) The Amazing Aquarius (Jan 20- Feb 18)

Proud owners of poetic and artistic qualities, this sign is a free spirit! Aquarius is assertive and love to experiment with quirky ideas. This air sign adapts to the colour of the sky and requires a sense of space in their lives. They are always looking forward in life and open to fresh perspectives that enrich their individuality. Open spaces and roomy interiors are totally their thing!

Source

12) The Preppy Pisces (Feb 19- March 20)

The true dreamers, this water sign is honest, low-key and sometimes gullible. Pisceans are a favourite amongst their friends and are very compassionate. Sea green being their colour, this sign truly sticks to its origins. Raw and simple, their surroundings are also plain yet appealing.

Source
title: What Does Your Zodiac Say About Your Room Style Quotient?

Also know as the mother-in-law’s tongue, it has a high tolerance to fluctuations in sunlight and is docile to water. Personally, we are in awe of the climber variety since they make for such pretty hanging pots. They must be watered regularly such that the soil is moist at all times. subtitle: Had a crazy party last night? Don't know what to do with all the empty bottles? Don't fret it because you can totally utilise those bottles and turn them into glasses to be the star of your next party.
description:
Source

Materials Required

  • Old Beer/Vodka Bottles
  • String
  • Lighter/Matchbox
  • Flammable material like Nail Polish Remover
  • Tub
  • Ice Cold Water
  • Sandpaper
  • Kitchen Mittens/Gloves
  • Scissors

Once you've gathered all the materials, begin with the creation-

  • Take the empty bottle and mark the area where you want the cut.
  • Tie the string around this area. Make it go around the bottle several times and secure with a knot.
  • Cut off the extra string with the help of a pair of scissors.
  • Gently take off this loop and soak it in some nail polish remover. Make sure that the entire surface is covered with the remover.
  • Once done, put the loop back onto the bottle.
  • Quickly fill some ice cold water into a tub and be ready with your mittens.
  • Keeping the bottle over the tub, light the string on fire with a lighter.
  • As the string catches fire, rotate the bottle for 30-40 seconds so that the fire evenly spreads around.
  • Then, immerse the bottle into the cold water.
  • Once it strikes the surface of water, the bottle will crack on its own along the string area.
  • Incase the cut is too uneven, you can repeat the process again.
  • Too make the edges of the glass smooth and fit for drinking, grab a sandpaper and rub it over the edges to make it even.

You can do this trick with a variety of vodka and beer bottles. The key to this is patience! You might not get an even cut in one go but 2-3 tries will definitely be worth the hardwork!
title: DIY: Turn Leftover Beer Bottles into Glasses

subtitle: Cupboard drawers could really be such a boring thing to deal with. But what if we tell you that you could upcycle these products and turn them into absolutely crazy stuff? Yes, you can easily make magnetic pinboards out of these drawer sets.
description:
Source

Add some glamour to your living room or study areas!

Materials Required

  • Old drawer
  • Aluminium Sheet
  • Metal Cutter
  • Quirky Fabric
  • Measuring Tape
  • Marker
  • Fabric glue
  • Fevibond

Be careful with the metal sheet and take care of yourself at all times.  This is a clever DIY and will make for a stunning piece to adorn your spaces-

  • Start by measuring the inner dimensions of the drawer.
  • Carefully mark these dimensions on the aluminium sheet with the help of a marker.
  • Now take the metal cutter and cut along the marked dimensions.
  • Keep the metal sheet aside.
  • Take the fabric and cut it such that it’s able to wrap along one face of the sheet and has some extra fabric to fold over to the other side.
  • With some fabric glue in hand, fix the ends of the fabric. Secure the fabric over the aluminium without wear and tear.
  • Now that the sheet is covered, fix it into the drawer with some more fabric glue. Fevibond may be used to additionally stick the sheet to the inside of the drawer.

Your pinboard is now ready. You can either hang it on the wall with the help of metal clamps or allow it to rest on your mantelpiece. Either way, it’ll make for an alluring attraction!
title: DIY- Upcycle Old Drawers to Make Magnetic Inboards

subtitle: Wondering what to do with those old silverware that you’d never take out otherwise? We have the perfect solution for that! Turn your silverware into keyholders for that quirky interior spot.
description:
Source 

Materials Required

  • Silverware
  • Thin cylindrical rod
  • Hot water
  • Container
  • Fevibond/ Furniture adhesive
  • Wooden block/ Plank
  • Acrylic Paint
  • Brass hangers

Silver is easier to work with, hence, its prefered over stainless steel. Get your materials in hand and start with the magic-

Firstly, take a container and pour water into it. Let it boil over high flame. While it’s boiling, put the silverware into the container to make it soft.

Once the silverware is soft, try bending it by placing a cylindrical rod in between such that the end of the silverware wraps around the rod.

Your spoons and forks are now ready to be reborn as keyholders.

Meanwhile, take the wooden plank or block and paint over it to give it a funky look.

Once it’s dry, glue the brass hangers to the back of the plank/ block in order to provide for a hanging mechanism.

Next, take the bent silverware and glue it to the plank/block with the help of a strong adhesive.

Voila! Your unique keyholders are now ready! Since the silverware is only glued, it’ll be a good idea to not burden them with heavy weights. Keep it light to make these creations last longer.
title: DIY- Upcycle Old Silverware to Make Keyholders
