subtitle: The correct orientation of your room has a crucial role to play in how your room would behave in the long run.
description:
The correct orientation of your room has a crucial role to play in how your room would behave in the long run. You wouldn't want your room to be too sunny during odd hours of the day neither too dull and dark when you need it to be sunny. To come out of such loopholes, it is wise to align your rooms in a certain manner so that you can make great use of everything that nature has to offer to us. Dim light, direct light or diffused light — light here is the guiding force.

1) North-Facing Rooms

Rooms having their longer axis aligned towards the north tend to be the darkest rooms with the most diffused light. This is perfect for artists and painters. This light is also great as diffused light gives a very soothing and calming effect to the inhabitants. North-facing rooms are comparatively cooler and to add splashes of warmth to it, you could go for a warm colour scheme.

Source

2) South-Facing Rooms

Brimming and brewing with brightness, south facing rooms dazzle with sunlight the most. These rooms receive the most amount of sunlight from late morning to noon. The sunlight here is consistent and crisp casting sharp shadows. For such rooms, you would want to go for softer colours and delicate decor since the bright light already energises things a lot. You would not want to cross the line of hyperactivity with warm colours hence, go supple.

Source

3) East-Facing Rooms

Rising with the Sun itself, east facing rooms receive abundant natural light during the early morning. Areas that require the first rays of the sun should be made to face the east. Spaces in your home like the temple would be perfect for this orientation. Also, if you like to wake up early, you bedroom could be aligned along this axis. These rooms remain cool from late morning onwards. Therefore, a warm colour palette would be perfect to balance out the hues here.

Source

4) West-Facing Rooms

Harshest of them all, west facing rooms receive the most scorching sun throughout the day. Rooms that do not require to be used for predominant hours of the day should be made to open up in the West. West facing rooms can also be kept cool with more neutral colours like whites and creams.

Source

There are also certain tips that you can keep in mind if you are in the process of designing your dream home-

  • Try and align the longer axis of your home in the East-West Direction to make maximum use of nature.

  • Windows on the northern side prove tone most beneficial whereas windows on the western side is something you must steer clear of until absolutely necessary.

  • Rooms that require activity throughout the day like the kitchen and the living area must be aligned towards the sun.

  • Landscape features must be planned in such a way that they do not hider the path of natural light.
title: How Orientation Can Help Give Your Room A Totally Different Aura

description:
As a child, I've always seen my mother surrounded by candles, flowers and everything pretty. She rests her faith in the power of positive vibes and finds herself to be most creative in an environment that's beautiful. I second that. So for my first DIY Project, I decided to make this gorgeous potpourri-inspired, candle-in-a-jar which brings together all those elements which turns a house into a beautiful home.

What you’ll need :

  • Glass Jar
  • PotPourri Pink Strawberry 100G (http://www.itsybitsy.in/store/life-style-products/potpourri/potpourri-pink-strawberry-100g-pb-ib)
  • PotPourri Purple Lavender 100G (http://www.itsybitsy.in/store/life-style-products/potpourri/potpourri- purple-lavender-100g-pb-ib)
    • Craft Glue
  • Scissors
  • Golden Ribbon (Gota)
  • Scented Candles

 

How to make it:

  • Take a glass jar of the size you desire. You could either buy one or use the old jars at your home.
  • Use the dry leaf from the PotPourri pack and stick it onto the glass jar using a craft glue (or feviquick alternatively) to create a peeping window-like-frame for your candle inside.
  • Now pick up the PotPourri pieces one after the other and patiently glue them around the leaf first and slowly cover the entire jar with them.

 

  • Once that is done and dusted, take the golden ribbon or gota and cut it slightly greater than the circumference of the neck of the jar just enough to be able to tie it into a bow around it.
  • Also make sure the breadth of the ribbon matched that of the neck of the jar.
  • Fix the golden ribbon using the craft glue and tie it into a neat bow.

Place the scented candle into your jar and there you have it, simple and so pretty. I think this little jar candle would fit perfectly in any corner of your home. They’d surely make the best gifts too. I definitely wouldn’t mind receiving one! What do you think?

project by: Era Tangar

photos by: Priyadarshi Kinth

inspired by : Rahul Adhikari
title: Jar Candle

subtitle: Where do you find that inspiration to create an extravagant and stylish space? A Tasteful, well-curated homely ambience that screams YOU. Perhaps a little from the Magazines, a bit from the blogs and definitely a lot from your dearest — Pinterest.
description:
Where do you find that inspiration to create an extravagant and stylish space? A Tasteful, well-curated homely ambience that screams YOU. Perhaps a little from the Magazines, a bit from the blogs and definitely a lot from your dearest — Pinterest.

Your house is your story. The things you love, your memorabilia, your bunch of crazies, your heart — all contained in this beautiful place called home. This series is set to unveil the living spaces of Delhiites and their stories; people like you and me. Those who have instinctively reckoned what makes their dwellings mirror the essence of their true self, whether it's an apartment, a standalone house or even just their room!

Hereafter, we’ll be featuring a ‘House Of Delhi’ every week. We hope you find them to be as inspirational as we do!

On the 13th of July, while the rain battered the roof like a hail of bullets, we somehow managed to make it to Shubhneet Kohli’s sprawling two-storey apartment in Mehrauli. The way to his apartment is a tad-bit deceptive but once you’re in, you wouldn’t wanna leave.

Shubhneet Kohli, a young entrepreneur born and brought up in Delhi, is a die hard lover of the city. He, along with his family, has created this eclectic interior that is both welcoming and in vogue. It’s actually an Airbnb house for now where guests from all over the world come to stay. Shubhneet is a superhost with 5 star reviews on the same. He started off with Airbnb because of his mother. He thought she’d make an exceptionally great host.

“Initially I was a little skeptical about having the apartment here because the location isn’t the finest. The view from the terrace, although, is brilliant. The archeological park, Qutub Minar, ruins of ancient forts and the beautiful apartment itself make up for the location.” Shubhneet explained. “In Mehrauli lies a treasure trove of historic sights to satisfy the spirit. It is one of the oldest areas of Delhi and possess the true flavour of the city.” he added. 

These classy movie posters in his place have an interesting story behind them. Shubhneet happened to spot one of these at a shop in GK-1, M-Block. While checking out the poster, he found an inscription on the back which read, ‘I DID THIS’ along with a phone number under it. Being a movie enthusiast, he called up the number and got in touch with the man, who’s based in Kolkata and designs these posters. Then all he had to do is, tell him the exact scene he wanted from his favourite movies and that's all. Who said magic isn’t real? 

Shubhneet’s stunning terrace garden is home to a variety of flowers, plantations, creepers, colours and statement pieces with a vintage feel to them. As soon as you enter the garden, the majestic view leaves you dazed.  The antique chairs and tables impart that “vintage glam” to the garden.

What is your favourite spot in the house?
“Definitely the terrace garden. Mr Sehgal, the ex CEO of Philip Morris and my neighbour, share the garden space. He has made a major contribution to the way the garden looks and feels. He lives a royal life and extravagance is his thing. And hence, the lavish garden. He gets all the plantations from his farmhouse, keeps making unique additions and improvising from time to time.”

Ample seating, gorgeous lights, colours and greenery in all its glory, the views and the immense peace -- sometimes it's the small details that make the most impact.

What is the best way to know your neighbours?

 “Go for a walk. Explore the galis. Cycle. Play in different parks. It is sad how parents today are overprotective of their kids. But that is also because of the image of Delhi they have in their minds. I, as a kid, have travelled in all kinds of transports on my own and that is how I got to know the feel of the city. There is something so mystic and beautiful about Delhi and it’s people.One must always try to keep it alive and never stop exploring.”

Any secrets about the city you think we should know about?

“One of the secrets would be Jamali-Kamali, a haunted place right in the middle of the archeological park. The other would be Dramz Whisky Bar. They sell all kinds of whisky but do not promote themselves because they are happy with their own secret clientele.”

Thank you Shubhneet for the lovely tour.

We look forward to sharing another home visit with you soon and we hope you consider leaving a little note here on this post, sharing any thoughts you might have about this beautiful, inspiring space. It means a lot!

 

Photography: Priyadarshi Kinth.
title: Houses Of Delhi — Shubhneet Kohli’s| Terrace garden love

subtitle: Bohemians are always full of surprises and manifest trends with great panache. Scroll down to the free spirits signs that you might be one of.
description:
Pattern. Colours. Cozy Corners. Distinct curios. Eclectic style. And some more patterns.
Bohemians are always full of surprises and manifest trends with great panache. Scroll down to the free spirits signs that you might be one of.

1) These moroccan lamps and light fixtures are not just restricted to the occasions of Diwali and Christmas to you. 

2) The colourful Ralli quilt from Rajasthan and Gujarat adorns just about everything at your home, from cushion covers to coffee tables, beds and even the walls.

3) Your walls are either intricately hand painted with a vintage feel to them or you simply rest your case by hanging a vivid, graphic tapestry because empty, dull walls just ain’t your thing.

4) You are doing it the royal way when it comes to cabinets. So. Much. Vintage Glam.

5) In this selfie struck world, you choose mirrors. And guess what’s better than one mirror on a wall? Ten mirrors on a wall. Positive Bro.

6. Plants are like your little babies. The closer they are to you, the better you feel. Also, more is always the best option.

7) You love patterned poufs. They fit in just about any space of your home and set that perfect boho-ambience just the way you like it!

8) You’re a sucker for hand-made things and thus — dreamcatchers. A dash of pretty-little-vibrant-hand-crafted owls here and there sets the right temperature for melting that bohemian heart of yours.

Sounds like your style?

We created this striking palette of home decor items that will gratify the bohemian bit of your Indian heart. You can check these out and many more here.

Also, let us know about your personal styles that may not fit any genre at all. We are suckers for thou pristine taste.
Until next time ... XOXO

subtitle: Nikhila Ahuja is the epitome of liveliness. This Delhi based cake artist and an MBA in Marketing firmly believes that if one’s desire is strong enough, they can turn even their biggest, craziest dreams into reality.
description:
Nikhila Ahuja is the epitome of liveliness. This Delhi based cake artist and an MBA in Marketing firmly believes that if one’s desire is strong enough, they can turn even their biggest, craziest dreams into reality. Just like she did. “Me and Annie, my partner in this sinful crime, are homebakers. They say creativity is a way of life, we made it ours.” she tells me gleefully.

 

“Life is best lived with simplicity.”

From the moment you step into her bedroom, you feel like you already know her. Her space is impeccably appointed and has this creative charm and warmth despite being simplistic. 

“This room was a dump room until five years back, when I decided to tell my dad that I wanted a separate room to myself, because all the other rooms were otherwise connected. We were anyway wasting this space so why not utilise it. It took me around five months to push my dad into getting this room done up. Finally, we called an architect and told him what we wanted the room to look like. The designs he had made were way too jazzy for my taste. So we redesigned it to our preference which was something very basic, simple, and subtle. I and my dad were involved in each and every step. We kept giving our inputs at all points of time till we finally came up with this design.” 

The pretty little things in her room add oodles to the fun quotient of her personality. Whether its the vintagey miniature cabinet she got from The Tip Top market in Karol Bagh or a miniature tea set which she found beautifully wrapped in an old drawer that her Badi Amma had got for her from Bangkok years ago.

What caught the attention of my wandering eyes (like they do when in a wonderland), was the fabulous and colourful vision board. She had a number of pictures of Yeh Jawaani Hai Deewani on it along with lots of notes, personal pictures, Christmas bells, little lady-bug-thumbtacks that one of her friends got for her from London and a special date. So Prettaay! 

“A lot of these ideas came from Bollywood movies. I am a die hard fan of romantic bollywood movies. All my friends tell me that I am DDLJ [Dilwale Dulhania Le Jaayenge] personified. This cage is actually inspired by Konkana Sen’s huge cage from the movie, Wake Up Sid. I wanted the same but couldn’t find it so, I got this miniature version of it.” 

“The Butterflies, the message in the bottle, all infuse marvellously well rendering an aura of fairytales, which also played an immense role for giving the room its persona.”

“I am very fond of cozy homes. Like very very fond of them. The only thing I miss in this room is an attached bath and a little kitchen otherwise this is my house for me. It gives me space to do my own cakework too. I bake in the kitchen but all the creative play of it takes place right here.”

Perfecting the art of personalisation, Nikhila’s room had these endless little surprises that didn’t cease to amaze as I browsed through the nooks and crannies. The customised “whatsapp-kiss-smiley” cushion, the paper weight tortoise, the gorgeous lights embellishing one of the alcove of her room (from Chandigarh), The “Best friend” flower that she bought for herself, her memory drawer which was more like a treasure box.

“I love reading books. I am reading four of them right now. What To Say To Yourself When You Talk To Yourself - Shad Helmstetter, The Power Of Your Subconscious Mind by Joseph Murphy, The Vortex: Where the Law of Attraction Assembles All Cooperative Relationships  by Esther Hicks & Jerry Hicks and The Power Is Within You by Louise L. Hay.”

Thank you Nikhila for glorifying a few moments of our lives with this lovely bedroom tour.

We look forward to sharing another home visit with you soon and we hope you consider leaving a little note here on this post, sharing any thoughts you might have about this beautiful, inspiring space. It means a lot to us!

Also if you have a house in your mind that you’d like to see featured here, shoot up an e-mail to era@zimply.in right away.

XOXO
Credits// Author: Era Tangar. Photography: Priyadarshi Kinth.
title: Houses Of Delhi — Nikhila Ahuja’s| The Cake Lady’s Bedroom|

subtitle: Bright colours, beautiful pieces and lots of warmth surrounds the Bakshi’s. Their source of positive energy changes with the season of their lives but the intensity of it is never compromised.
description:
Bright colours, beautiful pieces and lots of warmth surrounds the Bakshi’s. Their source of positive energy changes with the season of their lives but the intensity of it is never compromised. Located in the calm and serene society of Vikas Kunj, Delhi, their cozy house proves that one doesn’t need a lot of space to create a welcoming, multidimensional expanse where dreams come true.

 

The charm of this wonderful home is reflected beautifully by its creators, a family of four — Mr. Bakshi, Mrs. Bakshi and their two sons, Abhimanyu and Anubhav, who have taken care of every intricate detail with love synonymous of a mother’s and their home being the child, it is so evidently conspicuous.


Come, Take a look!

Watch this video to have a better look at their abode.

“It is small but it’s perfect and just the right size. When it comes to big houses, cleanliness and maintenance is a big issue. At our age, when we are turning 50, and are working, we wouldn’t want to come home and clean the house. We would want someone to be there and help us out. But with a small house, we can do it ourselves, we don’t need an entire entourage to help us.” says the lively Mrs. Bakshi, who happens to love the company of kids and has served as a teacher for several years and now manages a cafeteria at a prominent school in Delhi.

It was so soothing to see how all those details, each with their own little tale to tell, had been put together so harmoniously. Everything seemed to fuse flawlessly with another.

The impeccable doll set. The dragons from Thailand. The plate with the picture of the ship in which the British came to India. The cups Abhimanyu bought from the airport whose box had an interesting piece of history written over it. And the tea sets from Russia and China, everything was absolutely exquisite and shiny like a brand new piece of jewellery. “My parents love tea, they drink it five times a day.” says Abhimanyu with all the seriousness that he could possibly muster.

“Me and my husband are passionate about decorating our house. Normally both of us go shopping but won’t buy something until and unless it hits the bull’s eye. We can get a little choosy but then that is how we are.”

When asked about her source of inspiration for decorating her place, Mrs Bakshi says,“My inspiration comes from within me. Just keep your place clean and unique. It has to spic and span. Like how one has a body that they get from God and you have the responsibility to take care of it, the same thing applies to your home as well. I also derive inspiration from hotels and professional pictures. It is completely dependent on how you feed your eyes which are accustomed to see beautiful things around. It has to be colourful and cozy.”

“We have been in this society for as long as I remember. I was born in a different house in the same society but we moved in this house in 2000. This drawing room was actually the garage earlier, we took the place and converted into a drawing room. And the living room was actually a bedroom.” Abhimanyu said.

“All this stuff is pure crystal from Russia. Some of these things are Limited Edition like the Big Beer container. My father used to travel to Russia back in the 90’s and the 2000’s and at that point of time he was working for first logistics Indo-Russian Venture. He used to travel a lot and he used to buy a lot of alcohol and a lot of stuff related to alcohol and the irony is that my Dad does not drink. He literally cannot have more than two beers. He is a curator. He loves to collect because he’s fascinated with the bottles and the packing. Fun Fact: In Russia they don’t have 30 or 60 ml, they have 50 and 100 so that’s actually a patiala and super patiala.” says Abhimanyu amusingly.

Abhimanyu and his mother then got this huge tub of toys. The Dino Clan, the Vilma from the The Flintstones and so many other. Nostalgic indeed. “Everytime their dad came back from Russian, even if these kids were deep asleep late at night or early in the morning, they’d know their dad is here and would jump like monkeys just for these chocolate eggs called KinderJoy.”  Mrs Bakshi tells me laughingly.

“I and my dad, we love watching movies. My dad used to come to Delhi from Ambala just to watch movies, back in the days. I always wanted a home theatre but I always thought that my house is too small for it. Last year when me and my mum were travelling to Bangalore for 10 days to see my brother, Anubhav, I asked my dad to get the home theatre constructed after I had already pitched the idea to him earlier. And he got it done! It costed us around ₹5 Lakhs but it was definitely worth it. These recliner are the same as the Director’s seat. Mother India is my mom’s favourite and Rush is mine. My dad really like The Good, Bad and Ugly and hence the ongoing cowboy theme.” Abhimanyu explains.

The Home Theatre was certainly something to die for but the washroom of the home theatre took the centre stage. The ceiling posters, the crafty little things, the movie poster, the restroom didn’t look like a restroom to me. Mind Blown!

Abhimanyu’s Bedroom was equally well equipped as the rest of the house with statement pieces which were indeed a delight to look at. Abhimanyu happens to be a very creative person himself, which he says he got from his parents. He also derives his inspiration from Pinterest, Etsy and other sites like those.

“I am trying to make this charging box out of a shoe box. I am still yet to personalise it. I like to make things myself rather than buying it.”

“Even with the bottle lamp,I wanted to this specific comic book lamp which I could have bought for about ₹2500 but then I couldn’t find it online. The one I found was for about 5 grands so I just made one.”

“My parents are big time gardeners so thats why it is in my blood to buy things for the house but then I also love to make things. I like to make things myself rather than buying it.” says Abhimanyu gleefully.

Whilst it rained cats and dogs that evening in Delhi, Abhimanyu told me that he and his Dad are Bikers from heart. They love their Bikes. Hence the garage was decorated with so much finesse that manifested absolute ethereal joy. “We built these biker-themed-cabinets from scratch. We are very handy people. We love to make thing.” Abhimanyu tells.

We would like to thank the Bakshi’s for this incredible House tour. It was truly a delight.

We hope you guys loved it as much. We look forward to sharing another home visit with you soon and we hope you consider leaving a little note here on this post, sharing any thoughts you might have about this beautiful, inspiring space. It means a lot to us!

Also if you have a house in your mind that you’d like to see featured here, shoot up an e-mail to era@zimply.in right away.
XOXO

Credits// Photography: Priyadarshi Kinth.
title: Houses Of Delhi — The Bakshi’s | Home of Dreams |

subtitle: When I first moved into my rented house in Delhi about three months back, I was way preoccupied to notice how sad and dull the walls of my new room looked.
description:
There are so many of us living in rented houses, PGs and Hostels for long spans of time, missing out on the luxury of living at home and falling short on ways to give our rented spaces the look and the feel that reflects us.
Not anymore. Welcome to The Rental Series. Hereby, we’ll be listing out several ways in which you could give your temporary place a beautiful makeover without causing any damage to the property. 

First up : Walls!

| HEAD BOARDS |

1) Geometric patterns don’t just make a classy statement but they are also in vogue. Craft this stunning headboard with the colours that you fancy. Inexpensive and impressive, it’ll quietly hang on your wall without spoiling it. 

source 

2) Fancy stylish and sophisticated hotel rooms? You could turn yours into one! This exquisite headboard might take little bit of hard work but it can completely change the way the rest of your room looks like. PS : You can get this made too and carry it wherever you shift next. 

source 

3) Now this is definitely something. If you are just way too lazy to do anything, pick up you mum’s old, but pretty duppatta (stole) and hang it above your bed. Simple, and costs nothing. 

source 

| WALL ART |

4) Hex wall art is slowly gaining popularity because even though it takes time, it is sure not as elaborate or complex as the wow factor would assume. You could incorporate floral prints, loads of glitter, or even The Justice League, whatever suits your style.

source

5) This is my favourite. When I stumbled upon this idea, I was sold. If you are a kind of a person who loves having friends over, party and glitter is your middle name, then you must have one of this hanging in my room.

source

6) Nothing can get easier or cheaper than this! You can use these DIY dots to cover one entire wall or just a little area, however you desire. 

 source

| GALLERY WALL |

7) Whenever I look at something like this, I think of old, vintage restaurants from the 1800’s and I love the feel of those. If you do too, get all your favourite old pictures, art and absolutely anything and get them all framed. Arrange them later, as you like it. 

source

8) This is similar to the one above but here you can go ahead and hang your favourite things too and not just the frames. Whether it’s a hat, your treasured necklace or even just your house keys. Anything, like I said.  

source
9) Compliment your Wall of Fame with a mirror! Mirrors never lie and also never fail to look pretty just about anywhere.

source

| POSTERS |

10) If your budget doesn’t allow you to get your favourites framed, do not worry. Get some double tape and fix them on your wall in any fashion. You could also enhance the way they look by outlining them with washi tapes that you can easily find in any craft store nearby.

source

11) If you are a kind of a person who likes the idea of randomness, then you could go with something like this. Cover the entire wall with absolutely everything you like. Remember, it is not a one time thing — it is a process. And it’s more fun like that.

source

12) If you just don’t wanna do anything, I got something for you. Get home a huge poster and cover up your entire wall with it. Looks amazing, promise!

source

| WALL PAPER |

13) If you have the liberty to use wallpapers, you must. Most of these can be easily installed and removed as well without damaging the walls.

source

14) Add dollops of oomph to your walls with this simple yet stylish black and white wall paper. You would definitely never regret this one.

source

15) I am in love with this wallpaper. It is so subtle yet stands out like nothing else. Perfect for people who like to keep it simple and sober.

source

I hope you give these a try and make your living space a homely feel to it.

XOXO
title: The Rental Series : 15 Ways To Transform The Sad Walls Of Your Rented Space

subtitle: Rooftops are often neglected and left to rot away.
description:
People do not realise the vast opportunity that rooftops have to offer. They can be used for an array of purposes and absolutely brilliant spots to come out and relax in. With some easy tips, you would never look at your rooftops the same way.

1) Cozy Corner 

Snuggle and cuddle in this small niche. Listen to music or spend the whole day reading. This rooftop lounging spot is perfect to find your own little escape from the world and its branches. Get set and go with this idea to give your rooftop a pleasant makeover.

Source 

2) Of Beautiful Fairy Lights 

A stunning gazebo amidst the city traffic is just what you need on your rooftop. Bring in some seating counters and dress them up with cushions! It is totally a win-win situation with you in this environment and so many pretty things around you. Host a party or have this place to yourself because it is totally worth showing off, any which way. 

Source

3) The Colour Pop 

This entire setting is a celebration on its own. You do not need the guests neither the party music because the décor takes care of everything. The splashes of colour drive you into a state of enigma and the thought of having this on your rooftop is already making you excited. So throw in some funky décor, some colourful rugs and planters, and dance away in a tune of your own.


Source

4) A Call To Nature 

How about turning your entire rooftop terrace into a mini ecosystem? Yes, you should totally convert your terrace into a terrace garden and give a pleasant shoutout to nature. The lush greens will stand out from a distance and liven up your surroundings.


Source

5) Dive Into Luxury 

It’s time you stop thinking about a rooftop pool and actually implement it in real time. A rooftop pool is a total sign of luxury and if you have a vacant roof, definitely convert into into a pool and bask in the glory of its opulence. 

Source
title: Transform Your Rooftops Into Something Magnificent

subtitle: The four walls of my rented apartment, frankly, look like those of a hospital.
description:
I wonder what the landlords were thinking of as they erected structures they plan to rent out. But then again, there is hardly anything we can do about that. What we can do, though, is find a cheap, quick and easy ways to make our temporary rentals look worth a million dollar buck. And then it occurred to me — CURTAINS!!

From making your space look larger than life, being quick design additions, hiding the ‘Not so pretty alcoves’ of your house to making great doors and walls, curtains are undoubtedly a blessing in disguise.

1) FRILLY DELIGHT 

Windows or no windows, these pretty curtains can be used in a multifaceted manner. Perfect for covering those messy shelves.

source

You can hang these bright, sheer curtains at the entry of the passageway. Go ahead and use one of mum’s old “dupattas” to turn them into curtains.

source 

3) DO IT YOURSELF (CHEVRON)

If you’ve got a little extra time on hand, you must absolutely try these beauties. They look so chic, stylish and add a hint of pattern to your place.

4) HANG ‘EM UP!

Just for the sakes of breaking the monotony of walls, simply hang these patterned curtains on your walls.

source 

5) COVER ‘EM SHELVES

You could give the shelves at home a new twist with some statement curtains and change the way the room looks like.

source 

6) SCARF IT DOWN

You could either buy these exotic beauties or just gather some old scarves at home and sew them up together. The colours and pattern would give an ethereal uniqueness to your room.

Yes! These look soo pretty. I mean can you imagine how simple and brilliant an idea this is. Something to die for, definitely. 

source

8) BOW TO THE BOW 

To add drama to the platter, you can embellish your curtains with pretty bows.

 source | source 

9) LOOPING TWIST

Instead of the traditional, mundane curtain loops, you could add scoops of style to your curtains by hanging them using anchor ropes or wide, pretty ribbons.

 source | source
title: The Rental Series: 9 Ways To Accommodate Curtains In Your Rented Space

subtitle: When I think about a fusion of art, drama, tension, exuberance, and grandeur — Baroque is the first thing that comes to my mind.
description:
It is assumed as a period of artistic style full of intricate details and exaggerated drama. This impressive trend took birth around 1600 in Rome, Italy and slowly spread throughout Europe. 
We’ve listed these super easy-weasy ways to incorporate Baroque into your Home Sweet Home. Come, Take a look!

1) Walls That POP! 

Wallpapers with intricate designs and a tad bit of shimmer is all you need to give your home a touch of Baroque. You could also go for Plaster Of Paris if you really have the time and penchant for art and detailing.

source | source | source

2) This So Floored Me!  

You can’t go wrong with this one. You either opt for designers tiles, Printed wooden floors ( Do It Yourself, Babe — If you can, I mean, no pressure) or simply embellish your floor with a carpet that your dad got you from Persia last year.

source | source | source 

3) Chairy on Top!

This would require a little investment but trust me, it’ll be worth it. You could build your own little Baroque alcove — a corner at home for reading or, well, just chilling.

source | source | source 

4) Mirror Mirror — On the Wall!  

The one very easy way to incorporate baroque in your house is by using mirrors.
It’s easy to find these in all sizes and shapes and put together as many of them as you fancy.

source | source | source

5) Little Things

Bring home cutlery, candle stands, moroccan lamps, flower vases and other little things with a sinuous touch to them. And Voila! Baroque is now under your claw. Meow!

source | source | source

There’s something royal about this beautiful style, it feels almost like a story being told. A story of the known and the unknowns. Adding just a tinge of Baroque can change the way how your home feels and looks and we hope we inspired you enough to see it at your place — telling your story.  

xoxo
title: Drama & Art: 5 Ways You Can Add Baroque Style To Your Home

subtitle: A space that motivates us to go on and calms us down when we get stuck. A space that reflects our mind map and renders a clarity of thought.
description:
Productivity is the time we spend working towards our goals and we might not be in the space that reflects what we stand for, are doing or believe in. Doesn’t that sound wrong? Something that means so much to us and that defines who we are, must have a dedicated space to it. A space that motivates us to go on and calms us down when we get stuck. The space should reflect our mind map and renders a clarity of thought. 

My work space is a fancy makeup box with no makeup in it but, that doesn’t deter my desire to buy all the makeup in the world. Here, I have put together some beautiful and inspiring workspaces that will blow your mind. Check ‘em out!

1) THE ARTIST

Art, patterns, illustrations, colours — All of this compiled so harmoniously together that it almost seems to sing a song of freewill, a song that keeps one going.

source | source

 2) MESH IT UP 

If you are a creative person with a mild OCD, this one is for you. You could organise all your paraphernalia on these pretty meshes and compliment the setting with lights and hues. 

source | source 

3) THE MINIMALIST

Minimalism, when done right, is one of the most pleasing and serene form of setting. Clean, organised and soothing — the perfect combination to make a great workspace.

source | source 

4) THE ECO STATION

If you are a lot like me then you’d know how plants and green life can be a great source of energy and motivation. Plants tend to break the monotony of stills and make the space come alive. 

source | source 

5) KEEP IT SIMPLE, SILLY!

A desk, a chair, a lamp (or if there is natural light, nothing like it), a book and a quiet surrounding. Enough said. 

source | source

6) FASHION FIESTA

If your life is a fashion festival — Celebrate it with amazing fashion posters, mini chandeliers and lots of crazy jewellery. Do not forget the trademark mannequin!

source | source


7) THE KID LIFE

I was surprised how one of my colleagues thought that kids don’t need a workspace. EVERYONE DOES. It is an absolute necessity, especially for the kids. One can certainly help them organise but it is always a good idea to dedicate a space for your kids where they can create and display.

source | source 

8) OUT OF THE BOX!

If you are someone who likes to experiment, you must go ahead and try out these bizarrely beautiful workstations. 

source | source 

9. BREATHE IN THE HUES!

If you are lively person who loves the idea of being surrounded with colours at all times and derive positive vibes out of ‘em - Go for these! 

source | source | source
title: 9 Striking and Inspiring Work Stations

subtitle: Charles Eames, a celebrated architect and furniture designer, has rightly said that details are not the details, they make the design.
description:
The interior designs that managed to leave a lasting impression on me have been ones with fine detailing. All the little elements contribute to one single picturesque panorama. Charles Eames, a celebrated architect and furniture designer, has rightly said that details are not the details, they make the design. 

Door knobs have to be one of those little details that are very conveniently consigned to oblivion by most but  remain an integral part of a  home. According to me, these impeccably little entities hold as much significance as any other piece of furniture. 

Paying a tribute to the same, we have a collection of some of the most beautiful door knobs.

1) A CHIP OFF THE OLD BLOCK

Vintage is timeless. These glamorous knobs establish a strong statement and make you reminisce the sands of time.

source | source | source

2) PATTERNS & COLOURS

These knobs would mingle immaculately with your freshly painted, white doors and cabinets. You must definitely give a shot to those trendy floral printed knobs.

source | source | source

3) THE CRYSTAL FAIRY

Glitter in the vein and a sparkle on the skin, these beauties proffer a splendid enhancement to any door.

source | source

4) SURREALISM

You know the time when people say they are looking out of something different, something out of the world — Well, this is what they are talking about. Art in its purest form.

5) THE GORY DETAILS

Filigiri and a touch of the art of sculpting — a wonderful recipe for a knob that will impart an artistic glow to your home.

source | source | source

7) STICKING TO TRADITIONS

The culture and traditions of India come across through these antique door knobs. Think of petrichor and magnanimity of the Sahyadri — that is what these pieces remind me of.

source | source | source

8) FUN STUFF

Kids would love these fun additions to their cabinets and doors. The wonderful, bright colours would bring any room alive with bustling creative energy.

source | source

subtitle: An inspirational cluster of some of the most beautiful wall art has been displayed before you. They are not only vivid and quirky but also quaint.
description:
“Art disturbs the comfortable and comforts the disturbed.”
Home is your space. A space where you unwind, take your shoes off and think freely. A realm where you are the King. The way your realm looks and feels to you largely depends on what it comprises of. Art is an expression and through it, you set a mood for your kingdom. The one that evokes a feeling in you that undeniably makes your soul happy and completes your home. John Keats’ famous lines say that a thing of beauty is a joy forever, and art is sheer beauty.

An inspirational cluster of some of the most beautiful wall art has been displayed before you. They are not only vivid and quirky but also quaint.

source | source

source | source | source

source | source | source

With all the solid hues and the flavour of the pop culture (the Audrey Hepburn poster from ‘Breakfast At Tiffany’s’ unarguable steals the show for me) — it sets the perfect ambience for a person who is a lively and a happy soul.

Wash rooms should never be mundane. I repeat, never. Afterall we spend some quality self time in there, everyday. The deepest of thoughts and the most important life decisions are made in there. One must take time out to embellish them with some beautiful art.

Human images make a really strong statement and summons powerful emotions in one that, perhaps, are as mesmerising as the dance of a peacock or A R Rahman’s music.

Art in its most simple form can be as complex. Whatever looks good to one's eyes and stirs some good feelings in them is art. All in all, incorporating art into your home decor isn’t rocket science. Whether it is an unusual family portrait, pretty crafts, a tone centric collection fusing flawlessly together to make a gallery wall or simply a few shapes, patterns and words — everything works.

source | source

source | source

An insightful, detailed wallpaper have the power to transcend you to another world.
Doors, too, can be completely transformed into something exceptional with a touch of art.

source

source | source | source

People’s minds astonish me greatly sometimes. The way they think and their manoeuvres leave me speechless. Take a look at these beautiful, smart art pieces.

source | source | source

source | source | source

I believe that there is something magical in the way each and everyone of us express ourselves. Our differences make our lives worth living. These gorgeous home decor entities are unquestionably worth taking a good, long look at.

I hope this left you asking for more. Apart from being a visual treat, I hope this inspired you to make art - a way of life.

subtitle: The kitchen is so much more than just a place to cook. It is where a family bonds and share the events of their day. It is a place where memories are made.
description:
"Gone are the days when kitchens were just kitchens — now they're so pretty they could be any room of the house,” designer Jo Ann Alston told HGTV of her French Normandy-style design.

For all the right reasons, the kitchen is no more just a tiny cut out of space in your home. They are now given utmost importance as they have come to become the family ‘hangout’ space.

While white colour schemes continue to be the top trend right now, along with the knockdown of the wall between the kitchen and the dining hall to maximise spaces, I am quite excited to showcase some playful ways to add colour to the kitchen. The reason being — I am too Indian to have a plain white kitchen.

With all the variety of spices that we Indians use in our cuisine, it is definitely a task to maintain a spic and span white countertop, walls and cabinets. But then again, we don’t have to stick to a boring kitchen.

A lookbook of some of the most charming, colourful kitchen designs have been laid out for you with fresh, interesting techniques — a trend that’s also holding strong.

1) CABINETS & SHELVES

Adding a splash of bright colours to the cabinets  will make you smile every time you step into your kitchen. Make sure the colours that you choose are in sync with the colour theme of the rest of the room.

source

source

source

source

2) BackSPLASH!

Indian kitchens tend to be neutral in their appearance which makes the space look lifeless at times. Adding some colours to the backdrop can do wonders to the way how your kitchen looks and feels like. Pink, Yellow, Green, Red and Blue are some of the popular colours you could go for. Blue and Green offer a calming effect. Yellows exudes optimism and Red instills courage and warmth — both also believed to stimulate the appetite.

source | source

source

Mosaic backsplashes with blissful blazons of turquoise give a feel of a kitchen by the sea.

source | source

source

source | source

3)POTS & PLANTERS

Along with incorporating colour in the backdrop, adding some exotic plants to your kitchen can do more than just make it look prettier. According to studies, the presence of plants make people feel less stressed and more focussed. They also act as air-purifiers and are pretty good absorbents of VOCs (Volatile Organic Compounds) which are harmful to humans when present in large quantities.

source | source

source | source | source

source | source

4) FURNITURE GLOSS

Adding colourful furniture to your kitchen can bring new life to the room. Colour contrasting can come handy in this case. You can decide on the vibe you're going for in your kitchen and then select a color that helps you achieve that look. You could also opt on painting your old furniture giving them a statement makeover.

source

source | source

5) CUTLERY

Cutlery in several shades of hues is a smart and easy way to splatter colour into your kitchen.
They look so classy and cute that one would indubitably take a second look at your fun-lit, dazzling kitchen.

source | source | source

source

source

6) ART ADDITION

Express your artsy self. Not just in you drawing area and bedroom but also the kitchen where you spend most of your quality time. Art is the most wonderful way you can add colour and a bit of you to your cooking space. Afterall the food tastes better when the food artist makes it with a happy heart.



source | source

source | source

7) FLOORS ON FIRE

Floors and ceilings can also be covered with colour to add that drama and fun to your kitchen. Solid hued floors or printed rugs and carpets, anything that compliments the rest of the decor of the kitchen can be incorporated effortlessly.

source|source

source

At the end of the day, the kitchen-dining should reflect the entire family because it’s the space that everyone loves to share. I hope you found some inspiration.

xoxo
title: Kitchen With Colour: Ideas To Splatter Colour All Over Your Indian Kitchen

subtitle: Sapphire, the September birthstone, is said to represent purity of the soul. As a tribute to this beautiful gem, we’ve gathered our favourite home decor ideas on how you can spread the aura of sapphire across your home.
description:
Sapphire, the September birthstone, is said to represent purity of the soul. Blue sapphires, which range from a very light to very dark greenish or violetish blue to various shades of pure blue, is also know to protect your dear ones from grief and wrongdoings. As a tribute to this beautiful gem, we’ve gathered our favourite home decor ideas on how you can spread the aura of sapphire across your home.

There is also an illustration of ideas on what colours would flawlessly fuse with these vivid shades of blue adding a cool, suave charm to your space.

1) THE DEEP BLUE WALL

What a beauty! Who’d imagine sapphire walls could look this splendid. Compliment these walls with contrasting shades of green, blue, yellow (sunflowers would look so pretty), pinks and earthy colours.

source

source | source

source | source | source

source | source

2) COOL BLUE COUCH!

A cozy little space — setting the perfect ambience for a cup of coffee and your favourite book.
Check out that lovely navy blue velvet diwan in all its glorious calm.
Bring the blue into your dining space and pair it up with white for a modern yet classy look.

source | source  

source | source

source | source

3)  THE SEA LIKE FLOORS

You could paint ‘em sapphire, put together some gorgeous blue filigree tiles or just throw on some beautiful rugs — I can assure you, you’d feel nothing less than walking on the sea. White walls alongside will give this look a nautical-debonair sure to make a bold statement.

source | source

source | source

source | source 

4) CUPS & VASES

This is an easy addition that you can make to your home in honour of the September Sapphire. Quick Tip : Gold goes really well with blue.

source | source | source

source | source

source | source | source

5) CABINETS FEELING BLUE!

Vintage and modern cabinets — both have this glamour about them that makes me want to get all of them home. Right away! Use them as dressers, table tops or a piece of art — they all work just fine.

source | source

source | source

6) BEDROOM

Cushions, lamps, stools, paintings, curtains, bedcovers and what not. Splash sapphire wherever and how much ever you like. Give you room a feel of September.

source | source

source | source 

7) THE BLUE INDIAN

The art and culture of India is so diverse, colourful and seamless that it becomes difficult to draw a line. The calm and tranquility that sapphire imparts, has been entrancingly displayed here in different forms.

source

source | source

source | source

source | source

We hope you got a pretty clear idea of how to make sapphire work in your home decor. Let us know in the comments below if you have any similar post suggestions. We’d love to know what you come up with.
title: Bring Home the Aura of September's Birthstone — Sapphire

subtitle: A series of tips and ideas that anyone, with a low budget or otherwise, can use and follow to throw an absolute stunner of a House Warming Party!
description:
I recently moved to a beautiful house in Delhi with three other friends of mine and it has been part fun and part hectic, to be honest. From cleaning , getting a WiFi connection, shopping for various household stuff to decorating the house   — none of it has been easy to pull off.

But it’s finally done! All of our friends have been more excited than us for a house warming party and frankly, we too cannot wait to throw one ourselves. And a really fancy one!

After days of discussion and brainstorming with my friends on the shindig, I was finally able to put up a series of tips and ideas that anyone, with a low budget or otherwise, can use and follow to throw an absolute stunner of a House Warming Party!

1) PARTY INVITATIONS!

Creating a Whatsapp group and inviting people over for a House Warming Party is one way of doing it but where is the fancy in that? I say — send over a pretty, chic invitation card to all your friends. There are a wide variety of printables that you can easily find online to suit your taste. But if you’re on a budget — just DIY! Some of these DIYs are incredibly simple to execute and look priceless + who doesn’t love a personal touch!

If you’re going for a theme party then make sure your invites reflect the same.

source | source | source

source | source

2) | DIVISION OF SPACE |

It is inevitable that a group of 15-20 people at a party would split into several small huddles. In that scenario, a smart move would be to divide the space in your house into small, beautifully lit and decorated seating areas. Make sure you use every part of your house for the same; be it your living room, the kitchen bar, your balcony or your terrace.

source | source | source

If you are a couch person then you could decorate your sofa with some stylish and colour coordinated cushions and pillows. Everyone loves that extra comfort of the pillows!

For a more casual setting, you could have a lot of throw cushions and mattresses.

source | source | source

source | source

3) AROMA & LIGHTS

Smell, they say, is the most powerful sense in humans. Easily forgotten yet the most important — The aroma. Make sure to lit up those wonderful scented candles you have been hoarding since forever for a special occasion. This is the occasion! Make that long-lasting, powerful first impression with a swooning scent of warmth spread across your home.
And if you’re on a budget and fragrant candles and oils aren’t happening anytime soon for you, there are always incense sticks! But this part, you absolutely cannot miss, my friend.

Also, don’t forget to mingle aroma with some good music to go along. Perhaps you can arrange a karaoke or a live band to perform at your place. Perhaps you may request a guitarist friend of yours to play, too. Anything works when it comes to good music. 

source | source | source

source

To impart a party like feel, lights are a big yes - yes! There are innumerable ways you can use lights to decorate your home — Randomly hanging them onto the wall, spiralling them over a hoola-hoop and hanging it as a centre piece, globe lights in mason jars, or lacey or colourful round paper lamps that you may easily find in the local markets. They will add dollops of oomph to your place, make the party come alive and will add a feather to your home along with your cap.

source | source | source

source | source

4) THE FOOD DECOR

Most humans love to eat. Everything they do, at all times, revolves around eating food. Especially social gatherings like these. A corner dedicated to a remarkable arrangement for foods and drinks would certainly make a striking statement, don’t you think?

Whether it’s balloons that you like, flowers that  you fancy or handmade colourful flags, you may take a pick of your absolute favourite!

source | source

source | source | source

Something out of the box is always welcomed and much appreciated. The idea of the chalkboard and a street-cart food arrangement are seamlessly fabulous.

source | source

A party without games is like food without salt. There are a lot of fun game ideas that you can find here.

Also, dedicating a space for a photo booth is an amazing idea. Perhaps you can get a photographer friend (or hire one) to capture the wonderful memories of the day.

source | source | source

5) HOUSE WARMING GIFTS!

My flatmates and I have been wondering forever about the gifts that we would want to receive at our house warming. These things can get really tricky even when it comes to deciding on a house warming return gift. Here are some cool and unique gift ideas that we came up with.

source | source | source

source | source

If you were planning on throwing a house warming party and were a little lost, we hope that this gave you ample clue on how you can easily organise one. If you have any questions or ideas on the same, you can share it with us in the comments below.
XOXO
title: 5 Awesome Tips for Hosting a House Warming Party!

subtitle: This season, the muted pastels are making a sweet comeback with an all new modern and sophisticated glow to them. They inspire and quell the cliched to make way for refined, flattering interiors.
description:
Who you are as a person and how you express yourself defines your style. All of us like to personalize our space in unique ways that matches our style and makes us feel comfy and at home. Trends enhance style. They inspire and quell the cliched to make way for refined, flattering interiors. This season, the muted pastels are making a sweet comeback with an all new modern and sophisticated glow to them. And for good.

From taupe, deep olive, natural beige to hints of mauve and baby pink — these shades have been fairly understated for quite sometime now but they hold the vigour to make diverse elements of your home work flawlessly together.
Modern. Classy. Balanced. Find the finesse these tones carry in different parts of your home and seek inspiration.

source

source | source | source

The gallery wall in the picture below is a fabulous example of how one can follow a trend and their unique style at the same time. Brilliant! Don’t you think?

With designer furnitures coming in uniques shapes and colours, boast over some quirky chairs, cabinets, vases and cutlery displayed at your home leaving that lasting impression on your friends and guests.

Muted pastels can be incorporated into your home also in the form of some easy DIY projects and gigantic art pieces. It isn’t rocket science and one must give it a try. The effort would definitely be worth it.

But remember — “Simplicity is the ultimate sophistication.”

And let us know what is your style like. Are you someone who likes it toned down or someone who cannot do without a pop of neon?

subtitle: A collection of 8 happening bathroom layouts that are sure to inspire you to take one step ahead towards the bath of your dreams.
description:
Think outside the box in terms of how you would want your bathroom to be designed like. What does your dream bathroom look like? Whether you have a small bathroom or a spacious one, your creativity decides if  the space is being used to accentuate the arrangement or not.

We have a collection of 8 happening bathroom layouts that are sure to inspire you to take one step ahead towards the bath of your dreams.

1) Shine Bright Like a Diamond!

Shimmer in the bathroom gives it an elegant and luxurious feel whether it is a small space or a palatial one. The metallic wall and floor tiles along with pretty lights seem to set the mood just right for a nice bath.

2) The Modish Tiles!

Simple yet oh so stylish! These contemporary coloured tiles compliment the white bath accessories and breaks the monotony of a boring, grey bathroom.

3) The Wooden Delight.

subtitle: A display of some exquisitely designed home theaters to get your creative and inspirational bug movin’ and groovin’.
description:
The idea of a home theatre is pretty straightforward — to have the scintillating experience of watching a movie in a cinema hall at the comfort of your home. Home theaters are slowly making their way in all kinds of households. Whether one owns a lavish, extravagant space or a comparatively smaller house, their coveted desire to have a theatre-like experience at home is not just a dream anymore. Check out this lovely home theatre built in a small space of a House in Delhi.

We have displayed some exquisitely designed home theaters to get your creative bug movin’ and groovin’.

source

As tough as it might sound, it is not very difficult to set up a home theatre. All you would need is a tremendously awesome A / V  system, subtle lightings, soundproofing walls, some pretty ruffle curtains, couches and lots of cushions. And this is the fancy way of doing your home theatre room.

source

source

In case you are low on budget — there are several other alternatives that you may opt for. There is no urgency to set up recliners. Instead you can go for scattered floor cushions where you and your peeps can sink in and watch DDLJ (Dilwale Dulhania Le Jaayenge) all over again. Don’t forget the good old projector and delicious food and drinks to go along with.

source

The elegance factor can be increased multifold by adding the right kind of lightings, complimenting hues and aesthetically placing framed posters of your favourite flicks on the walls.

source

False ceilings and starry night lights! These are the kind of home theaters people would pay for to watch movies in. What a beauty!

source

You may also go for a theme colour for your home theatre, if you fancy. It would add oodles of classiness and replicate the look and the feel of a vintage-y cinematic experience.

source

source

If you are a fan of earthy shades and muted tones — This one is for you! Everything, right from the furniture, the walls and the floors blend in impeccably to recreate the right ambience for an action-drama.

source

A bar in a home theatre — nothing can sound cooler than this! An arrangement like this would be perfect not only to watch movies but also sports with your buds.

source | source

A simple setting of few sofa chairs and a projector could also prove to be just enough to recreate the cinema hall-like feel.

source | source

source

source

This one got to be our favourite. Playing with patterns and solid colours is not everyone’s cup of tea. The three Marilyn Monroe posters placed side-by-side undoubtedly stole the show for us!

source

Extravagance in all its glory. Well, when we think about dreamy home theaters, this one tops the list. With its little ramp area, leopard print sofa chairs, whimsy lightings and classy carpeted floors — it definitely sensationalises the idea of a home theatre.

source

You can experiment with different kinds of seating arrangements for your home theatre to suit your style and taste.

source | source

source | source

source | source

source

source

If recliners and floor cushions aren’t your thing then you may also opt for beds. Just what you were fantasizing about, weren’t you? The coziness level of this one would be around 9000 or perhaps, even more. This particular home theatre redefines luxury in a whole new way.

source

If you have a backyard or a garden area to yourself, an open-home-theatre doesn’t sound bad at all. Get the pretty lights, the floor beds, a coffee table, a screen and a projector — and you’re done for a wonderful night with your lovelies.

source

Let us know in the comments below about your idea of a perfect home theatre setting.
title: 28 Exquisite Home Theatre Design Ideas

subtitle: Revamp the appearance of  toilet-paper-holders from a standard spindle holder to something artsy and visually appealing.
description:
Adding glamour to the minutest of things can really uplift the style quotient of your house. Here we had talked about how detailing makes a design stand out. Following the same trend, this time around we are talking about toilet-paper-holders — not the prettiest of bathroom fixtures but indispensable, nonetheless.

The fun part is that one can very effortlessly revamp the appearance of these toilet-paper-holders from a standard spindle holder to something artsy and visually appealing.

This spectacular, easy DIY by designlovefest displays how one can beautify their washroom measuring up to the standards of a 7 star hotel. The right balance of patterns and solid colours can really work wonders.

source

The idea of hanging a planter on this pretty holder is not only classy and sophisticated but also blends immaculately with any kind of a bath.

We are a fan of this pumpkin-toilet-paper DIY by Living Chic on the Cheap. This unique project is super easy to execute and the investment required in terms of time and money is hardly anything at all.

source | source

Sci-fi fans are bound to go gaga over these mystical toilet-paper-holders. These extraordinary statement pieces will hike the fun factor of your washroom leaving you and your guests either surprised or amused every time one attends the nature’s call.

source | source

source | source

Why settle for those simple spindle holders when you can opt for something as remarkable as dinosaurs and giraffes!? All you need to do to pull this look off is to get some plastic animal with a long neck. You can also spray paint these animals if you want to get more creative in this approach.

source | source | source

We are loving these artistic toilet-paper-holders which are sure to drive the boring far away from your washroom and spice up the interiors.

source | source | source

Industrial toilet-paper-holders go wonderfully well with brickwork walls and are dynamic in the ways they can be used. Add a planter or a scented candle to magnify the oomph factor of the arrangement.  

source | source | source

We all love to read in washrooms and having some magazines at our disposal is quite a bright idea. An antique magazine-cum-toilet paper holder could prove to be a beautiful, useful addition to the room.

source | source

Storing toilet papers cannot get more innovative than this. Colourful toilet papers could add a lot of life to a white or a gray bath.

source | source

subtitle: In 2009, this house was bought by a French travel company Voyageurs du Monde who gave it a new life in 2011 and transformed it into an extraordinary guest house and a museum based on the life of the leader who left a legacy in both the countries.
description:
“In a gentle way, you can shake the world.”

An epitome of strength, persistence and faith, Mohandas Karamchand Gandhi lived a simple yet a celebrated life that was not only reflected through his actions, but also his  way of life.

Gandhi was 24 when he moved to South Africa in 1893 and spent 21 years there developing his political and ethical views. Out of the 21 years, he spent 12 years in Johannesburg and in 1908, moved to a house tucked away in the suburbs of Orchards in Johannesburg  called Kraal (called so because of the style of architecture). He lived there for two years with his close friend — a german architect —  Hermann Kallenbach, who built the house in 1907. It was a  time when the country was surrounded by virgin veld.

“Within these walls, the future Mahatma created and developed his philosophy of passive resistance: Satyagraha in sanskrit. A pacifist method of protest that he employed in India to lead the country to independence. The Satyagraha House is thus a place that left its imprint on the life of the Mahatma.” - Satyagraha House Team

In 2009, this house was bought by a French travel company Voyageurs du Monde who gave it a new life in 2011 and transformed it into an extraordinary guest house and a museum based on the life of the leader who left a legacy in both countries of South Africa and India.

On either side of the entrance, there are two round, hut-like structures called rondavels used as exhibition space.

Gandhi’s words of wisdom have been engraved on large cotton hangings and concrete plaques in the Garden in the form of his own handwriting which is quite a remarkable addition to the place.

“It was a challenge to keep the new architecture very simple so that it didn’t overwhelm the original architecture. It had to be unimposing and unpretentious.” — Rocco Bosman, the heritage specialist who did the restoration work and new structures, told Joburg.

The pure white walls and wood finishing along with white concrete floors renders a spiritual aura to the place that once resided in the presence of Gandhi. The tables, the chairs, the wooden cupboards, the white linen and cotton curtains radiates a sense of calm and serenity that pervades through every nook and cranny.

A very thin line separates the living space from the museum created by the team curator, Lauren Segal, and interior designers, Christine Puech and Amit Zadok, making Gandhi’s true presence felt that permeates through each room and element, making it seem like a true spiritual encounter. Watch this video to get a better picture of the idea that Lauren Segal and Mohamed El Selhab, the manager of the house, went by.

There are a nine rooms in total in the guesthouse. The food served there is purely vegetarian and alcohol isn’t owing to the principles that Gandhiji abided by. Yoga and meditation sessions are also available for those who wish to indulge in them.

The smooth black ceramic sinks installed in contrast with the pure white walls, simple woodwork and artefacts including kitchen implements like a weaving machine and chests from the early 1900s bring the house alive with a flavour of realism and makes one feel like they are still living in the edwardian era.

Have a sneek peak into the renovation story of The Satyagraha House.
This was truly an admirable project built with so much heart and finesse, it is hard to take your eyes off the beauty of it.

{Image credits - The Satyagraha House, The Pretty Blog, An Indian Summer and Marsel Roothman}
title: A Tribute to Gandhi - The Satyagraha House

subtitle: An insight not only on traditional Japanese spirit , but also how it has been modernised to match up the chic contemporary designs.
description:
“Peace in my heart, Peace in my soul, wherever we are going, we are already home.”- Buddha.

Zen interior design ideas have been inspired from Japanese interiors, minimalist interior designs, ancient traditions and eastern culture where positive energy is encouraged to flow throughout the house.

The interiors of our homes should be the place where we feel calm and at peace , and what better than a Zen decor and design to enjoy this feeling of serenity.

Today we shall give you an insight not only on traditional Japanese spirit , but also how it has been modernised to match up the chic contemporary designs.

Low seating arrangements with slight elevation and softening of the space relaxes the knees and the back more than the floor cushions. Although floor cushions around a low rise table is a great way to create an oriental dining spot.

source | source

source | source

source | source

Abstract furniture and curious break the monotony of mainstream designs and has the power to transform a house into this peaceful and calm space. One feels at home like never before.

source

Japanese furniture is the natural choice for a Zen bedroom. Incorporating nature and using minimal window covering along with making them noiseless, clutter free, bereft of technology and cool are the key to creating a rejuvenating space.

source

source

Stacking up some Zen stones and scented candles and incense is another way to spread calm throughout the spaces of your house. These not only look gorgeous and enhance the decor of your place but also help in meditating better- boosting focus and a peace of mind and filling the house with positive vibes.

source | source

source | source

source | source

source | source

Zen design encompasses Buddha in various shapes and forms in different parts of the house. Elegant paintings and orchids can also be included to reflect the Japanese interiors. Most importantly, though, zen is a spiritual lifestyle and it is about exploring oneself and taking up a path towards finding one’s own center.

source | source | source

The minimalist lines of traditional Japanese interiors influenced decoration in the new, modern spaces. In accordance with that, it is important to keep the furniture minimal and adding a touch of nature in form of wooden stools. It keeps the space brimming with positivity. Clutter is strictly prohibited according to zen philosophy. The zen palette is all about natural shades, especially wood tones, beige, pale gold and antique white- all kinds of subdued hues.

One must remember that balance is the key. Don’t you feel serene just by looking at these pictures? Imagine transforming your house into one and living the good life. Let us know what you think.

subtitle: “Be the Light.” This saying holds true for Ms. Bali and her daughter. The purity of their heart and soul shines through every little element in their house. It is almost magical how true that is.
description:
On a hot summer day of 27th August, Mohit (who made the house video)  and I happened to visit the serene residence of Miss Priti Bali and her cheerful daughter Aashita. There was an air of absolute calm filling every corner of their 3 BHK apartment spread across 1,740 square feet, at Dwarka in Delhi.

When I think of a Zen Indian home, I think of authentic elements picked up from nature, minimalism, abstract decor, slightly elevated furniture or floor seating arrangements, huge windows, candles and lamps like The Home of the Bali’s. A space, where as soon you step in, you feel good, and the kind that calms every single nerve of your body.

“Be the Light.” This saying holds true for Ms Bali and her daughter. The purity of their heart and soul shines through every little element in their house. It is almost magical how true that is.

Watch this beautiful short video giving away a glimpse of the life and the home of the Bali's.

“We were in Kuwait when my father-in-law took seriously ill  so we had to come back to India. We had a sprawling space back in Kuwait and so, we wanted a similar property with open spaces because we had a lot of stuff when we came from the Middle East. We got this house in 2001. The area was good, not claustrophobic. When we saw this apartment, we fell for it at first sight. I am connected to nature, and love earthy colours. I am also fond of flowers, plants and travelling that reflects through the interior of our house.”

The interiors comprise of a subdued palette—tones of beige, wooden hues, hint of gold—a classy and contemporary style which has been mastered by Ms Bali who likes to sustain a fresh and lively feel at her place. “Don’t we change our clothes everyday? The same goes for your home. In every 15 days or so, you’d see that the colours have changed, the linen and the arrangements have changed. I feel that doing so gives that fresh appeal to the house and the interest remains intact.”

“I have a huge collections of curios. If I display all of them at one go, my house is going to look like a museum. So I keep changing. Whenever I am bored, I replace everything. We travel a lot and I keep collecting whatever pleases my heart and soul. Last summer we were in Bhutan where we picked up a few vases and the seven signs of Buddha that embellishes the walls of my drawing space.”

“I am a big foodie. My daughter tells me that I live to eat, cook and feed. I own school cafeterias where I cook in my style. Once I get back home, we don’t prefer the regular food, we like to experiment - cook up something new and interesting. When I am cooking, I like to accompany it with good music—Aashita interrupts—she cooks, I eat and I praise her that’s all we do. We don’t cook together.

The secret of being a good cook is to cook happily. I find my house very comfortable because my kitchen is set up the way I want it to be—my equipments, my knives—everything is placed in harmony - it’s convenient. My husband was a livewire. He could party every night. He loved throwing them because he was a hotel guy. He had this wonderful collection of wine glasses and then there is also my collection of bowls, crockery and cutlery is stored in these cabinets.”

“I couldn’t have asked for more. I lost my husband a few years back so the support and the strength I needed came from her. My participation in Masterchef India this season wouldn’t have been possible without her. She is the one who got me registered and pushed me to do something for myself, since I had spent enough time doing things for others. It has to be the best relationship I have had.” Ms Bali is overwhelmed as she reflects upon her intimate relationship with her daughter.

When asked about where she derived inspiration for her room decor, Aashita says, “I love pink and purple, that is all that reflects the girly side of me I guess. The rest of it comes from the fact that I am totally into music. I play the guitar; and I have been learning the synth since the past 8 years now. It inspires me. This may sound a little philosophical but music drives me towards peace. It makes me feel good about myself and the world and it actually helps me bond with my friends better because we end up discussing music most of the time. Be it Michael Jackson or Bob Marley—my room is all about music, me and peace.”

“There was a point in time when there were more than five people living here but now it’s just the two of us. We have evolved with this house. Our relationship has strengthened over the period of time so it describes us and our lives. It has been there for us and we have been there for each other. My mother has been a pillar of strength and supportive throughout.”

Ms. Bali’s bedroom is a cozy space with a long wall window, a beautiful framed picture of her daughter, an earthy, walnut-pecan cabinet, flowers, a mirror and very simple but chic furniture.

The bath was, I must say, fancy like royalty. Spic and span with a fusion of colours and muted tones—the big bunch of artificial flowers, the mirror imparting an illusion of a bigger space and all things a girl would need, stacked beautifully.

“I have gone through a lot of tough times in my life. In a span of two years, I lost both my in-laws and my husband. My daughter was hardly 12 then. It was the toughest phase of my life. We had a lot of happy memories together, infact extremely happy. A lot of positivity surrounded this house but those few 2-3 years changed everything. I had to gather myself and live for my daughter because she had a long life ahead. I was spiritually inclined to Sai Baba and slowly he became everything for me. Talking and discussing my problems with him made me develop a strong connection with him. Everytime I talk to him about any problem, it gets sorted.

Infact, the Masterchef people said that I was the first Delhiite who seemed so calm.
I have a room dedicated to my God. I read all kinds of books there and talk to him. I don’t have any chairs or stools there, I prefer a floor seating arrangement. I enjoy these moments with him, it is very relaxing and gives me a lot of energy and prepares me for the rest of the day.”
title: Houses Of Delhi — The Bali’s | Zen Inspired Home |

subtitle: Coffee Table could be perceived as the hero of our living rooms as it occupies the center stage and it sure deserves to be treated like one.
description:
Many a times we wake up in the morning, brew ourselves a hot cup of coffee and advance towards a coffee table covered up in clutter—remotes, used cups, books, the glasses you couldn’t find last night, wrappers and what not!

Coffee Table could be perceived as the hero of our living rooms as it occupies the center stage and it sure deserves to be treated like one. There are a lot of ways to keep the chaos of a boring space turned into an arcade at bay.

1) THE FLOWERY BUSINESS

A splash of pretty, fresh flowers is a wonderful way to add colour and appeal to your coffee table. You could also opt for cute potted planters that double up the charm of not just your table but the entire living area.

Fun Fact: Add disprin into the water in which your flowers are resting, they’ll last longer!

source | source

source | source

2) TRAY IT UP

Who doesn’t like a clean, organised space? Adding trays to your table can readily aid your organisational bug into creating a beautiful and aesthetical arrangement that is difficult to mess up with.   

source

source | source | source

3) DECOR NEUTRALITY

If you are a person who’d rather spend their lives in the lap of nature and loves the feeling stirred by earthy, muted tones—This one is for you! Using neutral elements of varying heights and shapes will break the monotony and add multiple dimensions to your coffee table.

source | source

source

4) THE TWINS & THE TRIPLETS

Sometimes one just isn’t enough. Add drama to your living room with two or three coffee tables blending together in harmony. They enhance the usability of the space and the beauty of the living area.

source | source

source | source

5) COLOUR POP

Colours fill any space with a lot of life and instantly diffuse an aroma of sheer bliss. You can play with all kinds of elements to make your coffee table look colourful. Place books with artistic and colourful covers as the base to layer it with other patterned elements. You could also bring in a striking solid shade coffee table and pair it up with pretty things in contrasting hues.

Nothing is quite as impressive on a coffee table as a stack of books and magazines with intriguing covers. Use them as a base to exhibit statement pieces. The way the stacks are placed depends upon what all you’d want to incorporate on your table.

source

source

source

source

Metallic embellishments impart that classy and sophisticated feel to your coffee table which is much sort after. Fortunately, it is super easy to coalesce metallic chattels with the other stuff kept on the table. Use showpieces, ethnic containers or any of your favourite curio for the same.

source

source

9) THE BOLD & THE BEAUTIFUL

Abstract statements pieces can serve as amazing conversation starters. One may either add them as a singular center piece or pair them up with complimenting elements on your coffee table.

source

source | source |  source
