subtitle: The entrance of your house is the first impression you create in the minds of the people who come to your place and that is something you wouldn’t want to be anything less than perfect.
description:
The entrance of your house is the first impression you create in the minds of the people who come to your place and that is something you wouldn’t want to be anything less than perfect. It must also be a space the evinces your personal style along with being aesthetically appealing and organized.

There are tons of ways to decorate this space in a pragmatic yet beautiful manner to make it an inviting and calm to come back to everyday. The formula of creating an enthralling entrance is pretty simple. Here are 9 ways we can adopt to do the same. Let’s have a look!

1) THE FRESH LOOK.

Bring in the flowers and the succulents. They give a whimsical fresh appeal to your foyer that’ll put a smile on your face everytime you step into your home, sweet home.

source | source

2) MIRROR MAGIC. 

It is always a good idea to have a mirror on the doorway so as to give that touch of perfection to your appearance right before you step out of the house and get ready to take on the world one day at a time.

source | source

3) STATEMENT ART PIECE!

Art can really be helpful in uplifting anyone’s mood and hence having your favourite piece of art on display right at the entrance of your home could impart that lively look and feel to your space.

source | source

4) DASH OF COLOUR.

Colours brighten up any space and to have a colourful entrance is just the right way to add feathers to the appeal of it. A colourful vase or a pretty pastel side table adorned with joyous elements is just the best thing ever.

5) THE SHOE BUSINESS

This is an absolute necessity and must be practised with diligence to keep things organised and in place. Organisation of shoes doesn’t have to get boring, nonetheless. Use compartmentalised shelves and pretty baskets to dispose shoes off at the entrance.

6) HANGING ‘EM UP!

7) THE FRAMES & THE SHELVES

A space to store your keys, succulents, candles, books, things that you always forget to carry on your way out—Shelves are the one simple solution to all of this! They can also be used to provide a coverage may be a radiator in your entryway. To enhance the look of the shelves, you can pair them up with framed photographs of your family and friends. They look adorable, promise!

source | source

8) SEATING SPACE

A super cute seating space is a wonderful idea to spruce up your entrance. Add a statement chair or a storage cabinet-cum-stool—that ways you’d be able to not only store the shoes but also deck up the space with some pretty cushion and pillows—giving it a great look!

source | source

9) MUTED TONES.

Your entrance would stand out significantly by adding the ethereal drama of muted tones. Addition of dainty light fixtures and a singular solid tone of colour could augment the look of the space.

source | source

We hope you’d try some of these ways to your entrance. Let us know about the same in the comments below.

subtitle: Halloween, a festival widely popular in the western countries, is slowly gaining a lot of popularity in India and being embraced as another reason to celebrate. And why not?
description:
Halloween, a festival widely popular in the western countries, is slowly gaining a lot of popularity in India and being embraced as another reason to celebrate. And why not? It’s a fun festival that includes traditional activities like trick-or-treating, bonfires, costume parties, visiting haunted houses and carving jack-o-lanterns.

There are endless ways to celebrate this festival. And, we Indians, we don’t need reasons to celebrate, do we? So go ahead and throw an ultimate halloween bash at you home. Organise a costume party, watch a horror movie, indulge in some relishing halloween treats and we promise, you are going to love it!

If you have some time on hand, get some crazy, spooky party invites to send to your friends. It adds a touch of glamour to the party scene that you are planning and who doesn’t want that?! We love it!

source | source

Planning the decor isn’t rocket science when it comes to Halloween. There are plenty ideas in the sea, all you gotta do is watch, observe and execute. Get lots of orange and black balloons along with bat cut outs to decorate the walls. It looks so pretty and gets you right into the mood of halloween.

One could also choose a particular theme and work on it accordingly. Whether it is colour tone, patterns or anything that fancies your taste—everything works!

source

They can be used for decor in so many ways—paint them, impart a golden plating on them, turn them into candle, add lightings inside—they won’t fail you in spreading the awesomeness that you’d want your party to look and sound like!

Mind blowing lightings, in any party, is an essential! Gather some innovative lights that make your party stand out. Or better, make them! It’s always a good feeling to create something pretty!

subtitle: Alright our lovelies, the mist and the chill in the air is giving us subtle hints of the oncoming season of winter and its time to get our plants indoors.
description:
Alright our lovelies, the mist and the chill in the air is giving us subtle hints of the oncoming season of winter and we are loving it. Along with our winter faves (hot cuppa morning coffee, cozy warm fuzzies, holiday decor), it is time to get our plants (babies!) indoors. This calls for a little transitioning in the interior decor and imparting a refreshing vibe to the space with some pretty plants that demand low light conditions, are low maintenance and thrive brilliantly in dry air. Since you are going to be spending a lot of time indoors, it isn’t a bad idea to bring a mix of some blissful plants to brighten up your decor.

Here are 10 season perfect plants that you need to get in your homes right now.

1) ANTHURIUMS

These exotic-looking blooms take good care of themselves and don’t demand for much of your attention. They make lovely gifts and are ain’t just a pretty face because they are known to suck up harmful chemicals from their surroundings too.

source | source

2) ORCHIDS

Orchids are one of the best plants that has happened to mankind. They love you (by looking lovely at all times) and they also love being neglected. So beware of killing them by watering them too much or keeping them in the sun for long.

source | source

3) ALOE VERA

Super low maintenance, super practical to have as a part of your decor and what more—they look super cute!

source | source | source

4) LADIES’ SLIPPER ORCHID

This beauty needs shade to bloom which make it an impeccably fit for the sweater weather! The colour of this flowering plants brings in a cheery vibe into your decor and brightens everything up!

source | source

5) PEACE LILY

All it needs is regular misting and a moderate amount of daylight to survive the cold weather. It also has air purifying qualities.

source | source

6) POTHOS

Creepers are popular in many households and when it is pothos that thrive in cold weather and low lights, what more do you need?

source | source

7) INDIAN BASIL

Indian basil or tulsi is ideal for the winter weather. Apart from having innumerable herbal properties, they have a lot of antiseptic benefits.

source | source

8) PHILODENDRONS

They are just perfect for this cozy weather. They look immaculate and are a low maintenance plant.

source | source

9) LUCKY BAMBOO

Just like the name suggests, they are actually known to be lucky. This tall, sculptural plant gives off a distinctly tropical vibe, providing some island vacation inspiration while you’re stuck indoors.

source | source

10) SONG OF INDIA


Their bright pretty leaves and low light requirements make a perfect addition to the bright decor of the winter season.

source | source

Tell us what you think!
title: 10 Winter Plants To Get Indoors Right Now!

subtitle: We are listing down 10 ways how you can live stylishly on any budget irrespective of how much space—big or small—you have to yourself! Let us have a look.
description:
Time, money, imagination and inspiration—these are the four factors that determine the style that one may embrace to create their beautiful home. More often than not, the designing of the coveted interiors is by no means a cakewalk. Right from picking up the apt furniture to choosing the art that occupies the big, empty wall in the hallway—everything requires tons of research and investment in terms money and time.

“For a house to be successful, the objects in it must communicate with one another, respond and balance one another.” – Andre Putman. To hit the right balance, one must be aware of what may or may not work, collectively. The elements, colour palette, pattern layering, proportions and shapes must all come together in harmony to shape our homes. It is also extremely essential to give emphasis to the details because those are what make the design, afterall.

We are listing down 10 ways how you can live stylishly on any budget irrespective of how much space—big or small—you have to yourself! Let us have a look.

1) Let your furniture do the talking!

Whether your living room is a sprawling space with exotic wooden flooring or a tiny room with neutral walls, a decent sized, bright sofa would completely change the look of your room. You can choose to let it sit by itself and look pretty or compliment it with contrasting throw pillows and cushion.

source | source

2) Splash of bold statement pieces.

An interesting touch can easily be imparted with bold wallpapers, eclectically colour blocked cabinets & chairs or a huge wall clock. Remember, you got to be careful about not overdoing it and keeping the rest of the elements either neutral or of contrasting shades.

source | source

3) Do not ignore the corners.

A corner is a divine gift in terms of decor hacks. “Addressing (and dressing) your corners adds depth to your room and actually makes it feel bigger because it brings your eye further into the space." - Emily Handerson, an L.A.-based interiors stylist, told Refinery29. Accented chairs, poufs, gallery wall, candles, statement vases and flowers—corners are fun to decorate and make a huge impact too.

source | source | source

4) Less is more.

Keep it simple. Keep it minimal. Think about oreo when you decide on the colours for minimalistic interiors. This is a ‘zen’ way of interiors and is a great choice for those who are looking for a clutter-free home.

source | source

5) Let one thing shine on.

To add an intriguing glam to your space, opting for one statement piece or thing is a very smart option. Keep the rest of the elements in the scene neutral or earthy to make it pop out.

source | source

6) Place all you curios together.

Well, we think this a brilliant idea. A space dedicated just to showcase your collectives from all that travelling and all those pretty gifts you received from your friends. Turning your vacation shots into wall art isn’t a bad option either.

source | source

7) Work on a colour palette.

It is always a good idea to stick to one colour palette. It looks and feels more harmonious and renders a distinctive look to your place.

source | source

8) Occupy the entire vertical place.

Covering the vertical space entirely will give some depth and ethereal feel to your room. Either in the form of shelves, tall plants or ladders with intertwined fairy lights.

source | source

9) Use portable furniture.

Make use of furniture that saves space and lets you use it in multifarious ways. It looks unique and saves one ample of space.

source | source

10) Finally, don’t shy away from hiring a Designer.

If you are looking for a complete transformation which is out of the box and looks like a work of art, we’d say go for a designer. Get your space planned out and fill it with the right kind of furniture within the budget you desire.

source
title: 10 Ways You Can Live Stylishly On Any Budget

subtitle: Sensual and bold, delicious Marsala is a daringly inviting tone that nurtures; exuding confidence and stability while feeding the body, mind and soul.
description:
6 Ways To Decorate With Marsala

Marsala, an earthy-muted-reddish shade that hits somewhere between wine red and Terracotta, was announced as the colour of the year for 2015 by Pantone. There was an immense hue and cry along with frantic uncertainty among the home-fanatics which, we’d say, was expected and a cinch. A bold colour like Marsala wasn’t an easy colour to incorporate in houses owing to its bold and dauntless attributes.

source

Here’s what Pantone had to say about the color:

“Sensual and bold, delicious Marsala is a daringly inviting tone that nurtures; exuding confidence and stability while feeding the body, mind and soul. Much like the fortified wine that gives Marsala its name, this robust shade incorporates the warmth and richness of a tastefully fulfilling meal, while its grounding red-brown roots point to a sophisticated, natural earthiness.”

There was crazy experimentation with the colour and turns out it wasn’t half as bad as the idea sounded. The kind of ways in which Marsala can make an appearance into your houses keeping its sultry appeal intact are subtle and mingles well with amber, umber and golden yellows, greens in both turquoise and teal, and blues in the more vibrant range. Have a look at some ways you can bring Marsala home.

1) Throw pillows and cushions.

With a neutral backdrop, earthy tones and light shades, Marsala cushions and pillows add a touch of class and glamour to the setting. One may go for sequined, textured and striking prints to render a festive feel to their space.

source | source

2) Wallpapers & Tapestries

Walls in bold colours is not everyone’s cup of tea. Although, if one is daring enough, they could go for intricately designed Marsala shaded wallpapers and tapestries.We believe they look beautiful and we’d definitely give those tapestries a try!

source | source | source

3) Chairs and Sofas.


Modern, elegant, cozy—Marsala magnifies all of these qualities without trying too hard. Selecting a sofa in dark, mural shade like this one could seem like a tough, conflicting choice but it definitely imparts a royal feel to any space. With a mix of a lot of oranges and blues along with accents of brass and copper, one could easily render a classy and stylish vibe to a living room.

source | source

source | source

4) Curtains

This could be a bit of a tricky choice to settle for because curtains hold the power to make it or break it when it comes to a balanced and modish home decor. We’d say - go for it! It is a tried and tested magic trick that looks oh so good! Satin or silk fabric enhances the appeal of this colour.

source | source

5) Patterned rugs and carpets.

Nobody can deny the ethereal impact that rugs and carpets impart to any space. Bold colours and chic patterns like aztec and ones from Mexico, Turkey and India embossed over these rugs and carpets looks like an incredible way to incorporate Marsala into the home decor.

source | source | source

6) Accented baths.

Contrary to popular belief, bold walls and distinctively shaded bath accessories work really well in washrooms of all shapes and sizes. The contrast between white accessories and mute-y earthy red like Marsala looks impeccable. 

source | source
title: 6 Ways To Decorate With Marsala

subtitle: This calming palette of Rose Quartz and Serenity renders the spotlight on the world of art, mindfulness and curiosity that follows exploration.
description:
Marsala, the signature colour chosen by Pantone for the year 2015, was a bold pick yet it undoubtedly made an impressionable appearance in fashion and interiors as we saw earlier. For the year 2016, Pantone picked up not one, but two colours—Rose Quartz and Serenity.

The trending trail of pastels and muted tones is taking on the world, one or rather two colours at a time and nobody is complaining. According to the designers, the world is rapidly moving towards a terrible place full of agony, pain and stress.This calming palette renders the spotlight on the world of art and recreation. The focus diverts to a more relaxed locale studded with the beauty of nature, the hues of flowering seasons, mindfulness and connections followed by exploration.

The selection of these colours also signifies embracing gender fluidity as the colour pink and blue denoted—stereotypically—for a girl and a boy, respectively, seems to merge into a tranquil blur. These colours are slightly similar to the transgender pride flag, too, as noted by Pantone.

source | source

"Colors this season transport us to a happier, sunnier place where we feel free to express a wittier version of our real selves," said Leatrice Eiseman, executive director of the Pantone Color Institute. "With our culture still surrounded by so much uncertainty, we are continuing to yearn for those softer shades that offer a sense of calm and relaxation."

source

Rose Quartz, a colour that can easily be muddled with baby pink, is actually a warmer tone of rose. It is a classy and subtle pink that mingles impeccably with other soft tones and metallic shades of gold, silver and copper. White, neutral and wooden tints amalgamates wonderfully with it in vivid settings and seasons.

source | source

Furniture, cushions, walls, artwork, cutlery and the list goes one—Rose Quartz makes an impressionable presence whether it's being inducted in patterns, illustrations or simply mixed with other elements in contrasting shade.

We recommend layering of patterns and a vivid palette of muted tones in your home decor to pull of these two colours—the other one being—Serenity which is a close family member of cool blue has been described as, ‘weightless and airy, like the expanse of the blue sky above us, bringing feelings of respite and relaxation even in turbulent times.’

source | source

source

Experimentation and refurbishing, contrary to prior beliefs, is not half as onerous when it comes to adopting these soft tones into your interiors. You can pair them with dark shades as well as the light ones and their soothing vibe accompanied with a composing feel enunciate them as the best bet to flatter any space in your home.

Don’t forget to mix them up with darker shades and patterns of contrasting but muted tones. Sometimes pop colours work, too. Bling, on the other hand, always works.

source | source

source | source

If you are a kind of a person (and trust us! A lot of people like you are out there sitting with a smile of their faces!) who loves to change the look and feel of your home every fortnight or with every season, these tones still work just fine as we can see in the picture below. Mute + Mute = Beauty! Mute + Pop colours = Beauty! So, don’t shy away from making these two colours a part of your interiors.

source | source

source | source

source | source

Go for the amazing wall murals that are out there waiting for you to be picked up. If you aren't a fan of walls in a single shade then wallpapers are something that you might absolutely love. There are some really innovative and quirky patterns that are ought to match up to your style and taste. Sometimes you gotta give into that gut feeling, pick up something seemingly eccentric and make a part of you just to see if it is really what you would like. We say, you go take the risk because you stay trendy nonetheless.

source | source

source

If you have any other ideas on how we may be able to adopt these poetry-like shades into our home decor, do let us know in the comments below.
title: How to Make Pantone Colour of the Year 2016—Rose Quartz and Serenity—A Part of Your Home!

subtitle: Remember the animated world of ‘The Jetsons’, back in the 90's and early millennium. Futuristic cyber cities, suspended mid-air with an abundance of flying cars and automated assistance.
description:
It made life seem so easy and comfortable for the characters.

It seemed far-fetched back then, the doors operating as if they had a mind of their own, toiling tasks and clerical chores reduced to a mere redundant formality. Smart buildings, gardens, vehicles ably supported by the AI machines and many other sci-fi tools that offered a contented lifestyle. 

Home Automation, essentially is the management of the main home systems through a single source. Core areas are -  

Security

Energy or Utility Management

Motorization- Remote control of devices such thermostats.

Lighting  

Entertainment 

Considering the prevalent requirements such as curbing the energy consumptions and safety/security, let us quickly take a look at some of the prominent home-automation products available in the market.

1) Falcon Jaguar 8 - Intrusion detection system ( aakash enterprise)

Source 

A wide variety sensors like door and window magnetic contacts, passive infrared curtain motion sensor, dual tech sensor,, fire detector, emergency and active infrared motion sensors.

2) Dome/IR/PTZ/IP - CCTV Surveillance Cameras ( aakash enterprise)


Source 

These units are designed to secure personal property from damages. In case of any intrusion, the configured device would alert the homeowner and it includes systems such as DVR,, Video Web Server,, Multiplexer and other Security Applications.

3) ZHOME Dimmer & Switch Combo (100-240V)

 

Source

Control the different individual lights from the bed, the kitchen, car, or even from the poolside from vacations. Empowering the homeowner, with leisure and peace of mind.

4) Zhome  AZ-GC-TFLX Bridge Controller


Source

The state-of-the-art controller facilitates automation for a wide spectrum of features such as TV, AV and STB along with mood lighting with a single click.

5) ZHOME AC ON/OFF Control


Source

The AZ2R1D is connected to the AC unit via additional relays that can take a load of a 2-3 Tonne with features such as set time based control, occupancy based control, outside weather based control.

Unbelievable and shocking as it may sound, controlling the security locks with a smart gesture gadget while slouching on the couch and at the same time, moderating the A/V and lightning of the entire complex is a possibility for even the mid-income groups. 

Monetary Requirements

Single room/Studio flat - 45,000 INR

3 BHK - 3,00,000 INR
title: Brickless Building: Programme your house Bit by Bit

subtitle: The last bastion for masculinity, the man cave has quickly transformed into an urban expression of freedom and liberty, the slice of seclusion from the cacophony of life struggles.
description:
Whether it be studying, recording crappy sounds, slouching on the couch or day-dreaming, either building the most sophisticated machine ever or even perhaps on the brink of a scientific breakthrough; The Man Cave has made a definite comeback with many new entrants, synonyms with the coming of age professions modern India.

Lets take a look at some of the popular ones.

1) Lawyer: Compatriot in Jurisprudence. 

Need some time off to prepare for next week’s judicial hearing and devour entire sets of books and thesis on topical judgements. Setup and remodel any unused area into your very own solitary space.

source 

The Lawyer’s cave, lined with voluminous books and armed with tranquility for the most enriching learning experience. 

source 

2) Engineers : For the machine lovers.

An uber-cool solitary man cave for the machine maneuvers is a must-have. The Ingenious constructors with a knack of disassembling every moving part only to put it back someplace totally new. The emotional sanctuary of the ‘guydom’, a substantial and perhaps a critical element for success as the undue stress takes it toll. 

source 

Moreover, so much of garage-silverware dazzling behind the tools is one hell of a sight to admire. Tacky and dedicated, these gruesome metal lovers quite often wreak havoc with their ‘monkey’s wrench’, so a separate working space is a must. 

3) Defense Personnel 

Dedication and discipline flourishes their backyard, with the smell of sacrifice and patriotism dipping from their very moustaches. With an addiction of arms and ammunitions (self-explanatory), the articulated taste buds and solitary moments of leisures; the man cave seldom misses the veterans bucket list. 

source 

Adorned with high-powered firearms, table-lamps and aged Scottish Scotch, the veterans are often guilty of indulging in perhaps an early retirement and cosy comforts!!! The guydom also assists in alternate career options with in-depth, high level thinking.

4) Musician

The musicians, the galore instruments and an early night. May either cast into an ideal lullaby harmonious to sweet melody or perhaps the worst cacophony. Either way, the artist and his ‘self-time’ is a prerequisite for erecting musical edifices that stand the test of time.

source

Beautiful music never fades away, and a similar case applies for the man-cave. Soundproofing is a must, in addition to ample lights, liquor, and hi-tech recording equipment for the ultra-mod artist.

source 

5) Writer 

Perhaps the most thought provoking of them all, a writer’s work demands intensive cognition, weaving together of sentiments, spicing it up with the emotional baggage and perhaps a hint or two of nostalgic notions. 

 source

Every night, the writer inside them takes precedence as they plunge into the deepest-darkest corners of the sub-conscious, an unreal world free of bounds and constructed out of sheer imagination. The silence of the night, a study table with a lamp shade and hundreds of books of all sorts complete the guydom.

source
title: Be the king of the House: Man Cave to Guydom!!!

subtitle: The luxury wrapped holiday home promises an escape from the traumatising life-struggles.
description:
1) Jade House, Bengaluru(Karnataka)

Iconic yet subtle, the many shades of Green from Jade adorn this beautiful Villa with dimly interiors and open-exposed exteriors. Slurp your noon tea under the sun, observe the aura of Jaded medieval China or romanticise the night under the starry skies. 

A perfect backdrop for that ultimate soiree or a weekend escapade, with facilities of even a BBQ Sunday Brunch. Exclusive leisure In The Lap Of Nature.

Source 1 Source 2

2) Himalaica, Bhowali(Uttarakhand)

The secluded bungalow, surrounded by natural beauty is simply majestic and peaceful. It is so quiet up there, the only sounds would probably be from the Pangot and Sattal fowls, chirping and chittering from moist branches right in front of the windowsills.

A sight that fills up your heart with silence soothes your soul. Its just so beautiful. The place is just perfect to pause and reflect, to meditate, to rejuvenate the life balances or just relax with nature as your only companion.

Source 

3) Marigold Villa, Kochi(Kerala)

There is one thing in unison with every outstanding holiday home, the amount of radiated sunlight that reaches into every crevice, gets reflected back and forth. This ‘brownian movement’ elevates the ambience, making it easier to feel comfortable and assist the flow of creative juices.

Designed by Interior decorator Bill Fletcher, this unique specimen of traditions and modernity speaks out for itself. Impeccable and simply majestic, the Marigold Villa with lively color combos is a prolific stress buster. Heal those battered and tattered souls with a spiritual boost to the senses.

Source 

4) Thematic Tikka Cottage, Arpora (Goa) 

Rustic themed inspired architecture, overlook the Thematic Tikka Cottage at your own risk. In the backdrop of splendid tropical birds and wakeup calls from peacocks, the spacious and superbly colourful cottage offers a quick getaway from the hustles and bustles of a monotonous routine.

Simplicity marks each and every nook of this property. Plenty of open spaces and brightly lit interiors compliment the wooden exteriors for an amazing rush of tranquil delight.

Source 1 Source 2 

5) Charming Pine Room, New Delhi

Astonishingly designed interiors with an inclination towards cane furniture and locally crafted exquisite showpieces. Complementing the open spaces is an array of vibrant colours, with majestic tones of green and blue that does wonders beyond imagination and lights up the entire atmosphere to an electric gust of energy and sophistication.

Simple yet elegant home decor with the musty woodwork outclasses every other rental from the posh Safdarjung neighbourhood.

Source
title: Heal your soul: Breathtaking homes that you must Elope

subtitle: Money can buy almost everything.
description:
1) Shahrukh Khan

Imagine the most majestic King’s palace, surrounded by lush green gardens and fountains plumbing clear cold waters, polish vitrified tiles in every square inch of the mansion and a living standard reminiscent to the Mughal Emperors.

King Khan and his humble abode, Mannat is one hell of a luxurious palace with classy decor and sublime lighting. Massive open spaces, royal caricatures on walls, victorian era chandeliers and intricate aesthetics that complement the Badshah's lifestyle.

Brightly lit interior, splendid home decor, exquisite graffitis with magnificent showpieces and an imposing mediterranean-styled architecture and pillars. Mannat, an offering upon the fulfilment of a vow or simply just a ‘wish’ is one “Dream House” for  millions of people.

Source | Source

2) Mr. Bachchan

The so-called angry Young Man of Bollywood, Mr. Bachchan and his Bungalow Prateeksha are both symbols of success and dynamic living lifestyles, professed under one single roof. Mr. Bachchan seldom misses his morning tea paper in the front lawns and reading is a cosy affair in the afternoons, with the enormous dimly lit library lined with hundreds of volumes.

Prateeksha is a perfect combination of minimalism and deliberate avant-garde haphazard settings. Artistic home decor with magnificent lighting in every room, entire walls adorned with portraits from the past and traditional exteriors hallmark this house well above the rest.

Source  | Source

3) Shahnaz Husain

The most outstanding authority in skincare and cosmetics in the country, Shahnaz is an iconic entrepreneur and her house is testament of the ‘crafty inclinations’ that she is so passionate about. Dual-coloured tones with an excess of vibrance and yellow, intricate frescoes and exotic vases and a distinct charm to the house.

Shahnaz is known for her exquisite preferences and accessorized leanings, and all of this evident from her home-decor. Paintings from the age of Renaissance, ancient greek, pharaoh sculptures, medieval cannon wheel-benches and lots and lots of flowers. The aura is certainly refreshing with a dash of insurgence, radiating from her breath-taking house with a simple motto: Don't keep it simple when it could be awe-inspiring.

Source

4) John Abraham

Buffed up, ripped and  flexed with muscle strands visible from a distance. John is known for his insistence on strictly a veg-diet but he’s also renowned for his posh residence. Walk into his domain and its like from the next century or something. Compact, subtle, sleek and mesmerizingly beautiful, the house is studded with all sorts of comforts as well as hi-tech home automation.

An infinity pool overlooking the Arabian Sea, maple floorings with logs of wood for benches, comfy furniture and lots of plants that supplement this European-styled celeb-house. John’s humble abode is completely child-safe, the only missing aspect is the kid-itself. Perhaps, it's time to get settled mate. 

Source | Source
title: Fame Game: Fabulous 4 Bolly-Celeb Houses!

subtitle: Family is not important, It's everything - Michael J Fox.
description:
When I left home to pursue my Masters, I adopted a simple approach to counter the very painful - Homesickness. It wasn’t the perfect cure but then nothing really is.
I put together some beautiful images of my family which includes my grandparents, my sister, wonderful aunts and some distant cousins. I call it The Montage Of Memories.

And as Michael J. Fox rightly said, “ Family is not important, It's everything.”

I tried to source the photos from many places but mostly found them on the dusty shelves back home. Those decade-old albums with evocative photos, resulted in a stirring collage. And for the first time since I’d left home, I was at peace.

Check out some really cool ways for the same. Also scores high as a captivating Home Decor option.

1) Why not DIY?

Okay, these dont look easy but unlike all classics, they actually are. Their distinct charm and resonance is quite evident from a distance. Give them a shot.

Source Source

Source Source Source

2) The Fam Frame

True elegance is in keeping things simple. Framed photos offer distinct cohesion, the final result stands apart as it imparts a serene ambience to the entire home decor.

Source Source

3) The Family Tree

These have been in the circuit for quite some time now. Within a matter of days, family trees have become an iconic style statement that may embellish the sour, dusty walls of your apartment into a sumptuous, charismatic masterpiece.

Source Source

Source

Source Source

Source

4) Abstraction

 

Unconventional, perhaps a tad bit eccentric, but is ranked amongst the most creative methods of them all. The most flexible and exciting, it definitely pays-off in the end as you play around a bit.

Source Source

Source Source

Many a times, when I’m lost for hours, recalling my favourite memories, I feel like the heavens have showered me with blessings that many of us only dream of. This token of love is a privilege, for the ones who always stood by me and cared for me.
title: Montage Of Memories: A Photo Story

subtitle: Go forth with these fancy appliances or maybe a stylish makeover.
description:
One should be less enchanted with the trends and more so with the choices. As the house is probably the most important piece of property, it should not be tainted with wrong choices.

Most of the contemporary devices draw a complete blank on the aesthetics and visual appeal. The smoothness of vintage appliances, the crisp strokes and their seamless continuity, that is so indistinguishable with pieces of art has become a rarity these days.

In my opinion, the 21st century is all about consumerism and monetary benefits, rather than art appreciation and the innate beauty. People are bonkers for cutting edge technology and latest gadgets. They've stopped embracing TVs, VCRs, speakers and fridges as pieces of art but only just as machines that perform a number of functions.

Cheers to that, but I feel that a machine could be much more just a tool. In my quest for alluring appliances, I've come accross a good number of gorgeous devices and DIYs for an impressive makeover. Check them out.

1) German Horn Speakers 

These Deep Bass Boosters are an exotic commodity. Flawless sound that excites the soul and charms the mood with every audible note.  

Source Source

2) The Philco PC: Inspired by 1950’s

This exquisite personal computer is a comprehensive mix of modern minimalism and steampunk. A stimulating design that can hardly be ignored. Moreover, the funky and charismatic colours impart the necessary sheen. 

Source

3) DIY - Refrigerator

Scintillating, classy and straightforward. This is a simple project for embellishing the refrigerators. Just select the wallpaper, press roll it, and you’re done. Or maybe mount a chalkboard on the refrigerator. User discretion is recommended.


Source Source Source

4) Lamps

The perfect choice to project your house as an inspiring place of residence. Creative light-bulbs serve the dual purpose of sophisticated illumination and voguish ambience. So much better than those standard and uninviting LED’s.

I have fond memories of this thing. These babies rake up a lot of attention and have a charismatic feel. It boasts of an impeccable sound quality with negligible maintenance, and only the cleaning part is a bit complicated.

These vintage screens single-handedly overwhelm the modern TVs. Admire the appeareances, the free-flowing aesthetics and sophisticated design. So much better than those ugly flatscreens. 


Source

7) Vintage Pin Gold CameraSource

subtitle: Ways to Keep your House Cool, minus the AC.
description:
The world around us is changing fast. I’m sure that most of us could relate with the drastic changes in weather and the unpredictable climate, the harshest of droughts and the fiercest of floods, and connect these dots to global warming. Things were so much different and ecologically stable a couple of decades ago. The suffocating summer heat for the greater part of the calendar, and the continuous air conditioning has left a big hole in the ozone.

I don't want to frighten anybody but the truth is that we are polluting the biosphere and slowly treading towards the end of the world, and we are ones responsible for it. It's time to stop.

The twin benefits of cutting back on AC (by designing an energy-efficient) and eco-sensitive home is an excellent present-day proposition. As the best way to avoid the summer heat is by blocking the sun rays from ever reaching the windows, a flawless shading system occupies a pivotal role in this. 

Source Source Source

The impact is considerable with around 30-60% of the heat mamthe windows. Turn off that cash-guzzling and energy-hogging AC units. Cutting-back on the AC can yield an estimated reduction of about 20% in the utility billings.

1) Mounting Shades/ Overhangs - Proper installment is the key with this tightly sealed shade that minimizes both the heat gained and lost. Shades with dual colors( light and dark ) add more functionality.


Source Source


Source Source

2) Blinds - Both interior and exterior blinds are capable of reducing the solar heat gained by as much as 50%. Attributes such as light exposure, ventilation and the desired privacy are easily manageable.


Source Source Source


Source Source Source

3) Drapes - Elegant and graceful, these classy drapes are a great way to mitigate the sun’s  hot rays. Also, easily maintain the soft natural daylight that is so essential for a relaxing indoor ambience.


Source Source Source


Source Source


Source Source

4) Reflective Film - High quality reflective films offer UV protection and minimal solar heat radiation. Check out some really cool and funky ways for the same. Dazzle the eyes with a majestic combination of vibrant colours and charismatic lighting.


Source Source


Source Source

5) Curtains - The most common method, curtains made out of natural fabrics, coupled with ceiling and/or table fans are very effective during the dry summer months. Exterior shades work wonders and a perhaps a tip; Place a table fan on the floor, tilt it up slightly and aim for the shades. This creates a difference of at least 10 degrees between the outside and the insides of the house. You have to try this hack out.


Source Source Source


Source


Source


Source


Source Source


Source

6) Bamboo Screens - Very inexpensive, natural bamboo screens block a good portion of sun's rays without completely sacrificing on the natural light. Cover the west-facing windows with bamboo shades on the exterior and this another brilliant hack. Many would testify the same.


Source Source Source

Moreover, automated retractable screens are another great option for cooling. Also, try the smart shutters that remain shut during the day and open up only during the nights and early mornings.

Source Source


Source Source Source

Work the interiors:

1) Research studies support the considerable cooling effect that plants can have in the house. The shade and the very clean air is very rejuvenating, better than any artificial shading method, Ever.

Source Source Source


Source


Source

2) Another great method to move on from the AC, work with the ventilation and let your house breathe. Ceiling fans are great for cooling, especially in highly humid conditions.

Source Source Source

Source

1) An old trick is to sprinkle some baby powder or talcum powder on the lined before going to bed. An effective absorbent, you’ll feel fresh and cool during the night.

2) Turn off the major appliances during the day. Directly affects the house ambience as bulky electronics such as Refrigerators radiate a lot of heat.

3) Stay hydrated during the course of the day as fluids, especially water assists in regulating the body temperature and keeping it cool.

Tell us: How do you tackle the summer sun?
title: Out of the sun and into the frying Pan: Ways to Keep your House Cool, minus the AC.

subtitle: Essential Herbs a sophisticated lifestyle.
description:
Thyme: The Quintessential Herb

In vogue since the middle ages, no herb garden is really complete without thyme and is a regular  occurring to large parts of Eurasia. With more than 60 varieties, the herb thrives in rocky and sandy soils, although the bushes necessitate a sound drainage system with ample of sunlight, ideal for the Indian conditions.

Source


Source Source Source

Thyme occupies a pivotal position in the French and Greek cultures and is widely used in the Indian, Spanish, Italian, Greek, French and even the Turkish cuisines. The most common varieties are the Garden, the Orange and the Lemon (strong aroma) Thyme.

Source Source Source

Thyme indeed is a landscape plant with endless ornamental possibilities. Plant a bush in your garden and let it shimmer under the morning sun. Or maybe hang it from your ceiling and breathe in the steady aroma.

Source Source

Source Source Source

Thyme is relatively easy to grow and is virtually free of pests and disease, though the occasional greenfly tends to take it’s toll on this emblem of French Republicanism. Apart from the usual tossing, sauteing, stewing and poaching,  it is a multi-purpose herb accepted widely as an antiseptic, that fights against infections and is an excellent source of fibre. It just is so mesmerizingly tasty, the grilled salmon with butter sauce and thyme is one of my all time-favourites.

Source

Source Source

A significant ingredient whilst preparing exquisite meats and veggies as well as marinades, its strong, pungent flavour is of the essence (fresh and dry ) in the preparation of Spiced Roast Salmon, Thyme and Garlic Chicken, Grilled Chicken Breasts with Lemon and Thyme, and Thyme Au Gratin Potatoes and many more.
title: Thyme: The Quintessential Herb for an Elegant Garden

description:

subtitle: Celeb Interior Designers with a charming finesse
description:

Soaring sky-high under her mother's ambitious wings and an esteemed label, her every home decor product emanates an aura that goes beyond the imagination and radiates a feeling of exclusivity and euphoria. subtitle: Essentials for that perfect Baby Nursery
description:

The Mother, pious to her duties usually find herself on the edge as many of them are dead-worried due to the sheer herculean responsibilities of nursing the young ones.

subtitle: It's time to jazz up ladies! These majestic and plush vanity rooms are going to blow your mind away.

subtitle: Vaastu principles for wealth and the general well-being.
description:
Vaastu Shastra, like any other branch of sciences is based upon sound principles of logical reasoning. The tremendous respect that Vaastu necessitates especially amongst the ladies, is very much evident from the long-list of experts it boasts of, second only to the all time favourite Cricket.

It literally translates into ‘science of architecture’  and its basics are marked by a clutter free home, essential for the unbounded prosperity and an abundance of well-being.

Though most of the attributes focus upon remodeling or starting from the scratch whilst building a home, some interior decor methods can be put to use for proper implementation of Vaastu Shastra. The harbinger of wealth and general contentment, one that transforms your House into a Home.

1) House Entry

Vaastu begins right from the entry. High quality wood with an impressive decor should be employed for the main entrance door. The entry should be facing the Northeast and the width has to be more than every other door.


Source


Source


Source

2) Vaastu Plants

Plants occupy a special place in Vaastu and their rules vary as we move from the indoors to the outdoors. Plants in the Northeast corner of the house should be avoided and there should be none whatsoever against the North and East walls.

Growing of lemon, lotus and jasmine are considered lucky inside the house. Bonsais, Flowers with red petals, cactus and other thorny plants are a strictly prohibited in the house.

Tulsi is considered extremely auspicious in Vaastu. This plant should be placed in the North, East or the Northeast direction. It is known for bringing prosperity as well as for its many useful medicinal properties.


Source Source


Source

Money plant is acclaimed for generating immense wealth and is the only plant that can be placed in the bedroom.


Source Source


Source

Lucky Bamboo is said to bestow enormous monetary benefits and is also a good luck charm. Moreover, as per Vaastu, different stalks have different meanings.
For example 3 stalks represent happiness whereas a plant with 5 is synonymous with health.


Source Source Source

3) Colour Schemes

Dark coloured walls should be avoided, especially those in black and blue paints.  
Focussing separately on different house sections -  
Bedroom - Pink is best suited for them. Light shades of blue and green are also recommended.


Source


Source


Source

http://www.bestastrologer.asia/bedroom-vaastu.html
http://www.vaastu-numerology.com/94-Vastu-Tips-For-Couples-Bedroom#.VgowXMuqqko
http://architectureideas.info/2008/11/vastu-shastra-guidelines-bedrooms/

Living Room - Pleasant colours such as Yellow, Blue, Green and Beige are perfect as these facilitate a lively ambience and a promising aura for the guests.


Source


Source

Bathroom - A combination of white and black or white and grey are perfect for the Baths. Subtle and soothing colours come highly recommended, such as the ones in the photos. 


Source


Source

4) Paintings

Fighting scenes from epics of Mahabharata and Ramayana as well as nude portraits are strictly prohibited. Aggressive and abstract paintings with conflicting colours that depict scary instances especially those of animals, beasts and birds must also be avoided.

Instead you could settle on symbols, sculptures and paintings of rangoli, Om, swastika. tortoise, galloping horses, subtle and abstract colours and the prestigious Sun God Ganesha.


Source Source

Source


Source


Source


Source


Source


Source Source

5) Home Mandir

Mandir or the altar is the King of all Vaastu rules and should be placed in the Northeast section of the house. Also, face the East while praying and God shall shower his blessings upon you.


Source Source


Source Source Source


Source Source

6) Kitchen is the symbol of prosperity and should be ideally placed in the Southeast corner of the house. Green and white are considered as the ideal colours for kitchen apart from shades of yellow and orange.

The gas burner must be placed in the Southeast and it should never be placed opposite to the kitchen entry. The wash-basin or sink in the Northeast along with the water pitchers. Essential grains must be stored in the South or West while the dining area should face towards the North or West direction.


Source


Source


Source Source

The fundamentals of Vaastu ensure a clutter free, smooth working area. You may hang three bronze bowls upside down from the ceiling as a good luck charm. Mop the floors twice every week with sea salt water and get rid of the negative energy in your house.


Source Source Source


Source
title: Vaastu Shastra: 6 Ways to Happiness & Prosperity

subtitle: Natural incense is derived from (or based upon) the following elements: fruits, water, flowers, leaves and roots. Take a look at some gorgeous incense sticks and burners as well as scented candles. Leap forth and feel the freshness!
description:
Incense: That Purifying Aroma!

Incense is deeply rooted in the Ayurvedic principles of spiritual healing and meditation.A tradition since ancient times, the Vedas have sanctified it for the pleasant fragrance it emanates and also the soothing calm that eliminates negativity from the surroundings. A cultural delight that is akin to the lighting of candles, wherein the continuous combustion of scented wax with the endless flicker of the wick induces a beautiful tranquility, that is so rarely facilitated by any modern-day commodity.

Composure for the reckless and amusement for the refined senses, burning of Incense and scented candles has been a customary privilege for this country. From the ghats of Benaras to the stone-cut Shiva temples of the peninsula, Incense has been the norm. Whether it be the secluded and gorgeous mountain valleys of the Northeast or the Kathiawad dunes of the western provinces, the intense aroma is a bliss for many amongst us.

Natural incense is derived from (or based upon) the following elements: fruits, water, flowers, leaves and roots. Take a look at some gorgeous incense sticks and burners as well as scented candles. Leap forth and feel the freshness!

subtitle: 10 Insane and wacky hacks for a brilliant and uncluttered home.
description:
Decluttering is all about making room for the things that matter, having more space for yourself from the endless jargon of avoidable things. We don’t realize the potential of decluttering and many of us even shy away from it. It's hard admitting to the fact that you might be in dire need of it, although we all would agree that uncluttered areas look simply stunning. As a quick thumb rule, only the most common items of usage should be on display and do not overflow any drawers with too much of stuff in them. Proper utilization of the space is an important aspect for maximizing the area. 

 

Take a look at some insane and wacky hacks for uncluttered homes. Also featuring the Oprah Winfrey Experiment.

 

The Oprah Winfrey Closet Hanger Experiment. Although this wasn't one of her original ideas, but Oprah really got it into the mainstream with a lot of notoriety. It begins with the most difficult question of all, identifying wardrobe pieces that should be cleared out. First, hang all your clothes with the hangers in the reverse direction. Once you are done with wearing an item, put it back in the closet, but this time it should face the correct direction. In about six months time, you’ll have a clear picture of the clothes you don't wear and should be discarded. The experiment may tweaked a little and applied to a number of clutter areas in your home (cleaners, toys, linens, tools, craft items etc).

subtitle: Explore the Moroccan design & decor culture!
description:
One of the most exotic and influential culture centres, adorned by the magnificent souks (marketplaces) famed for its myriad of savoury smells, the many riads (houses) boasting of picturesque gardens with imposing courtyards and the age-old streets with a mesmerising decor that leave you speechless. All of this and perhaps a lot more, and I won't ask for even a dime from anybody. Morocco, simply superb!

A soothing cacophony of textures, colors, different shapes and many sizes is delectable from the celebrated street cuisine and at the same time, is again visible in its exquisite decor and design. The captivating ambience of the humble and vivid flea shops offering locally crafted decor items, with the mint-tea cafe’s and the sumptuous Tagine (beef/chicken curry) cart vendors define the cornerstone of this place and is sight that I yearn for, each and everyday. 

Speaking about the decor culture, its prolonged history with numerous contrasting influences have entrenched themselves deeply amongst the many walks of Moroccan life, culminating a flavourful palate for almost everything this place has to offer. 

Things that stand out for Marrakech Decor

  1. Design and Print

  2. Colours and patterns

  3. Textures and Shapes

The dazzling patterns and charismatic details with lots of multiples in textures and shapes, the heavenly riads have got no match in terms of the grandeur and the bedazzling home decor choices. The brave pairing of colors, the mix of curves and straight lines with metal against wood and the opulence of textiles with beads, every house would simply just pop-out and come alive with such delicate notions of the Marrakech culture. Try these out for a perfect Culture Connect!

subtitle: Celebrate this festive season with Pandal Hopping.
description:
There must over thousands of pandals within the NCR-region only. Though in all honesty, not every one of them is worth hopping to, so to speak! And the ones that should be visited are crammed up with happy faces that often end up stepping on your feet amongst all the commotion, unintentionally of course! The festival commemorates the slaying of the demon king by Durga Mata, marking the triumph of good over evil. Considering my staunch atheism, I do not wish to comment on that. But in every respect, the enthusiastic merry-making and the lively ambience, the sumptuous food with its ensuing happiness, the genuine warmth within every greet from the known as well as the unknown, the intense excitement in the hearts of especially the pretty youth that are waiting to dazzle the audience with their performances, the awe-inspired audience with all the beautiful lights and decor and many, many other things culminate into one of the most awaited festivals in this country.

Feast your eyes!

Priests performing a ceremony during the Durga Puja.

Source

Goddess Durga

Source Source

Dhunuchi Nritya: The frenzied Incense dance!

Source Source

The Enchanting Pandals!

The Pandals are the major centre of attraction, a temporary pavilion that serves as the place of worship wherein all the ceremonies and rituals take place. Check out its magnificence and blazing ambience, the sundry decor crafts and intoxicating lights! Most of the humongous Pandals are the artwork of experts roped in especially from Kolkata.

Plus, most of the well-known pandals are going green. Minimal use of thermocol and metal and preference towards eco friendly materials such as hay, clay pots, jute, etc. Free Wifi is another highlight for this year.

Best crowd pullers:

  • Kashmiri Gate

The Resplendent Food!

It's a gastronomic frenzy. Food stalls, Lots and lots of food stalls that satisfy almost every palate. From Chowringhee Kathi rolls to fish fry and fish chops, mediterranean delicacies to Italian pastas, phuchka, jhaal moori etcetera. There is biryani to be gorged on, rolls to be gobbled and chaat to be demolished. Ask anybody about it, every pujo regular would testify to the fact that Food is one of the most significant part of the entire festive experience. Slurp away!

The Vermillion Saga

Married women participate enthusiastically in the sindoor (vermillion powder) ceremony at the end of the Durga Puja festival. There’s dancing, laughing, celebration and lots of playing with vermillion. The ceremony is a farewell ritual where women wish for each other's happiness and it precedes the immersion of idol of Durga in the river….

subtitle: For quite a long time, shades of gold were discarded as old-fashioned and blase, and it had been tucked away into the sidelines.
description:
Go for Gold: 7 Ways for a Glittering Home Decor!

For quite a long time, shades of gold were discarded as old-fashioned and blase, and it had been tucked away into the sidelines. New and cooler aesthetics such as chrome, nickel and platinum dominated the modern interiors industry since then. But now, it's back with a bang with many new takers from different industries. From fashion to jewelry, and home décor to electronics, the timeless shade of wealth and luxury has reincarnated itself with an ever more pronounced following. Remember the iPhone’s Rose Gold cover with it’s seductive appeal, especially amongst the ladies! That was just the tip of the iceberg.

Gold home decor exhibits a very rich and upper-class exclusivity. Its royal elegance and glamour is not easily substituted by any other. A brilliant combination of white, gold and wood is simply superb! If you favour metallic hues, keep larger pieces like the sofa or the rug neutral. A simple palette makes for a sleek foundation so that the accessories can pop-out with more zing!

Tips: Mustard yellow looks awesome with gold. Deep chocolate brown is another great way to balance out those golden tones. Moreover, it is better to add hints and touches of gold to your home. One way is to impart subtle accents into your space, either through the finishes (a door handle or table leg) or through an accessory (such as a mirror or accent piece). Give it a golden shot!

1) Faucets

subtitle: Imagine a bathroom basking in the glorious shades of green and blue for an undisturbed tranquility.
description:
Jade, a symbol of energy and beauty has a long history in arts and culture, one that has encompassed the massive Chinese Empires of the past. The best part about Jade is the culmination of traditional and modern aesthetics with its greasy sheen, in a particularly harmonious way. Moreover, it is useful in gemstone therapy due to its balancing effects upon the mental agility. Believe it or not, it even stimulates creativity in a melodious manner!

Now imagine a bathroom, carved out of the gemstone itself, basking in the glorious shades of green and blue whilst purveying an aura of perhaps, a bygone-era. Jade is renowned for its peaceful and undisturbed tranquility, as if the nature’s lap has invited you for a blissful bath that you may never be able to forget!

subtitle: Build a home gym for yourself with these simple steps.
description:
Its great fun to work out with a group of people at the gym. Seeing them working hard and getting rid of that accumulated Olive oil is indeed inspiring. The place reeks of adrenaline and usually is bustling with a lot of sweaty folks. But for the ones with a lot of self motivation, the fitness-frenzies, a home gym is the the perfect choice for staying at the top of their game. And guess what, it's ridiculously easy and cheap as well!

First things first, cover the floor. This part is very important as a resolute grip on the mat helps with the workout. It does wonders when you’re giving it all, when you’re going that extra mile. Try working out at the sometime, barefooted at the gym and you’ll get a fair idea of what I’m trying to say here!

Next, source the necessary equipments such as Dumbbells, Kettlebells, Stall Bars, Rubber Matt, Rings, Skipping Rope, pair of sturdy shoes with a great foothold and those extra-grip gloves. The last two things are very important, believe me, cause you wouldn't wanna injure yourself!

The stairs lead to another dimension. Climb up, or you may try the wall!

subtitle: Tips for nailing that seemingly complicated arrangements of different kinds of patterns!
description:
Introducing you all to the elusive world of patterns and designs. Distinguish your rooms with sets of different patterns, or just one of them. Whichever one does the trick for you! I have featured five types (floral, plaids, paisley, meander and tribal) of patterns today, and many more shall follow soon. Plus, some tips for nailing those complicated pairings of starky contrasting pattern designs has been included. Take a look.

First things first, colourful wallpapers and throw cushions are going to be powerful allies in this task. Secondly, odd numbers tend to look the best, so if you’re going to play with patterns, start with three different ones, that too, with three different scales. Let's take an example, one large floral pattern, with a medium chevron(geometric), and lastly one small meander pattern.

Special Tip: Large pattern works best on a big items, such as a wall, a window treatment or a rug. Its because of the fact that there is ample of space so as to accommodate the large pattern designs wholly. Subsequently, a medium pattern is better suited to furnitures and the small pattern to accent pieces. Simple as that.
Well, what are you waiting for, Get to Work!

subtitle: Create the perfect fall decor with accents like Mustard, Orange, Grey and Pale Pink!
description:
Easily identified by the crispy rustle of hundreds of leaves, in shades of yellow to orange with the smell of scented lavender candles that are a favourite of my lovely sister. I just the love this time of the year, when the air is brisk with the many invigorating smells that just automatically set the mood and lift up the dead spirits, no matter how bad a day I’ve had. Those comfortably lazy Sundays, spent with my favourite book and a cup of coffee and the occasional wind that drifts every lifeless thing, making room for the new-ones! Ah, just so lovely and rejuvenating!

If we talk about the colours that so easily represent Autumn, starting with my own favourite Melon, Mustard and others such as Grey, Olive, Camel, Orange, Pale Pink make it to the list. Similar to accents, the scents are also always fluctuating, from lighter and clean to the richer, woodsy. Take a look at some of the brilliantly Frugal Home Decor Ideas for this Fall.

subtitle: Amaze your loved ones with the most beautiful Diwali Gifts!
description:
As Diwali draws near with its beautiful myriad of festivities and the exchange of gifts, those visits by friends, distant relatives that you perhaps have not seen for a long-long time and the unexpected loud bursts of crackers that leaves everybody shaking and shivering become a daily affair. But it’s also filled with many surprises. Talk about surprises,my dear brother has been living overseas for a couple of years now and he did something that astonished almost everybody within our gated community. All with the power of the internet!

After surfing for hours, he found the perfect king-sized bed for Mummy-Daddy and got it delivered over last Sunday Evening. I was amazed with his planning as I kept standing there baffled, and those logistics guys shifted the new bed indoors within minutes. A bit of commotion ensued as there was no space left to adjust the old bed, but we managed to discard it away to one of our maid’s relatives that live a couple of kilometers away. Once that was done, Dad rang up my brother and with a wisp of acceptance and that longing, kindred lovely voice of his, He said - “Happy Diwali”. Perhaps some tears trickled down my brothers face, thousands of miles apart but Daddy was certainly bursting with sentiments. And Mom was soo Happy, she even invited those friends over that she had a fight with last year. I got really pumped up and decided that I’ll do something like this pretty soon. Maybe next year. As big-brother had stolen all of this year's limelight.

Quite a Surprise, Eh!

The point being, why don't we all do something on similar lines for our own folks, Our own People. It might be a bit late for now, but then again, That’s what makes a true unexpected surprise and the world, A Happier Place!!!

Take a look at some gorgeous gift ideas for your loved ones. I’ve tried to include a lot of love into this listicle. Go crazy with these thoughts.

subtitle: Shades of 'Rich Red' add warmth and work up the comfy levels in Winters!!!
description:
It's approaching us fast and it is going to be harsh. Yes, we are talking about the Delhi winter!
Thinking of the cold weather and many of its colours, the first ones that pop in our mind are, White and the Cool Blues. These crispy-cool colours serve to impart a cool vibe to a room and is known for literally lowering down the temperature, and warm colours do quite the opposite! Shades and accents of chocolate browns, rich reds, deep oranges, strong greens and even mustard yellows are powerful sources of adding warmth. These warmer tones also alter the ambience, making it cozier and much more relaxed! Couple the accents with natural elements such as wood furniture and comfy rugs that help in radiating heat in the winters. The following listicle has some ideas that incorporate the rich red accents. Get inspired and deck up your homes as Winters are coming!!!

subtitle: Explore this newest, Quirky trend of dye-dipped paintings!!!
description:
In what started as the staging of paintings, dipped and ruined with paint has now turned into the newest-trend to watch out for. It all happened at an unknown Manhattan basement, as Oliver Jeffers destroyed paintings after paintings and then offered the witnesses a Drink. It is possible that a lot of people have started appreciating this unconventional work. The artist is mostly famous for whimsical illustrations and music collaboration with U2 and this is perhaps the best of them all. The paintings seem a little sinister but are indeed reflective of grandeur and magnificence. It might be a big rage or it might not, It’s too early to tell. Not everybody is able to grasp the genius in them!

Would you dip-dye a painting? Or is that going one DIY step too far? I’d try on one and see how it looks!

subtitle: Welcome the cold chilly winters with a combination of Textures, of varying degrees. Make use of natural materials like leather, fur and natural textiles
description:
Welcome the cold chilly winters with a combination of Textures, of varying degrees. Make use of natural materials like leather, fur and natural textiles (linen, cotton, hemp). These just not only bring visual warmth and a luxurious look to the space, but more importantly add a lot of comfort! To get the best experience , Mix it up and layer the natural textures. Think cowhide rug, large knitted cushions, sheepskins, and luscious throws. Most importantly, plants add color, offer texture and clean your air, making your home a little bit healthier. Those little green air purifies are a great way to bring interest to your space without making it feel too cluttered. One of the most prominent method to add textures is to use different shades of the same color. Colour palettes help with the transition and the neutral color palette seldom appear cold with all those complementary color accents.

1) Rugs and Carpets

The Neutral color palette with the grey/brown color accents looks fabulous.
